Reviews.Title: “Trendy vibe. Great view of lake Michigan”
Reviews.Author: Maurdunn
Reviews.Content: 4 blocks walk to Michigan Ave shops. Usual W decor and feel. Rooms comfy and quiet considering how busy the hotel is. Both rooftop and lobby bars always packed. Fitness and pool very nice. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, so-so rooms”
Reviews.Author: mandalaypokerplayer
Reviews.Content: I would prefer to give this hotel 3.5 stars to be fair...as it fell solidly between a 3 star/4 star place to stay. That said, let me start by saying that I am also basing this review on value. W hotels are supposedly the chic, upscale Starwood brand (more hipster, less expensive than the St. Regis). This hotel had a fun clientele, and a buzzy downstairs, but the rooms were kind of awful. The bathroom was dated. I am sure it was cute in 1980 (or whenever it was built) to have the peek a boo bathroom, but it just feels tired and looks even worse. It's no more luxurious than a Holiday Inn. The bed was fine (not sure if it was the Heavenly Bed), but it was just a very basic room (with a good view if you go high enough). For some reason, they put a very shaggy/hairy cube on the bed spread. I am not sure what one is supposed to do with this cube as it provides no function and it is full of dust. The whole room felt like it was stuck in another time period. On a much better note, the staff was top-drawer. Very pleasant overall and they will run up a coffee maker to your room with a smile. Not sure I would stay here again unless it is a great price.

Reviews.Title: “"Whatever Whenever"' that is their mantra.Trendy,cool fun place to stay.The W is always a happening place”
Reviews.Author: Debbie W
Reviews.Content: I love the W hotels.The lobby is such a happening place.The bar is fun, the furniture is interesting, the hotel is very trendy, very clean and very comfortable. Lots of people on the weekend, it turns into a club type bar scene. Rooms are perfect, beds are heavenly. The restaurant is really good too, convenient and very tasty. It's a 5 minute walk to Michigan avenue, great shopping. Wonderful getaway location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but over priced”
Reviews.Author: chiblk350z
Reviews.Content: Visited this for a valentine treat, enjoyed the layout average room, but done up in such a way to make it enjoyable, Bedroom seperated from bathroom and shower by a wall cut in half with shuttered dutch doors which can be lefted open for viewing of an individual in the glassed shower stall (kinky huh). Nice large king size bed, but don't touch the very expensive treats(double pack of Oreos 8cookies $12 Planters peanuts$8). No ammenties of any kind but a free USA Today paper, parking in the area$$55 a night. Room was priced at $300 a night and the view was of high rise parking lot and other roof tops.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: dabax
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the W for my 46th birthday in Sept 2011 and spent the 4th of July 2010 with wife and three daughters. We loved the location. Waking up to a scenic view of Lake Michigan and the Navy Pier every day was awesome. Being able to walk to the Magnificent Mile to eat and shop was very convenient. Service from the staff was ok. The front counter personnel never really impressed me to be sincerely interested in ensuring that my family and I enjoyed our stay. On the other hand, the staff that provided room service were very friendly and took care of all of our personal requests. The workout facility was adequate. Indoor pool was awesome. We really enjoyed our 4th of July stay as we had front row seats to the annual fireworks display on the river. The experience for my girls was priceless.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Rayrachz
Reviews.Content: Overall my stay was good. The hotel is clean. I love the smell of the W fragrance! Location is good walking distance to all shopping and restaurants. The concierge staff is very helpful! I would recommend this hotel. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “NOT WORTH THE $$$”
Reviews.Author: gcm1106
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here because I got a pretty good priceline deal; however when I showed up they said they only had double beds and ofcourse that was not going to work out for my boyfriend and I because it was Valentines Day. (wink-wink) So I had to pay $100 extra for a king bed; I def felt like we got cheated out...anyways we wanted to spend a nice time on this special day so we coughed up the $$$. First time staying at the W so we were expecting something with a "WoW" factor but we just got a loud/small room and we some decent furniture. The view was nice...got to see the frozen lake and Navy Pier. The only good part was that we got some Bliss mini shampoos/conditioner in the bathroom. Anyways skip this place and spend your $$$ elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: PrincessBeach
Reviews.Content: My mother and I went to the W Chicago for the USC football game. We stayed for three days and two nights. We had very good service. The room was on the small side compared to the Westin (thatâ€™s where my mother stayed for the game 2 years ago). The bathrooms are very open to the room, only shutters between the bathroom and room. This wasnâ€™t a big deal because I was with my mother but if it was a different situation I would not be as comfortable. We only had one complaint and that was the room service took over an hour late night! We got home from the football game, itâ€™s a 2 hour drive back so we didnâ€™t get back until almost one and we were starving. It took so long that I was asleep by the time we got food, that was the only bad part of our stay. I do think this was an anomaly. We had lovely service from everyone there and the hotel is walking distance to lots of restaurants and great shopping! I look forward to returning in two years. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: ndnurse53
Reviews.Content: Great, modern hotel. Nice touch to have free coffee, paper and a place to read in lobby. Only odd thing is a pocket door to bathroom and a shuttered window, less privacy. Staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with family with young kids”
Reviews.Author: Spillicus
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here as a family with a 2 year old and a 4 year old. The location was good, only about 5 or 10 minutes walk from Michigan Ave, and right next to Navy Pier. The Acura shuttle was a nice service, they took us to Shedd Aquarium, strollers and all, free of charge. That saved 1 way's cab fare, and we decided to walk along the lake shore on the return trip (took about 45 minutes). The rooms were nice and well maintained, and beds were comfortable. They're not huge rooms, but fine for a big city and big enough for us. There is a shutter between the room and bathroom (Westin Ft Lauderdale Beach Resort is the same way), which I guess bothers some people but I thought was fine. It does allow more noise out of the bathroom than normal, and I'm sure some people find that awkward, but with my kids there's no such thing as privacy anyway. The staff was friendly and promptly accomodated my requests. My only issue was I requested a few things via the W Hotels iPhone App, and after waiting an hour didn't recieve anything. I talked to the front desk and had my requested items in under 5 minutes, so probably the app isn't ironed out yet, not a hotel problem. It's a nice hotel, and seems to have a very trendy, party kind of atmosphere at the lobby bar, but everybody was nice to our kids and made us feel welcome, I"d definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: happylove333
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at W Lakeshore, Chicago. Room was nice, view of the Lake and Navy Pier was awesome. Was originally put in a room by the elevator and it was very loud. There was no problem at all in switching rooms. Beds were very comfortable. They have a great, cool-looking bar. Courtesy car to take us to dinner was convenient (no return ride is available though). It's obviously sponsored by Acura because they run an Acura commercial while you are riding and have a Acura questionnaire for you to complete. It saved us a taxi fare though! And to be honest, I would now consider Acura when we are ready to purchase a new car...loved the car! Cookies and hot apple cider in lobby were a nice touch. All staff were kind, courteous and helpful. My only reasons for "very good" vs "excellent" are: 1) They have a "window" with shutters that opens up from the bedroom to the bathroom and a sliding door to the bathroom. It is a nice touch that helps to open up the room more. However, it does limit your bathroom privacy because they don't shut tight and you can easily hear any sound coming from the bathroom and the bed is right on the other side of the shutter. If I was sharing a room with a non-family member, especially if sharing with a business associate, it might be a bit awkward. 2) The comforters on the beds are not inviting. They are a thin, rough material that do not offer warmth or a cozy feel. Overall it was a great experience and there is nothing that would prevent me from staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location meets superior service”
Reviews.Author: WIPam
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at a W hotel. Our party of 6 loved the convenient location...how great to be able to walk out the hotel door and be at Navy Pier in 5 minutes. Amazing restaurants and shopping venues were within walking distance and Union Station was just a $10 cab ride away. The hotel itself is fun and upbeat. We loved the rooms overlooking the lake...a sense of calm in the frenetic city. Rooms are small but make great use of the space. The products, robes, bedding and Tv/audio systems are of superior quality. We had cocktails and food service in Whiskey Sky and the lobby restaurant...everything was delicious and the service was prompt and friendly. And the service is amazing! The concierge staff is available from early (7am!) until late evening. They were so helpful in finding great dining and nearby pastry shop for an amazing birthday cake. Showing the concierge business card brought us special attention as we tried to order from an Indian menu that was unfamiliar to many of us. Wow, what a spectacular meal! (Check out the review under restaurants; Indian Garden.) We hope to return to W soon.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and trendy”
Reviews.Author: Derek1005
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here and enjoyed our stay. We stayed in a Spectacular room, which has a view of the lake. i believe the wonderful room (one step down) do not have the lake view. The room was quiet, the bed was a little too soft for our liking and the decor was updated. The hotel hallways, elevator and pool area was a little unkept. Other than that our room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “The staff makes this a 5”
Reviews.Author: Jay S
Reviews.Content: Location is great - especially if you want to take the family to Navy Pier (or the beach in summer). Rooms are typical 'W'. The opening between the bathroom and sleeping area is a combo of 'chic' and slightly odd. Views are great. Parking is expensive, but it is Chicago. Pool is great. Has a deep end and was warm - even in February. Kids voted it their favorite hotel pool in Chicago (and we've done almost all of them). All around great hotel. The difference maker here is the staff. Everyone that I have dealt with in my multiple stays has been friendly and helpful. I would put the staff close to the Ritz or Peninsula, but the W is a fraction of the cost. If there were a measure for "service/dollar", this hotel would be tops in Chicago. I don't know how others reviewers could have had issue with the staff - I think it's more an indication of them, not the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: NYCGirl130
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel over New Years. The hotel is up to the "W" standards. The room was small, but modern and comfortable. The bathroom does not offer a lot of privacy. The hotel lobby bar and the bar on a higher floor, Whiskey Sky were both great for getting drinks. Nice lake views and views of Navy Pier. Close walk to Magnificent Mile. The room gets very dark with room darkening curtains, good for anyone trying to sleep in! Be careful when settling your bill before checking out, they charged us for parking, and we didn't even have a car! They were quick to take it off, so it was not a problem. Overall service was friendly, and the hotel was clean, and modern. I would not recommend this hotel for anyone traveling with young kids. Also, rooms near the Whiskey Bar can be loud with the music from the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: whitt1travels
Reviews.Content: Came here for business in early February. Staff was real nice and accommodating. Rooms for business receptions were nice but small for our group size. Got very loud. Food served at functions was good. Nice selection offered for non-meat eaters. Wave restaurant on the first floor was great. Choose the large plate options to share at dinner. The truffle French fries are amazing! I'd go back just for those! Everything we tried was amazing: shrimp, chorizo and fingerling potatoes with chimichirri sauce, mushroom ravioli, scallops with risotto. Small plates we tried we the calamari (wow) and blue crab cakes (actually about golf ball size). Rooms were nice, Bliss amenities were nice. Only issue was that you could hear everything happening around you. From your neighbor flushing the toilet to the construction workers across the street. Still, it was a good experience all in all.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel, wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: sequoiasnowflake
Reviews.Content: The W is not typically our first choice, especially since we travel with our three-year-old son and W doesn't really fall into the "family-friendly" classification. The W line also is typically modern and trendy - we're more old-world romantic, and not usually dressed like we're heading for a photo-shoot. We recently stayed at the W Chicago Lakeshore on a business trip for my husband/vacation, and we can say that this W is still modern and trendy, but very comfortable and a place we'd most certainly stay again. The hotel staff was amazing and never once did anyone make us feel awkward about having our son with us - they actually helped very often with making traveling with him a little easier (a few names that we collected that were exceptionally helpful: Nicholas Baes, Amy Miller, Robert Shumate, Ashley Sarpong). Our room was a great size, nice view of the city, quiet, clean ... only complaint would be the lack of soundproofing/privacy with the bathroom. Because of the wooden shutter-covered opening and thin wooden sliding door (we could easily have a conversation from the room into the bathroom with shutters and door closed), showers in the morning woke my son up. I would believe that people with allergy sensitivities or general frangrance issues could be bothered by the various scents of the shampoo, soaps ... one is a bit lime-like, another earthy, and one smelled like bubble gum to me :o) We don't usually have our room refreshed as my son's toys take over our room, and it's just easier so he can nap whenever, but housekeeping was kind and helpful whenever we needed assistance. Location is very nice - view of lake is gorgeous, walk to Navy Pier and little beach and park by lake is short (did need stroller, though) and lovely, and walking to restaurants, shopping, touristy areas is reasonable. Acura service was a bonus! Wouldn't complain if I had to stay at this W again :o)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with thin walls”
Reviews.Author: mdurakjones
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W lakeshore for one night 12/28. The main lobby and bar areas were very trendy and an inviting place to sit or relax. All of the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. The fitness center was quite small, but enough to get a workout in. The rooms were well appointed with everything you would expect. There was a nice chaise lounge for reading/relaxing near the window. No tub, but larger open shower with nice toiletries from the spa. Our one and only complaint was the noise. We could hear everything in the halls and the adjacent rooms to us. We heard other people's wake up calls, conversations and even arguments in the hallway. While we understand a loud argument is just that, I really did not want to hear all of our neighbor's wake up calls. While the overall experience was nice I think there are nicer places to stay at a better value in Chicago. (The Amalfi for one)

Reviews.Title: “excellent service in a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jlillie308
Reviews.Content: From check-in to the valet and the concierge...everyone at this hotel was helpful and extremely nice. We had a great time and loved the location. Definitely recommend it. Make sure you grab a cocktail in the Whiskey Sky bar...great view of Navy Pier!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful lobby, alright rooms, horrible service”
Reviews.Author: Jaclyn G
Reviews.Content: rooms were small, and not impressive especially for the price. management was awful. would not suggest anyone to stay at the w on lakeshore.

Reviews.Title: “Puttin' on the ritz”
Reviews.Author: ConchyLee
Reviews.Content: Walking into this property and looking around, it just screams, "WOW!" The property is well decorated, and looks fantastic. The staff is superb. This would have you questioning, "Why the 'average' overall rating then?" Not so fast, grasshopper. I've been here before. I stayed in this property 11/27 & 28, 1970 (don''t ask how I remember,) when it was the Lake Tower Inn. Then I stayed a couple of times in the mid-1990's when it was a Days Inn. Now, it's the "W." I'm sure the decorations and layout are very "New York." Don't get me wrong, the bed was great, furniture & decorations were lovely. But get this: There's an open window from the bathroom into the bedroom. Yes, there's a set of shutters you can close, and there's a louvered sliding wood door to the bathroom. But I'd say there's not much "audio" privacy, if you get my drift. The bathroom...I'm sure it's very cosmopolitan. The shower stall has a half-wall that's glass, and there's no shower door. The "rain" showerhead is very nice. But I'm tall, and that shower is probably only 7 feet tall, so when I washed my hair, I banged my hands on the shower head the first time. Minor problem. Towels were big...but some softener in the laundry would have gone a long way toward "luxury." Parking...it's valet. That's your choice. $55 a night. So when we returned from visiting on Saturday evening about 10:30, there wasn't anyone there for valet. Well, Saturday night...surely they'd cut back on staff, after all it's late Saturday night...who would still be out at 10:30pm in the city of Chicago? Sigh. I parked it myself. Then, they were disturbed with me on Sunday morning because I'd done that. Ok...this is what says Day's Inn. The place has been remodeled and redcorated. Quite nice. But the walls on either side are still "Days Inn thin." We had a "city view" room. Read that: our room faced another building, not the lake. The wind was off the lake, yet it was breezy coming into the room. Days Inn all over again. For $270 a night, I'd expected more. And attention to minor things would have bumped the rating, because it really IS well decorated and pretty. But I'm from the farm country down state and we have a saying...you can gold plate a cowchip, but it's still a cowchip. It's a pretty fancy Days Inn.

Reviews.Title: “cool W”
Reviews.Author: Matt O
Reviews.Content: More 'Urban Amercian' than the New York, Chicago is cool and being i the W makes it even cooler Great views, location and bar

Reviews.Title: “Nice views, cool decor, but poor/deteriorated service”
Reviews.Author: Incurable_Romantic
Reviews.Content: My second stay at this hotel; the first time was terrific, great views, cool decor, comfy bed, but service has deteriorated a lot over past year or two. No one met us on arrival despite lots of luggage. Whiskey Sky bar was closed despite advertised availability. So we went with room service; we were told that the kitchen closed 1 hour earlier than advertised in hotel materials; no apology offered. When we ordered therefore from the very limited "all night" menu, the food took 50 minutes to arrive, contrary to a promise that it would be 30 minutes, and was lukewarm/cold. Our requested wine glasses for wine in the honor bar were not delivered (strangely, there were no wine glasses in room even though there was a bottle of wine). Internet cord was too short to allow me to sit down with the computer at the desk, so I had to stand to use computer. This place has the bones of a really great hotel, but poor maintenance and staffing have undermined the experience.

Reviews.Title: “This is not Grey Goose”
Reviews.Author: dna7575
Reviews.Content: This is the third W Hotel that I stayed at and, truth be told, I haven't been all that impressed. While the rooms are fine, something is clearly wrong with the bars. When you ask for Grey Goose, or any other premium alcohol, what comes out of the bottles is not what you ordered. Clearly, they are refilling bottles with less expensive alcohol. I've called them out on it several times. Their response, "Well, it came out of a Grey Goose bottle." I can't understand why they do this when they are clearly making lots of money on their alcohol sales. I can tell you I won't be staying or visiting another W Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay here again...love the W...just not this one”
Reviews.Author: ritamack71
Reviews.Content: I booked our stay at the W Lakeshore due to the great value on a city view room. When I made the reservation, we had decided we did not need to rent a car for this trip. Unfortunately, that changed as soon as I hit submit, as our ride for the weekend was in a fender bender and could not provide any transportation. Normally this would not be a problem, until I saw the price for parking at the W Chicago Lakeshore - $55 per night! Insane! Add to that the valets did not provide a permanent car tag for the stay. Upon each arrival, we had to get a new tag, provide our name, etc. and were reminded of the fee with large numbers printed on the face of the tag - $55 - as if we did not remember. The room left me puzzled. I have never experienced a bathroom quite so.....open. A window from the bathroom that opens into the bedroom? Really? What exactly is the point? The shower itself also had no door - or curtain, or anything else to prevent the water from spilling out onto the floor. Each day, the shower was the most unpleasant, cold experience of my life. On to the bed....extremely high off the ground....and hard. Absolutely nothing heavenly about this bed. Positives: the hotel was decorated in true W style - modern and contemporary with great lighting and funky furniture. Cons: bathroom configuration is odd and uncomfortable, bed was uncomfortable, shower was unpleasant, valet parking was a huge ripoff. The location was ok for walking so if you do not need to leave the immediate area, skip the rental car and save the $55. On another note, Wave, the restaurant was pretty good. The first night there our food was phenomenal. We treated daughter and her bf to dinner another night and it was only average that night. So, hit or miss. But the decor was a hit with 20-somethings. IMPORTANT NOTE: when using the public restroom in the lobby - there are 2 way mirrors. YOU CAN SEE INTO THE MENS ROOM AND THEY CAN SEE YOU. Only at the sink, but somewhat disturbing all the same. I am a frequent W visitor....just will not add this one to my list of faves.

Reviews.Title: “Modern,but worn”
Reviews.Author: le_nomade
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in January for pleasure. The staff was very good, service was as expected for a W,speedy check-in/out, every question was answered immediately. Breakfast here was not great, poor value. The room had a comfortable bed, very dark at night, easy to get a good sleep. However, things seem to be a little worn out, it looked like a renovation job rather than a modern hotel designed as such. Bathrooms were not really modern at all. Rooms were poorly soundproofed, but thankfully our neighbors were quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: roadtripblondie
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the W Chicago Lakeshore and I cannot say enough about every aspect of this property. I have stayed at many downtown Chicago hotels, and this one ranks among the best. Everyone we dealt with was pleasant, friendly and helpful from the concierge to front desk to housekeeping. The only slight disappointment was the Whiskey Bar on the top floor; while I had no complaints, I expected a bit more. We enjoyed the lobby bar much more. The comfort of the room was phenomenal; exceptional view of Lake Michigan and Navy Pier. I must agree with another review I read prior to my trip - the Oriental bathroom door and shuttered window into the bedroom area is a bit odd, but we got used to it. My theory is that this dissipates the shower steam. As a swimmer, I appreciated the large indoor pool and the generous hours it is open. Would definitely stay at the W again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: JNic21
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely - the service was exceptional and everyone was so friendly and helpful. I was able to have a bottle of champagne and chocolates waiting for us for my father's birthday - a simple email to a staff member and all was sorted, and they even upgraded our room which was fantastic. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Lost Suitcase”
Reviews.Author: sharonp4615
Reviews.Content: Last June one of the bellman lost my suitcase. The W Hotel refuses to acknowledge that anything happened. Horrible customer service. I've made 100 phone calls and still no response. Not worth the high cost!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: TexCaribbeanGal
Reviews.Content: The overall atmosphere of the W was very relaxing and modern though the service was rather disappointing. This hotel could improve its overall ratings by hiring a staff that doesn't take 30 minutes to deliver one (free) DVD. While my family was pleasantly surprised to find a huge DVD library free of charge for our use (besides the $25 refundable safety deposit), it took forever to have one unfriendly staff member deliver the DVD (this was after I volunteered to come down and get it myself). I know this sounds very particular, and to be honest it wasn't a big deal- until a couple other small things like this happened. BEWARE, the parking comes with a hefty price tag of $50 per 24hrs, nearly as much as our room which was $70 per night. I would recommend parking elsewhere and walking to the hotel instead of overpaying to park. (or just take the train) Anyways, the stay was very nice- if you like modern design. Our room had a view of Ontario St. which was pretty cool because we could see all the way down the road. The workout room and pool areas were AMAZING- the pool had a view of Navy Pier while the workout area was split into a weigh-lifting section and another section with more cardio-based equipment such as bikes, tredmills, etc. Each of the machines was in superior shape and had its own tv- so if you plan on working out be sure to bring headphones! Being from Texas, the walk from The W to Michican Ave and other major attractions (besides Navy Pier) nearly froze me to death, so if you have small kids this may be of concern. Other than that, our party of five was very pleased to have chosen The W Chicago Lakeshore and we will most likely stay here again if we can find good rates.

Reviews.Title: “Money Vacuum”
Reviews.Author: francophileinny
Reviews.Content: $ 15 Internet service $ 53 Parking $ 35 Steam at Bliss Spa since gym is "conveniently" not equipped with one $ 2 Fiji Water everywhere (not expensive, but stop trying to sell me stuff The James gives complimentary water. Moved room three times since we were in connecting rooms. Third room - still paper thin walls. Loudest at bathroom mirror. While I used the facility, I heard intimate conversation, and they heard me. It sounds like someone is showering in your room when a neighboring room is using theirs. 25 minutes to wait for breakfast table when 3/4 tables were empty. After booking hotel, three weeks later we got an email for a special New Years Rate, and I had to push to get them to accept a rebooking, then had to push again upon arrival, and then the front help keeps stating that she does not know what this thing is is "whatever" about the whole issue. Positives - Great view of Navy Pier (hope fireworks are great tonight!) Bliss products in bathroom and I asked for, and got a bit more. Comfy bed, but really high, and heavy duvet kept slipping down and off. Ample elevators, never a long wait, but lively music for early morning! All musicians performing in this city tonight must be here. Ojays, Big Gigantic and others, so I am excited for some after party fun in the hotel! (New Year tonight). The steak - anything on the menu with steak is the same (bar menu night is same as steak and eggs, served the same way on a stick) and delicious so I am cool with it. They try their best to please, so if you want to pretend to be a rock star, come and drop it like it's hot, because if you really had money, you wouldn't be in this place. The staff is truly kind and try their best (eager) to do what they can. This one good looking "bell-hop" porter who I keep seeing is just so genuine. He always strikes up a nice bit of banter and has a kind heart. More negative- Bathrooms have plantation shutters, so you better be comfortable with the bathroom noises of your bed mate and not be embarrassed when you make them! Shower head is rain one, but if you angle it at all, the proof of no water pressure is that it just drizzles out; also there is no door and no lip to the floor, so it is impossible to keep the main floor dry. Only one bathrobe with two guests. Acura car service ends at 7 so forget using it for dinner time. Today is NYE, and they are done even earlier, so why bother?! Bottom line - not coming back unless there is a fabulous deal. Great view, but little other reason to come here. I HATE the nickel and diming. I am willing to pay and then play, but I just want to pay once and get it all. It is like going to a theme park where you pay when you enter and enjoy your day with your wallet away, or where you gain access, but keep your wallet out for every instance/incidental.

Reviews.Title: “Nice trip”
Reviews.Author: allison1127
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at the W for our anual Christmas visit. The service was great from the moment we arrived. The front desk staff was very helpful and friendly just like last year. The views are great. Last year we had a lake view which was awesome and this year we had a city view which was nice too and at least we weren't staring at a brick wall or "L" track like we have at other 4 star hotels in Chi-town. Room service brought our young kids a large plate of all different kinds of cookies which was complimentary and very thoughtful of them. We were able to walk to Michigan Ave which was about 5 blocks. Its really not a terrible walk at all. Others have mentioned its too far from the main drag but its not. We were walking with 3 kids on the 23rd of Decemeber and it was nice to see all the Christmas lights. The room was clean and quiet, no one from the hotel bothered us with phone calls or knocks on the door. Our remote to the tv was not working and they quickly replaced it we didnt have to wait hours for them to come up and give us a new one. The crib service is complimentary which is great because other hotels in the city do charge. Last year the hotel also gave our kids little treat bags when we arrived. Overall our two stays at the W have been great. No complaints at all. Yes valet is expensive but where is not expensive in the city? We paid 53.00 I believe which was a little less then what we have paid at the Palmer House. We will deffinitley be back.

Reviews.Title: “You can't get closer to lake Michigan. Get ready for $60 parking fee!!”
Reviews.Author: chicagotraveler9411
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights during oncology convention in June. Even though I live in Chicago, I couldn't pass up a company paid room in a premium location in the city. The hotel is modern, trendy, and offered free local rides via the Acura driving experience. Everything at the hotel is expensive even for Chicago. $18 dollar grey goose Martinis at the bar to the $60 valet parking fees. Good view from the hotel especially if you have the lake view, but since you are right next to the lake shore drive, its a long walk or short can ride to the Michigian ave for shopping. If you are in to the spa thing the Bliss Spa on site is amazing of course at astronomical prices.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, lobby and pool. Thin walls though!”
Reviews.Author: Serosity
Reviews.Content: The decor in the room as well as the lobby was excellent. Very cool bar downstairs as well as on the top floor. The pool was clean and water warm, great views from the rooms onto the pier. Staff was very friendly and helpful as well. Location was probably not the best in the colder weather since we did a lot of walking, but still close enough to the main drag. Several pubs, little restaurants within a 5-10 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: JLM235
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several W Hotels around the world and this was one of the worst experiences. After a MULTI hour flight from Asia to the U.S., check-in at the W was cold and unfriendly, no offer of help with my luggage or even directions to my room. The room itself hadn't been cleaned yet when I entered, was in corner that felt like a closet and had a rumbling heater they didn't bother to fix when I brought it up. I am usually a big fan of this chain but will never stay at this particular one again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing View, Decor and Food!”
Reviews.Author: Licorish
Reviews.Content: I wish I could transplant this hotel to every city I visit. I LOVE LOVE LOVE IT, the room and furnishings were top notch, the restaurant was AMAZING for dinner, and the view from my room was breathtaking. Staff friendly and curteous! Its been a bit since I stayed here but I felt they were worth reviewing! The W Lakeshore is TOP NOTCH!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Chi-town”
Reviews.Author: DCbella85
Reviews.Content: Very modern and right on the lake. The beaches nearby are great in the summer and the Navy Pier is a good time too. Not far from shopping and transportation either. Great decor and trendy restaurants and bar in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's like putting lipstick on a pig...”
Reviews.Author: CharlieBarbK9
Reviews.Content: This W location is what it is - a cool and trendy veneer on what was an old school hotel. W Brand and amenities definitely make things as interesting as they possibly can - but the building itself is lacking - there is only so much lipstick you can put on a pig. Rooms are small and dark. Bathrooms are weird - the half wall/half shutter opening into the room itself drove my husband bonkers. 5 months later - he still complains of the lack of privacy. Location is great to Navy Pier and for jogging along the river front. Roof top bar has great view of lake and pier - both day and night. Expect to walk or cab to most other locations of interest. Concierge services are okay - their restaurant recommendations seemed mediocre for what one might expect to find in a true foodie town. Provide them with specific directions on what you want and do not assume they will hook you up with something interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend from my daughter”
Reviews.Author: MDK56
Reviews.Content: Great location to Navy Pier. Staff was wonderful. My daughter was having her 7th birthday. They surprised her with a treat and made her feel like a queen. I travel for work so know that there are standard "gifts", but these folks went above and beyond. The wrote her a personalized card signed by the staff. Most importantly, the next day they asked her by name how her day was (from the valet to the checkout). They really made her feel special -- and a happy daughter is a happy mother. Thank you! We were able to walk to Navy Pier and could easily get to other locations. Rooms were clean and nice, but the front desk service is what made this trip so great. The hotel does seem to attract a younger crowd (that seemed to have fun into the early hours), but didn't make the stay unenjoyable. However if you are looking for a very quiet get away, this hotel may have too much action for you.

Reviews.Title: “Not very impressed”
Reviews.Author: Pufferphish
Reviews.Content: I was not impressed! The room I stayed in had two double beds. The room was quite small for my liking.especially at $250.00 a pop! The bathroom door was a sliding wicker door, with not privacy, if you were to stay with a guest. The walls to the rooms are paper thin. I could hear my next door neighbors as if they were in my room. I had another guest from above, shower at 2:00am and wike me out of a dead sleep. For the money I spent at the "W". I would recommend another place to stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great View, Great Staff.. Lovely destination”
Reviews.Author: Jason I
Reviews.Content: The W Lakeshore Hotel is a great place to stay hands down!! I traveled solo on a business trip from New York and the treatment from when i walked into the " Living Room " to when i checked in was Superb. The Whatever/ Whenever experience was executed to a T. Whenever i requested a toothbrush, shaving kit and even floss, the young lady Raquel brought it up to me with a smile. She was very kind and always used her name and never ceased to let me know if i needed anything else to let her know. I felt like i was bothering her at times but she didnt mind at all..W Lakeshore crew, you guys rock!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service”
Reviews.Author: pammydz
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the W Lakeshore and wanted to eat at trendy restaurant with no notice. Our concierge Robert Shumate was so friendly and helpful on suggestions and getting us into Maestro's. We had a lovely meal and the waiter brought over dessert and said it was compliments of our concierge, What a way to make a statement..

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience, Close to Michigan Ave”
Reviews.Author: laurengucsb
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at this hotel; normally I stay at the City Center one but it was close to $500 so I stayed a bit further from my work to get a deal at this place. I would say for the price, it was worth it. The location is nice for leisure stuff, but again, a $10 cab to my office, and worst of all, when I came down at 8:15am, there were several mornings where it was a 15 minute wait for a cab. There were 7 people in front of me one day and a cab pulling up maybe every 3 minutes. It took forever. The staff is whistling for cabs to come, but I guess there aren't many around at that time, or maybe it was just a busy week - i think there may have been a big conference in town. As a Platinum member, I was upgraded to a lakeview room on the 20th floor, very nice, although for some reason it seemed to be a bit loud outside, even 20 floors up. There is the freeway that goes along the lake right there, but I'm still surprised that that would be an issue. The room itself was nice, although not as spacious as the rooms at the City Center W. The bed was higher up though, which I liked. I was able to shift the couch/chair thing so I could do yoga next to the bed. I always like that at Ws they have the TV guide on the TV so you don't have to scroll through each channel. Service was good, although I saw a note in the room saying you could cancel your newspaper if you didn't want it - I did that for the remainder of the stay (just one call), but they only canceled it for the next day, then the final two days I got the paper. Just seems like a waste. I was out of the room 3 of the nights through dinner and came back and there was no turndown service (I wasn't expecting it), but the one night I happened to be in the room, someone knocked and asked if I wanted it. Because of my status, they give free internet and water, but often times I get a bill being charged for these things. I'm happy to report that everything was correct on the bill. I didn't eat at this hotel, but do like that it's walking distance to Michigan Ave so there's are tons of good restaurants nearby. Not sure if we'll stay here again, it's not convenient for my work and if we do opt for something more leisure, we love the Westin on Michigan Ave. With that said, I'd still highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Always provide an excellent experience!”
Reviews.Author: brebes4
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the W Hotel on Lakeshore several times, both for personal and work purposes. I have always had an amazing experience, both with the venue itself and with the staff at the hotel. The hotel itself is an an amazing location (right on lakeshore drive on Lake Michigan) and has a spa (spa products are provided to you in your room) and a fantastic and very updated exercise facility. There is a very hip and fun vibe to the hotel. The "Whenever, Whatever" line you can call is fantastic - they will literally get you anything you need! From a microwave to an eyeglass repair kit, they will get it to your room asap. The staff was always very friendly and accommodating and was great at recommending a hair salon while I stayed for an extended time. The W Lakeshore is my first choice of hotel in Chicago and is the only place I choose to stay - not to mention the reasonable prices!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice view in lake-side rooms”
Reviews.Author: elle0ny
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty new and well-maintained. I was upgraded to a lakeview room, which made a huge difference in our quality of stay because the 'city-side' rooms faced into other high-rise buildings. (Very unattractive views.) It was convenient to have Bliss Spa in the hotel, and it was nice to have the Acura car service available to guests. The complimentary car service is only available during a portion of the day, which varies from weekday to weekend. The maid service was excellent, and they were very nice. Unfortunately, I cannot say the same for the concierge or latenight front desk person, or the lobby bartender. The concierge was too busy from what I could tell, and was not very helpful in finding a restaurant. The front desk person on duty late in the night was not that friendly and definitely made it seem like I was bothering her when I called down for help. The location is kind of out of the way because it is by the lake, but the view makes up for this if you are in one of the lakeview rooms. The restaurant and room service are very expensive, as is the in-room wifi. The lobby wifi wasn't always working properly, which was annoying. The bartenders in the lobby bar were very slow and were not attentive at all. Very annoying. If you are expecting a classic W Hotel experience, you might be disappointed by the layout of the room, which is less like other W Hotels and more like conventional hotels. However, you are still provided with Bliss products and the beds are GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “fab hotel... excellent staff....”
Reviews.Author: road_warrior848
Reviews.Content: I have stayed this hotel on many occasions and still enjoy it. The front desk staff, the concierges and the wait staff were all very courteous and professional. Raquel (always smiling and very cheerful) has always been exceptionally superb and helpful. this hotel has an amazing staff but she is an excellent role model. The view of the lake and Navy Pier from my room was perfect (I mostly get the suite and it comes with bang and olufsen - not bad) I am yet to try the fitness center so no comments here. I recommend this hotel and will def be back....

Reviews.Title: “Good deal in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveler2011
Reviews.Content: Location, location! Cool contemporary lobby, clean rooms, no coffeemaker in the room, but free hot coffee in the lobby. Play package rate was a real deal as it included parking and 2 drinks for a moderate price. Free rides within 5 mile range on a nice Acura sponsored car was of great convenience. The only unusual detail about the room was a window from the room to the bathroom: no glass, just wooden shutters that close but do not lock. Bathroom door also does not lock and it is a sliding door. Shutters + sliding door = you can hear every sound from the bathroom, unless loud heater overdo them. Loud heater was also a nuisance at night along with all the commotion in the hallways. So, the biggest issue during our stay was the noise of all sorts. But I have to admit their service was very nice in every aspect. Overall, for a short leisure visit to Chicago Downtown this was a suitable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Treated Like Royalty”
Reviews.Author: beauty b
Reviews.Content: The entire staff make you feel like royalty from the moment you arrive to the time you leave. Lois the concierge is the best she is always recommends the best places to dine around town. The hotel is modern and comfortable with a great location in downtown Chicago. I have stayed there for the last 10 years when I come into town to visit. It truly is home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Alejandro M
Reviews.Content: The minute we (my wife and i) we had a happy welcome greeting from W agents. I thank all of them for the kind attention!!! Concierge desk is the BEST! Clean and well organized... Best from Panama City, Panama Alejandro

Reviews.Title: “Decent but there are better W hotels”
Reviews.Author: BforBoy
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 3 nights. My whole stay was uneventful and I got an upgrade to a nice room. There is just nothing that really stands out about this hotel. But sometimes no news is good news. The location is great. If you get a good rate, I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Previous guests nail clippings all over bathroom....”
Reviews.Author: Holidaymaker-DC
Reviews.Content: Nothing could make up for the bad impression of poor housekeeping on arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the W Hotel Lakeshore in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Jeff A
Reviews.Content: My brother and I travelled to Chicago in October on a mixed business and pleasure trip. We stayed at the W Hotel in Lakeshore and we left there with a very good impression. It was my second time in chicago and I had previously stayed at The Affinia which is also a nice hotel. When we arrived at the hotel, we were checked in by Annie. She deserves a special mention. Her customer service was top notch. She enrolled me into the Starwood Preferred Guests loyalty program and was just very friendly. Her customer service alone is a reason for me to stay here again. The room we had was a good size and had beautiful views of Lake Michigan and Navy Pier. The hotel has a great spa called bliss and a nice gym. One real positive is the complimentary taxi which is run by a car company whose name I can't remember, but it was great. You just book a time and the car is waiting for you. There was a couple of negatives: WIFI should be free! I often stay at Radisson Hotels and as long as you are a member of their loyalty program, the WIFI is free..A hotel of the calibre of the W should not be charging their customers to use the internet in their rooms. The other negative was the bar...I expected it to be more lively. I think the hotel can do a bit more about that. The W hotel in London is an example. Apart from that, we really enjoyed our stay here. The location is great, the restaurant served great food and we were well looked after from start to finish and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: Caryaovata
Reviews.Content: First room smelled like cigarette smoke. Staff quickly moved us to a different room, which smelled much better. Wifi costs $15. Really? Even at my small hotel in Rome last week, wifi was free. Hotel cose to Navy Pier but not much else. Loud music in lobby, teeny bopper clientele not my cup of tea.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and location, but noisy higher floors”
Reviews.Author: CJS07
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here and it was amazing in terms of location, service, and amenities. It is a short walk to Navy Pier and other downtown sites, plus you are right on the water and can get a room with an amazing view. The gym was also great and the Bliss spa cannot be beat. Overall very modern and new with great service. However, if you are staying on a higher floor (we were on floor 29) you can hear the club which is on the 33rd floor, something to keep in mind if you want to go to bed before midnight! The club, however, is very cool and chic, highly recommend a drink there!

Reviews.Title: “Generally good, but not as impressive as other W Hotels”
Reviews.Author: mst7022
Reviews.Content: The room was nice, with an open bathroom plan, which I liked. You could feel that it's a re-do of an older property at times, unlike some other W Hotels. In particular, the A/C unit was ridiculously loud and would wake me up when it kicked in. Lobby is nice, location is great, just doesn't feel quite as nice as other W's where I've stayed (SF, for example).

Reviews.Title: “elegance, first rate service, and the best location in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: valentine55_11
Reviews.Content: Do you want a view of the Magnificent Lake Michigan? Do you want to walk to a sandy beach? Do you want to shop at Navy Pier? Do you want Elegance? Do you want 5 star service? Do you want access to a great swimming pool? Do you want to be treated as if you are royalty? There is only one answer......Chicago Lake Shore.

Reviews.Title: “W Chicago Lakeshore”
Reviews.Author: Benjamin N
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for our anniversary. We had stayed at the W Hoboken in New Jersey and was impressed with our stay there. W Chicago lived up to our expectations and made our stay a memorable one. The location is excellent. It is very convenient to get to famous local restaurants as well as Navy Pier and the lake shore. The only downside was that the overnight valet parking was kind of pricey. There is a public parking garage on the north side of the building that may be less money. The room was impeccable and decorated in modern decor. We went out for dinner and decided to come back and explore the bars at the hotel. We started with the bar off the lobby area and then made our way to Whiskey Sky. Whiskey Sky is an intimate setting on the 33rd floor overlooking the city. We enjoyed the setting, view and excellent service. The next morning we used their well maintained exercise facilities and then enjoyed breakfast in the outdoor cafe. W Chicago provided excellent service and made our anniversary one to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Great Chicago location - make sure you're into hip though”
Reviews.Author: markotoole
Reviews.Content: Hip hits you at every turn at a W. The Lakeshore location was no different. The location is great: downtown Chicago on one side, the lake on the other. Easy walking distance to many attractions or a short cab ride to the rest. But back to hip. Funky elevator music, open W-style lobby with lobby bar. A "whatever" button on your phone to ask for just about anything. I only spent one night so beyond sleeping, I did not experience much of the hotel. There was a pool and gym, but I saw neither. Also, there was a smallish bar on one of the upper floors. The room was older but comfortable with W-whimsy everywhere: the full-length mirror propped against a wall, the shutters on the bathroom wall opening to the bedroom. The list goes on. The bed was comfortable. I did eat here, but did use the conference space. The room was functional but nothing special. No windows and rather drab. Overall the building was older and had obviously been another hotel brand before it got W'ed. I heard the soon-to-open Radisson blu aqua in Chicago will set a new standard for hip luxury. This W tries hard but does not quite pull it off. Stay for the location and the W ambiance, if that's your thing.

Reviews.Title: “I hit the easy button!”
Reviews.Author: Thtswtimtlknbout
Reviews.Content: No reservation? No problem, Christine at the front desk got me a room instantly! I had to see Chicago in 24 hours and Robert Shumate (concierge) made it happen for me... Great restaurant suggestions and perfect bar/lounges to top it off! Room, spa, and gym were spectacular as well. Awesome service wish I could've stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, Hip, Energetic; Limited Perks for Elites;Expensive But Great Valet Parking”
Reviews.Author: travelingdoc42
Reviews.Content: This is the second â€œWâ€� at which we have stayed. The other was in NYC Times Square. Both have smallish lobbies, dark hallways, sort of â€œAsian Modernâ€� decor and no club lounge. The bathrooms are not too private - both had sliding, light-weight doors and this one had some strange louvered windows which allowed full view of bathroom internals from the bedroom. The closet had no doors â€“just curtains. There was no folding luggage rack. No coffee maker in room, but they said they would send one if asked. I thought all of this was strange and cheap looking; my wife loved it and informed me that â€œI was out of itâ€¦â€�. Perks for being a Starwood Platinum were limited to â€œwelcome gift(I took points)â€� and a room upgrade, which apparently was from a smallish room with no lake view to a smallish one with a lake view. They also gave us a free bottle of chilled â€œchampagneâ€� (actually a very nice Italian sparkling wine) which was a nice touch. Beds were very comfortable and we loved the pillows. TV was a modern flat screen one. Water pressure in shower was great, but keeping bathroom floor dry was tricky. At check in they mentioned special services were available like a spa and a gym (which we seem to rarely use) and a free limo service ( apparently very, very limited - it was already fully booked when we checked in at 3:30 PM). When we returned to hotel from the opera at about 11 PM the lobby was very energetic and (pleasantly) noisyâ€¦what from I have no idea, but it seemed like a night club atmosphere. All in all, these hotels seem to be geared to a younger crowd (which seems to include people like my wife - at least in spirit) and not fully appreciated by people like me. Valet parking was expensive ($53) but the best Iâ€™ve ever encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Hotel on the Lake”
Reviews.Author: nycndc
Reviews.Content: Although I was there for just one night, I would definitely return on my next trip to Chicago. The hotel rooms are very comfortable and the lobby bar has a good looking crowd. Free coffee and bagels in the lobby for breakfast. Great veiw of the Lake.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nelsoli
Reviews.Content: The W Chicago Lakeshore Drive is your average chain hotel. While the location (about a 5 minute walk to Michigan Avenue) and view (amazing views of the lake if you get the right room) are pros, nothing else really stands out at this hotel. It is a bit older, there is often a wait for the elevators, and the service is average. We stopped in the lobby bar for a "glass of the house red wine", and needless to say, we were surprised when the bill arrived - $32 for 2 glasses of average wine!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Lake View”
Reviews.Author: Ted_and_Linda_H
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place to stay in downtown Chicago. You either look at the lake or the park. I was there on a Saturday night and witnessed the best fireworks over the park I've seen in a long time. The hotel is clean, modern, and service is good. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa L
Reviews.Content: my family of 4 stayed recently. we used the acura car service and loved it. the drivers were wonderful and available anytime we needed. the spa was very nice. perfect location for a family we could walk to Navy Pier if we wanted. wasnt crazy about the shutters blocking the bathroom, good for a single traveler but with a family it can fly open leaving the person taking a shower no privacy!

Reviews.Title: “Better Starwood properties to stay at.”
Reviews.Author: jadebynikolai
Reviews.Content: The room size is good. The beds are not comfortable. The heater is loud. The amenities are awesome. Love the bliss spa!!! Excellent services and products. The front desk relied a lot on the conceirge. Which was always busy and he was overwhelmed and had an attitude. The doormen were extremely helpful with directions and getting us a taxi everyday. The wave restaurant is excellent. Food is delicious and service there is also very good. Overall I have stayed at better W hotels and Starwood properties.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Care”
Reviews.Author: TJB19
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been redone as another reviewer noted, but we found it tastefully and comfortably done. My wife and I had a King room and it was a little small, but not uncomfortably so. This was both a business and personal trip, so we were out of the room all day working and out seeing Chicago in the evening. The location of the hotel is great, overlooking Navy Pier. We chose this hotel because we got our room for less than the blocked rooms reserved at other hotels for our business conference. And that turned out to be a good thing. The service was impressive. Bellmen, valets, desk clerks, telephone operators, housekeepers, bartenders and wait staff were all wonderful, friendly and helpful. More than anything else, the concierge in the evenings was amazing!. I would advise that when you stay here, you look/ask for Ashley at the concierge desk. She treated us like we were her only guests and made sure that every evening was enjoyable and included a great meal. Between the location and the amazing staff - this stay was most enjoyable. Yes, the valet parking fee was a little unexpected, but this is downtown Chicago - on the lake, no less. It was not out of line given the location, security and unlimited access to the car. When we return to Chicago - as we do from time to time - I will do as advised and call Ashley at the W Chicago Lakeside to make the arrangements.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Khawnee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is marketed as being contemporary and modern in design. Sadly it is an older dog-earred hotel with a bandaid attempt at upgrade. Our king room featured 3 walls of old wallpaper and one wall of added silver wallpaper. The furniture looked like it came from one of those cheap home makeover shows where they build some of the furniture out of plywood and the rest is old furniture which has been spray painted black only adding new handles. The chaise lounge in our room was dirty and had scorch marks from a hot iron. There was no closet, just a curtained off area, and the bathroom had no privacy, with only a sliding woven wood door. Not at all what we expected from the W Hotel website, nor was it the norm for this group of hotels. Valet parking was $53 per night. Ouch! I read a previous poster complaining about the bamboo blinds lacking privacy. They must have missed there is a room darkening shade behind the bamboo which can be lowered by a chain. On the upside, the bed was clean and comfortable. The food in the Wave restaurant was great despite it being so dark we could hardly see it. We were in walking distance of Michigan Ave, Navy Pier and the Ohio St Beach.

Reviews.Title: “top notch”
Reviews.Author: J Z
Reviews.Content: had a wonderful experience at the w chicago lakeshore. the hotel is hip and perfectly located! the restaurant serves excellent breakfasts. and the hotel conference staff was superb-- making sure every detail of our meeting was taken care of!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great experience”
Reviews.Author: Lepeka
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the W Chicago Lakeshore and had a great experience. Rooms were great, Service was excellent, and they really assisted in making sure our time in Chicago included great meals and entertainment. A big thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Over and above the call of duty”
Reviews.Author: elizabeth w
Reviews.Content: I recently returned to the W Lakeshore and had a exceptional stay, which is by far more challenging to WOW frequent business travellers. From the reception staff, to the Concierge to the hotel runners each in his/her own empowered way give extra touches of service which made all the difference in the world: Surprising me with a W candle, sending up chicken soup for a sick colleague, extra care in finding the right restaurant with email confirmations (go Robert) and a restaurant staff that took special orders, and kept the kitchen open for my clients. It was over and above the normal guest service and why i choose to stay at the W where ever, whenever. This special brand of service definitely lives up the expectation, and worth every penny and SPG point earned or spent. Thank you W.

Reviews.Title: “Our Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: Ran G
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the W Lakeshore monthly for a week at a time since this past June and have since built great friendships with all the staff here including Ben, Lois, Amy, Maria Makalintal, Ashley (both of them), Stephanie, and Penny in housekeeping to name a few. We also got to know Justin over at the W City Center this past summer. Though we live in Miami, we now call Chicago our home away from home and think highly of everyone who's taken care of us at the W Lakeshore (they are like family to us now). We adore this property, its location, and its amazing staff---wouldn't consider staying anywhere else! As a road warrior myself, I can assure you that this is one property that will not let you down.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel”
Reviews.Author: lionswhs
Reviews.Content: Dirty, loud, smelly, smallest bathtub I have ever seen it is about one foot tall, no closet, no drapes, and peeling wallpaper. Complained and they did not care.

Reviews.Title: “Worst W I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: voomie01
Reviews.Content: Worst W ever, we checked in and our room was dirty, we had the leftovers of someone else drinks and water in our ice bucket. What else was dirty if they could not even clean out the ice bucket? We asked for two wake up calls on two separate occasions and neither were made. We were charged for a lakeview but were given a city view. Our room was not cleaned half the time we were there. I would say this place was better when it was a Days Inn.. Popcorn ceilings, really?

Reviews.Title: “Business -Group Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Alexis G
Reviews.Content: Great for Business Travel. Group accomodations made our stay easy and comfortable and helped us have a successful conference.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic view”
Reviews.Author: hotelsnobMadison_WI
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W on the Chicago Marathon weekend. The place was jumping. The view from our room was amazing. The hotel is very techno and may not appeal to the more traditional traveler The room was spacious and well decorated. The entire staff were great from the valet to dinning room service even though it was clear they were very busy.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you're in a wheelchair”
Reviews.Author: Roy L
Reviews.Content: First, Iâ€™ll set the stage. I am in a wheelchair. Iâ€™ve stayed at hundreds of hotels around the world. They ranged from one in WV where trees (and not small trees)were growing through the cracks of the asphalt in the parking lot and there were paper towels in place of real towels in the bathroom (I kid you not) to luxury suites at some of the finest hotels in the world so this review (my first) doesnâ€™t come from an inexperienced traveler. My wife accompanied me. We had spent the better part of the afternoon getting to our local airport and flying to Chicago. When we arrived at the hotel, we were hungry and exhausted; all we wanted to do was eat and go to bed. We checked in and asked the receptionist if the restaurant was accessible by wheelchair since we saw several steps leading down to it. He said that there was a ramp right next to the steps that we could use. We intended on eating as soon as we freshened up. Our first glitch occurred when we tried to get up to the room. The elevators required a key card to work. We tried several elevators but none of them liked our card so we had to wait for another guest to come and her card worked. This was merely a brief annoyance since the card worked fine on the door to our room. Getting into the room with someone in a wheelchair was challenging since the heavy door doesnâ€™t stay open (as they often do on accessible rooms) and my wife weighs about a hundred pounds. Once we got inside, I went into the bathroom first. There was a rack with towels on it right in front of the toilet so I had to move it. This is probably an easy task for someone who is not disabled but itâ€™s quite a chore for someone in a wheelchair. I moved it next to the tub/shower. Thatâ€™s right a tub with a shower in it in an accessible room just like a regular room, impossible for a person in a wheelchair to use. No shower for me in the morning. The description did say that it was a combined shower and bath but I had something far different in mind. My wife went in next so I thought Iâ€™d watch some TV while I waited. There was a chaise with a TV facing it on the far side of the room. I attempted to get over to it but, I was blocked by a desk chair. I found that if I put all the way against the desk, I could squeeze by. However, getting between the bed and the chaise was impossible (Iâ€™m sure the chaise could be moved but I couldnâ€™t move it) so I angled the TV toward the bed planning to watch it from there. I made my way back to the other side. The bed was so high that there was no way that I was getting on it. Later that night, I had to fall back on it and my wife had to swing my feet around onto it. Absurd! Anyway, I resigned myself to watching TV from my wheelchair. Luckily, the remote was on the bedside table on that side. It wouldnâ€™t work. My guess is that the extreme angle was beyond itâ€™s limits. I stared at the wall. We went down to the restaurant and took the ramp as instructed. When we got to the bottom, we were faced with more steps but not another ramp. Fortunately, the table next to us was free and we had a very enjoyable meal. It was superb â€“ Get the tuna appetizer. It was only after that that we found out there was a wheelchair lift that I could have used but we were never told about it. Back upstairs to our room after waiting for another guest with a working key card. I normally undress and dress by sitting on the edge of the bed. This was impossible due to the height of the bed. My wife had to undress me and dress me again the next morning. If Iâ€™d been alone, I would have been totally screwed. As far as I can tell, they took a regular room, put a bunch of hand rails in the bathroom, and called it accessible. This is a cruel joke to those of us who are handicapped. We went downstairs for breakfast. It was a beautiful day so we decided to eat out on the patio. Of course the automatic doors for the disabled didnâ€™t work. They didnâ€™t work on the way in either. Bottom line: My wife liked it but I hated it. She would have given it four stars and I would have given it zero (if possible) so we compromised at two. If you can get about normally â€“ Recommended. If youâ€™re disabled â€“ Avoid it like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “A room with a view!”
Reviews.Author: jrferreras100
Reviews.Content: Another W awesome experience!! Whether you are on a secluded Island and you will find the W Vieques, Chicago is no exception for the W experience! The W Chicago on Lakeshore is simply amazing! You feel you are like a star from the minute you walk in! But there is no better experience for your room to included a fantastic view of the Lake, simply an amazing view! The Lobby longe/Bar experience is simply awesome and so much fun that you don't even have to leave your Hotel for night entertainment! Really a great brand of Hotel you must try... I will be soon going to W Barcelona, can't wait for that!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view and experience”
Reviews.Author: BillParker
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several W Hotels and found them to be most interesting and enjoyable experiences. The W Hotel Lakeshore in Chicago was no exception--a wonderful stay. The front desk staff, the wait staff and the concierges were superb, as I have come to expect at a W Hotel. The only disappointment were the gentelmen at the front door, who completely ignored me during my four day stay--I even got my own taxi while they stood together and talked. The view of Lake Michigan and Navy Pier from my room was exceptional. I will definitely use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, ok location”
Reviews.Author: aboyer8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the W Hotel on a business trip. The hotel is stunning, but it is not at the best location. The room was amazing! We were in room 1900 which had a lake view. The room has beautiful furnishings and was very comfortable. It was probably 1 of the nicest hotels we have ever stayed in. They had a dreamy lounge chair which my husband fell asleep in. Our room had a King bed in it and was spaced comfortably. However, I could see how things could be tight if there were 2 beds in the room instead of 1. The bathroom was modern, clean and fresh. The staff was friendly enough. It wasn't above and beyond service like I would expect at a hotel like this, but we didn't have any negative experiences. The lobby is very nice and open. The conference rooms are a nice size and can be transformed to accommodate lots of different things. I was kind of freaked out by the lobby bathrooms. The mens and womens bathrooms are next to each other. For some reason, the hotel put in a 2 way mirror in the mens room. So they can see into the sink area of the womens bathroom, but the women can't see into the mens. The only way you know is a sign above the sink that states "You are not the only one checking you out." So really you could be in there doing your makeup and not know that some guy is staring at you. My husband thought it was the coolest thing. The location is somewhat lacking. It is close to Navy Pier, but you need to go under the highway to get there. And it is on the other side of the river from downtown and Grant Park. So you would really have to take a taxi to get most places. Bottom line is that if you are looking for a fancy hotel, don't mind walking a lot or taking a cab and are hoping to run into some celebrities, this is the hotel for you. If you are with your family or are trying to experience Chicago, I would stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice common facilities, but sub-par rooms”
Reviews.Author: GoBlueBoston
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a lot of W Hotels, and while I'd rate the common facilities of the W Lakeshore as on par with my other experiences (nice lobby, good bar/restaurant area, decent gym, etc.), the guest rooms were definitely below average. Like some other reviewers mentioned, it is obvious that this hotel was at one point an older, less nice hotel. The ceilings of the rooms are low and they have old-school POPCORN ceilings. I felt like I was in someone's basement den circa 1987. It was NOT a hipster retro design decision; rather it was a sign of a cheap renovation. Also, this is more of a general complaint about Starwood properties, but it happened to us at the W Lakeshore too, and it really irks me: at the check-in desk, there is always a designated line for Starwood Gold and Platinum members. Presumably this is so these members can go straight to that desk and be helped without waiting in line. Without fail, whenever we have gone to this line, the check-in attendants have continued to take the next guest in their general line without so much as acknowledging us standing at their preferred guest line. We usually end up waiting LONGER to be helped in this line. What is the point?? A few words of praise, though: as I said before, we did really like the lobby bar. The prices were reasonable, the service was good, and it is a chill and comfortable atmosphere. We got a few apps too, and they were tasty. The gym was pretty comprehensive for a hotel. We had a lakeview room, and the views from that side of the hotel are pretty fabulous. The hotel is also partenered with Acura and there is a desk set up in the lobby for you to schedule a free ride within a 5-mile radius of the hotel. It is great to save some money on cab fare!

Reviews.Title: “Such Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: reggie218
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in September for a extra long weekend trip to Chicago. I had 2 different reservations - I was only supposed to stay 1 night, but couldn't stand where I was staying the other days in was in town and had to bail. The person who checked me in was able to consolidate my reservations and put me in the same room for both of my nights. Since I was using my Starwood Points, I only got a room with a city view so she put me in a higher floor (31st, there were 33 floors in the hotel) so I can at least see some stuff out the window and not just another building, and she also offered me late checkout, which I took. In addition, I was able to get a ride to the nearest L train station going to ORD from the complimentary Acura hotel vehicles, with barely any notice - about an hour before I needed the ride. The Whenever Wherever rep was also able to print my boarding pass for my flight. I know that's what they are there for, but it made my trip much less stressful knowing they will be able to take care of my needs during my stay there. The bartender on the top floor was very nice as well, I came in there and it was deserted! He was nice enough to talk to me & keep me company until more people came in. The hotel is in a great location, its not right downtown, but its across from the lake, and on my floor, you have a great view of the Navy Pier! The bar on the 33rd floor has awesome views as well. It is walking distance to Millennium Park as well and stores on Michigan Ave. If you're not into walking so much, there are cabs right across the way from the hotel all the time you can hop in to. The beds are very comfortable, and that was the biggest draw, for me, to the W Hotels. I slept like a baby both nights I was there. The only weird thing was, there's no door to the shower, and the wall is made of glass AND there's a window in the bathroom looking out to the bed. (see the pictures!) I was fine with it since I was staying in the room by myself. At least the window shutters can be closed if more privacy is needed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service & sense of design”
Reviews.Author: MrsBuddy
Reviews.Content: Had a great great experience at W hotel. While checking in, I thought the tone was friendly but also full of elegance, not too familiar. The gym & pool are clean, quiet & well equipped. The room was spacious, the view onto Lake Michigan absolutely fantastic. Before leaving, I wanted to buy stamps for post cards, they just took them and offered to stamp them, free of charge. I highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Just ok, some issues”
Reviews.Author: cemckeon
Reviews.Content: If you've ever stayed at a W hotel, then you know this chain is a bit different. Some say the W stands for weird. The hotel is very dark in the lobby, halls and rooms. First room I checked into was supposed to be non-smoking but I could smell smoke residue and an abundance of perfume trying to cover up the smell. Second room smelled better. When checking out in the morning, front desk had no change and the airline check-in kiosk was not working. Was sent to valet stand to get change and the concierge to get a boarding pass printed. Would have preferred that didn't have to go elsewhere for these services. I would choose another hotel when in this area next time.

Reviews.Title: “It's the view”
Reviews.Author: 14clubs
Reviews.Content: Stayed a couple of nights for a wedding at a discounted rate and had a room with a lake view, including the sunrise. You could sit at the window and get lost in the view. However, like other posters have said, some interesting, shall we say, quirks? The bathroom did not offer a lot of privacy as the window to the bedroom and the sliding wood door were view barriers, but that was it. No fan, so steamed up bathroom and mirror is a challenge. Bath amenities are nice. Bed and pillows were comfortable. Lobby area was loud as it was all open to the bar and restaurant. Music was closer to noise and furniture was trendier than most. Not real relaxing and I wouldn't recommend sitting in the lobby to read a book. Also, conversation challenging. Like pretty much all downtown hotels (Chicago or otherwise), parking is very expensive. You can cut about half the cost with nearby lots or garages. And of course like all higher end hotels, wifi is a double digit fee. Starbucks is down the street. Staff was very friendly and accomodating. Everyone greeted you in a very sincere manner. About the Acura experience. It's not the hotel shuttle. We didn't experience the Acura because of limited hours and the one evening we could have used it, it was booked. If I was the manager, I don't think I'd promote it as such an exclusive feature if the majority of your guests can't use it. In nice weather, you can walk to the Magnificent Mile. Navy Pier is a short walk the other way. So for the lake view, if you can get it at a good price, it's an interesting experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay overall, but minor annoyances”
Reviews.Author: Love2TravelVA
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the W during a business trip. Here is a summary of my experience: Positive: - Large, attractive room overlooking the lake (beautiful view) and Navy Pier - Friendly staff - Complimentary breakfast for business travelers on Wednesdays (although breakfast was very light, and bagels were stale) - Nice outside sitting area for breakfast Negative - Setup with the bathroom is odd - has window into the bedroom, but I was alone so that didn't matter - If your business is in downtown, plan to spend $10 each way on a cab - Hotel is not convenient to the train station - Acura experience is only available from noon to seven; so won't work for business travelers; and the Acura doesn't pick up from locations, just takes you places Overall, the hotel was good, and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “W Chicago, close to all attractions!”
Reviews.Author: rayzer70
Reviews.Content: We arrived here not knowing it was the weekend of the air and boat show and so there was lots of people as this was right next to the lake. The front desk seems to always be busy but it moves pretty fast. We didn't ask for any room service so can't rate the service. The beds were made each time we came back. Like many of the other comments, the rooms are a bit smaller but very contemporary styling. Beds are comfortable with clean sheets.
