The washrooms has wooden blinds and a wooden sliding door which would be good for couples but not for business companions or families. The showers were strong with the rain-shower head. The hotel seems to cater to younger people but that didn't deter us (we have 2 children) since we saw some 4-5 yr olds there too. At night, the downstairs bar and the rooftop bar gets a little crowded so the elevators takes awhile. Late at night we'll see a bunch of young adults who seems to be drunk and just hanging by the valet parking throwing up and yelling. This hotel was close to Navy Pier and main streets for food and shops. If you do drive, I would not suggest to valet park since it's very expensive. What we did do was park in the outdoor parking lot closeby which is much cheaper. Overall I like this but don't love it. I would definitely try other hotels next time around.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special, noisy room”
Reviews.Author: ror57
Reviews.Content: When I booked a "Wonderful room" I setup some expectation, based on the price(!) and the hotel site. This was the mistake! If you have low expectation the hotel is OK, similar to an average 3 star hotel in Europe. The location is an argument and most probably the only one. I had a room at the 19th floor, with a view to the city not to the lake. The room was clean and the service carefully done. But the furniture is obsolete, the air conditioning is from the first generation extremely noisy; somebody had the idea to "provide" a window to the bathroom so that if you open it you can see the bathroom, or if you are in the bathroom the room. Personally I prefer a functional bathroom, with a good ventilation not the whole room like a bathroom. Internet is 14$/day in the room and free in the lobby (if is working). To resume is an expensive hotel for the condition offered but probably everybody should pay for the view over the Lake Michigan and this is the justification for the price. If possible avoid the breakfast, expensive too expensive; there are a lot off places around where you can eat

Reviews.Title: “south beach in chicago”
Reviews.Author: Pat C
Reviews.Content: Generally I would grade this hotel as average. The room was a little small but overall this was not an issue. Beds were very comfortable, room was clean and view was good. The biggest issue with the W is, in my opinion, the lobby area. Music from the 1st floor bar area - which is in very close proximity to the check in desks - was VERY loud, making it difficult to even hold a short conversation in the lobby or the bar. The hotel only has 4 elevators to service 30+ floors, so a twenty minute or longer wait at check-in time happens often I'm told. There were about 25 people waiting for an elevator one afternoon - not acceptable! The hotel staff is dressed in all black. I'm used to suits, ties and a more professional demeanor, not the casual atmosphere offered by the W staff. My wife made an appointment with a manager to see a suite only to be stood up! Not totally displeased with the W but would probably not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but it's trying too hard to be "hip" and "cool"”
Reviews.Author: Californianative123
Reviews.Content: I stayed here, and it was a very nice hotel. The lobby was ridiculously loud. I could barely hear the check-in person speak to me, and I was about 2 feet from her. The bar area was so loud that it was like you walked into some club. The elevator ride up has more club-type music, and then the rooms themselves are like a club. It's a little too much. I go to the W hotel in San Francisco, and it's similar, but this is like too much. It's just so loud, it's ridiculous. The room itself is fine. Nice W bath products, good shower, very clean. The bed is clean and comfortable. This location is great, with a phenomenal view over Lake Michigan. Overall, it's a nice place, but it is trying just a little too hard to be a nightclub instead of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAFF, GOOD FOOD, BEAUTIFUL VIEW”
Reviews.Author: likebeingwarm
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my overnight stay at the W Lakeshore. It was a birthday gift to myself and the staff bent over backwards to be helpful and friendly.They bumped me up to a room with an unbelievable view of Lake Michigan. the room was smoke free with an excellent king size bed. The restaurant was good for lunch. The concierge (Ramon) was very helpful in finding an odd time good lunch destination. The bliss toiletries are a nice touch. I wouldn't hesitate to stay again. It's a pleasant walk to Michigan Avenue. I booked for $127 taxes included on hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Great view and price”
Reviews.Author: JG4969
Reviews.Content: Using hotwire, I managed to get this room for $107 on a weeknight. The hotel was so accommodating. Our bid on hotwire only guaranteed a room with a king bed OR two queens. Once I arrived, I requested two queens which the hotel promptly agreed to. I then asked if it were possible to have a Lake Michigan view. I was told that because I went through Hotwire, they do not assign lake view rooms. However, they gladly agreed to see if one was available and upon finding one, assigned us to the room. The view was spectacular. Looking at the lake, the boats and the Navy Pier was a special treat. The lobby and outdoor patio and rocking chairs for gazing at the lake made this one of the nicest hotels in Chicago I have ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: McKennaElisabeth
Reviews.Content: I had a great trip to Chicago at the end of August. It was a perfect weather weekend which made our location at the W even better. The hotel is across the street from the beach and down the block from a Starbucks. Coffee in the sand over looking the skyline of Chicago. Yep, couldn't get much better. The hotel itself will be going through a renovation this fall which it needs. The room was nice, clean and had lots of nice amenities. One strange thing was the shuttered window in the bathroom. As I was sharing with a friend and not my husband, it was a point of amusement each time one of us was in there. No privacy. It's location can't be beat. Though a car is at your disposal, it is an easy walk to Michigan Avenue shops and restaurants. I'd recommend the stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good ....... Sometimes like a disco”
Reviews.Author: Mantad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Hotel Lake Shore Chicago from Sept 8 to 12 2011. The hotel is very nice and the staff is very helpful. The hotel is a hip boutique hotel and would appeal to couples and business travelers. The W is located on the lake and is close to shopping and good restaurants. I would highly recommend that when you are in Chicago you book a Chicago Greeter through Chicago Tourism and take the Chicago Architecture Foundation River Cruise both are excellent activities. The only down side to the W is the price of incidentals like parking and drinks at the bar, which is outrageously expensive. Most hotels in the US offer free in room internet but here its $14.00 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, trendy place”
Reviews.Author: MikeHam
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the end of a recent business trip. The hotel is the perfect base to explore Chicago, walking distance to most of what you want to see. My room had a great view over the beach to the lake. The bar has a good buzz in the evening and serves good cocktails. Brakfast was just OK, service was a bit slow but finally acceptable. The hotel is just arounf the corner from the MCA which is well worth a visit. I would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the Young Crowd”
Reviews.Author: ejl804
Reviews.Content: Good location and nice rooms. However the clientele is fairly young and the noise level in the halls can be annoying. Had to relocate my room due to heavy partying in the next room @ 2pm. Entring the hotel lobby @ 11pm you are bombarded by loud music as the bar is part of the lobby. Not my style.

Reviews.Title: “They Went the Extra Mile: We'll Be Back”
Reviews.Author: davelayman
Reviews.Content: My wife and kids and I had planned to fly out to St. Martin last Saturday for a long needed vacation to chill in the sun, but Irene shut down JFK and there was no way we were flying anywhere for a least a couple of days. So we decided to get in the car and drive west. Turned out weather.com said the weather in Chicago was great so we decided to spend a week chilling on the lake. Trip Advisor showed us the W by the beach and Navy Pier, and we set our sights. I called and booked 4 days. After a night in Cleveland I looked at my email to confirm our stay and saw that we were actually confirmed at the Marriott in Biloxi, MS! After a call to Starwood we were put back on track and they not only rectified the situation they made our escape from the hurricane to the great city of Chicago completely worthwhile. It wasn't St. Martin, sure, but the vibe at the W was hip and inviting. While it appears that the hotel is soon to be renovated to keep with the cool image of W, it was cool enough for us. In fact, the staff went the extra mile to make sure we had a great time, so much so we even decided to stay an extra night. I don't know who said this wasn't kid-friendly, but the staff and service was completely great for my 2 and 6 year old girls. They loved the servers in the outdoor seating of the restaurant, the pool was great, and the people were kind.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Could Use a Little More Privacy Please”
Reviews.Author: LVLVtotravel
Reviews.Content: Good location. Nice lobby bar & rooftop bar. Very good workout facility. Bliss Spa was wonderful. I had one of the best massages ever! Beds were comfortable & room was not noisy. We were on a girls' trip, and had a room with two beds. There was adequate space. My only dislikes of the room were that there was very little privacy in the bathroom as there were literally shutters opening into the main room from the bathroom. And, there was insufficient light in the bathroom and room (even with sunlight coming in) when needed.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worn around the edges.”
Reviews.Author: ColonelLiles
Reviews.Content: I tend to like W hotels for their sparse modern design, but it feels like the Chicago W on Lakeshore is using W's design tricks to cover an aging hotel. My room had a great view and was clean, but felt a little threadbare in places. The drains in the bathroom ran slow and there were places where it had been patched and repaired several times. The lobby is nice. The roof bar has a nice view and a very attentive staff, but it still feels like they're masking a worn-out space with low/blue light, sheers, etc. The price was lower than typical, which makes it a good enough value, though. I'd stay here again on business if the price was on the low side again, but would choose elsewhere for a longer stay or one with my wife.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best W's”
Reviews.Author: colnagoroadie
Reviews.Content: I've been to many from NYC, South Beach, San Fran etc and am Starwood Platinum.....but this W is one of the better ones. Maybe not the very best, but certainly up in the top 3 or 4 for me. Service great, food excellent, rooms large and clean with great views and good location. I really look back and do not have any complaints with this one and would recommend it and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: kacunningham
Reviews.Content: Do not book this hotel unless you want a several month credit card fight on your hands. Booked & paid for this hotel using points. Then they charged credit card anyway upon check out. Have been going back and forth for 4 months now to dispute the second charge via the credit card company. It is still unresolved and I don't know how much longer it will take to get it resolved.

Reviews.Title: “Service Beyond Expectations”
Reviews.Author: hoosiertreker
Reviews.Content: I find that even the most well-respected luxury hotels have only typical service standards these days, making the W on Lakeshore a true standout. Upon arrival members of the team struck up casual conversations with members of my family. Then throughout our visit, they used what they learned to personalize our stay. For example, we mentioned that we had stopped in Chicago for only a couple of days because my son wanted to get home to his dog. Later, we were pulled aside and he was offered a chance to play with the hotel's dog. Also, we tried to book theatre tickets, but the timing didn't fit with our schedule. That evening we were offered a selection of musicals to watch on DVD in our room. The valet even left a cold water for each of us in the car whenever it was brought to us. Everyone knew our name and they all went out of their way to make our stay excellent. As for the room, it goes without saying that it was well appointed. The decor was a little quirky, but fun. There was a kaleidoscope on the desk and a big fuzzy cube pillow and other unexpected touches. The room was very comfortable and the Bliss products are awesome. Overall, the hotel has a youthful, cool contemporary vibe. We enjoyed it all. Oh, and if you don't mind the mild sales pitch, use the Acura Experience -- free transportation around downtown in an Acura MDX. It's a kind of a strange arrangement, but everyone gets what they want -- Acura a chance to show off their car, The W a likely product placement fee, and I got free transportation in a clean car and skipped the dirty taxis with the wild drivers. If you are considering this hotel â€“ GO!

Reviews.Title: “Not so great.”
Reviews.Author: in_easttown
Reviews.Content: I really hoped it would be better than it was. Things were honestly a little rough around the edges. Dirty carpet in the hallway. Our bathroom wasn't perfectly clean. There was something all over the back of the bathroom door, might have been mousse or shaving cream, might have been something gross (don't know). 2 of the pillows had mildew stains on the pillowcases. There were, however, plenty of pillows in the room so we just set those aside. There were dirty smudges on the bathroom walls around the light switch and the door frame. This kind of stuff shouldn't be overlooked at a hotel in this price range in my opinion. I probably should have complained but we had a full day of activities planned in the city. I did complain about the bedside lampshades, though, which were tattered. The one on my side of the bed had several holes in it that looked like burn marks. Not very attractive and also made me wonder if it was a fire hazard. I thought maybe the light bulb was burning through the fabric. I honestly would not recommend this hotel. The decor is updated and very trendy but our room was not in the best condition.

Reviews.Title: “THE only place I stay when in Chicago - simply, Amazing”
Reviews.Author: woofdoc31
Reviews.Content: I think I just had my 60th stay at the W Chicago Lakeshore in the past three years. I am in Chicago quite a bit, so I love the location, the views, the restaurant, the service, and the walking distance to just about everything...especially Michigan Ave. The GM, Heather, manages both this property and city center. She is a joy and by far runs the tightest ships off all Starwood Properties where I stay. She is a joy and always manages to find time to make each visit feel special. It all starts off with Donnell meeting you as you check in - then the bevy of Latina Beauties (Jackie and Co.) who check you in. It helps being a Starwood Platinum and they NEVER fail to upgrade you if the room is available. Entertainment is all around and this property is a magnet for celebrities - sports, music and entertainment. Simply stated, it is the ONLY place I stay when in Chicago. I have tried others...nothing compares.

Reviews.Title: “W, Lite - Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: BTNHome
Reviews.Content: Great lake view, location, nicely designed, spacious. The service ranged from very good to fairly cold. The room was acceptable, but not of the calibre I've come to expect from the W organisation. The minibar was just cooler than the room. The charge for wireless was $14.95 PER DEVICE, which is really obnoxious when you're paying Hotel W prices for a Holiday Inn standard of room. To add insult to injury, after paying for multiple devices, there is only two electric sockets (on 1 wall plate), so you can't keep all your devices charged. Coming from the UK, we need to use converters, which adds a bit of bulk, so that you can't access both sockets at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for the Chicago Air & Water Show!”
Reviews.Author: MOMOsan_309
Reviews.Content: With an incredible view of Lake Michigan and overlooking Navy Pier the W Hotel was a fantastic experience for our family. We required an ADA accessible suite which was located by itself on the 7th floor so we weren't able to acquire a connecting or adjacent room. We had an additional room on a higher floor. The suite was a large two room area complete with a 1/2 bath for guests visiting (so the BR area wasn't invaded at all by visitors). We spent most of our time in the suite since we had several visitors join us to watch the Air & Water show. The suite had a great view of the passing jets and aircraft throughout the day but we weren't close enough to take in the "water" part of the show. There was a 7th floor outside deck for guests to view the show but rather than pay the $25 per head admission to stand with alot of people on a smallish deck area. We chose to remain in the private confines of the suite (that offered an equally great view without the very loud noise of the jets). During the summer, Navy Pier hosts a fireworks show on Wednesday and Saturday evenings. It's a spectacular view from any lakeview room! We breakfasted at the street level Wave restaurant out on the terrace. Beautiful weather and fantastic people watching as we enjoyed our juice, coffee and breakfast. In the evening we chose to again sit out on the terrace for cocktails and light dining. To our grandchildren's delight, Lake Shore Drive was entertaining with cool cars, motorcycles, double deck tour buses and the horse and carriages driving by. The Magnificent Mile is a 10 minute walk from the hotel. The riverwalk is a nice walk away too.There is a small beach right across from the hotel and Navy Pier is very close as well. Rush Street is nearby but I'm not certain how far as we didn't adventure out much since this was a quick overnight stay and specifically for the Air & Water show. The location of the W Hotel provides great access to many great sights, restaurants and shopping. We didn't have an opportunity to visit the Whiskey Sky (Rande Gerber) on the 33rd floor, but we did take the kids to the pool for a quick dip (the pool was pretty yucky in my opinion). There is also the well renown Bliss Spa located on the 8th floor that offers a huge range of treatments. By the way, the bathroom amenities in all rooms are the Bliss product line (one of my favorite body butter products!) Needless to say, you pay a pretty penny to stay at the W Hotel, but it's worth it for the location and view!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Go!”
Reviews.Author: Janie79
Reviews.Content: I travel to Chicago several times a year for business. I have had clients stay at the W Lakeshore assuming the hotel would be very nice. I stayed there for the first time last week and it was horrible! I had to change rooms once because the room was so dirty. The comforter had large dark stains and the bathroom was filthy. The room was smaller than the rooms I get in NYC. Someone informed me that it had previously been a low budget hotel before The W. That explains a lot. I ordered room service of 2 eggs over easy, breakfast potatoes and toast. The food was so salty all I could eat was the toast. Upon checking out I was waiting for my limo to take me to the airport the valet's were so busy visiting with each other no one notices that my car had been sitting there for 10 minutes. Call me crazy but I expect a little more for $300.00 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Only OK. Beware of parking!”
Reviews.Author: Reyes11377
Reviews.Content: Before even staying at the hotel I had sent two separate emails to the hotel regarding requests and I never received a response, so before arriving I was already leery of the hotel. I prefer to stay at W Hotels, but this particular one was a little disappointing. Upon arrival, the customer service was up to the usual W standards, which I very much appreciate. The room however was dark and I did not like how the bathroom was set up with a large window opening that used shutters for privacy. Perhaps other folks would find this chic, but I didn't like it. Overall the room, was a little worn. The most unattractive part of the hotel is the parking situation. I am from NYC, so over-priced is a fact of life, but $53 dollars a night, plus astronomical taxes, made parking almost as expensive at the stay itself. I stayed at the W City Center in Chicago last year and didn't pay nearly as much.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but reflects the age of the building”
Reviews.Author: RugbyTraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to spend 3 nights in Chicago for a brief vacation and selected the W because my wife had stayed at the W in Austin and loved it. I had visited W hotels in other cities and liked the lobbies and energetic atmosphere so I was interested in finding out more about them. The W on Lakeshore Drive is not in the heart of the downtown area, but it is conveniently located and a short walk from most of the major sites. It also is right across the street from Lake Michigan, which our 12th floor room overlooked, great view of the beach, which was constantly busy. Overall, our experience was very pleasant, but the hotel is an older building (someone told us that it used to be a Days Inn), which the four really slow elevators reflected. From the hotel room, you wouldn't have any idea about the age of the building - everything was clean, modern, and state-of-the-art. Only real complaint is that you have to pay $15 a day for in-room internet (free in the lobby) - Katy Perry, whom I understand refuses to stay in a hotel that charges for WiFi, has it right- there is no reason a high-class hotel should be charging for WiFi nowadays. On Friday night, the lobby bar was hopping and was an exciting place to hang out before a nice dinner on the town. One of the best parts of the hotel stay was the free Accra delivery service the hotel arranged. We had free rides from the hotel to any place within five miles of the hotel in a brand new Acura, which was great for our trip to Wrigley Field and to dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: adougla2
Reviews.Content: I love W Hotels! The W Lakeshore did not fail me. The staff was on top of things. We were quickly checked in to our room on a high floor and my hypoallergenic room request was accommodated. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom well stocked. The bathroom had this odd wooden window, so it may be awkward if you aren't sharing the bathroom with someone you don't hearing you in the bathroom. A manager informed us they are going to be undergoing a major renovation and those windows were be gone. We visited the gym a couple of times. It could be bigger, but was clean and had nice extras so it was great. We enjoyed our stay. The dark lighting and funky music was enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, needs some small improvements”
Reviews.Author: adiandrea
Reviews.Content: I spent the weekend here for a bachelorette party. The hotel is beautiful and we were lucky enough to get two adjoining rooms with a lake view. the rooms are decorated impeccably. Unfortunately, the one flaw in the room was the windows into the bathroom. They make it so you have no privacy when going to the bathroom. You can hear everything even if the shutters are closed. I wonder if this is the case in all rooms. The other issue that we had was that any time we asked to have something brought up to the room, it took FOREVER. We were sent a surprise from the husband to be and the surprise was ruined when he had to keep calling us to see if we got it. We had to call the hotel and keep asking them where it was and why it was taking so long. The same went for other things we asked for, we had to continually call for status updates on where it was. Other than these small issues, and the humid lobby, everything else was great.

Reviews.Title: “Staff really hustled for cabs during downpour/convention”
Reviews.Author: goodnamesaretaken
Reviews.Content: The W hotels try hard with new trends that I am sure the 20 to 35 year old traveler finds interesting. The last time I stayed at the Chicago mid city W , tbe lobby and check in was by candlelight and the hallways were so dimly lit I had a hard time seeing which end of the key card went in the reader. this was not a power outage! The Lakeshore W was a little more appealing but it is geared to the younger travelor. Call me an old fogie, but I don't like loud music in the elevator or the lobby. The room was quiet however, comfortable and shower was excellent. Room service was swift and actually tasted good. But where I give this hotel high marks is getting a line of 50 to 60 people waiting for a cab during a downpour and a city completely sold out to convention goers some transportation. The guys just hustled. They tried to match people up in cabs and brought out the hotel vans for some of the guests. I groaned when I saw the line, but had a pretty short wait given what was going on in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: heidiyoung07
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Modern, kid-friendly. Nice but not stuffy. Great accomodation, great pool & great food. The location is wonderful -- close to the beach & all of the fun activities on Navy Pier. We'll be back during our next trip to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel stay that I can remember!”
Reviews.Author: HMarkey
Reviews.Content: This seems like a renovated older hotel that is trying unsuccessfully to be hip and trendy. I had issues from check-in. There were dirty cocktail napkins on the floor of our room and stains on the headboards of both beds (gross!). The room was small and the bathroom did not have a real door. Instead, there was a bamboo sliding door and a window with shudders. I could hear everything my co-worker was doing in there like I was in the room with her. We took to running the water to get a little privacy. This trip was work-related, and I had a tax exception form that needed to be applied to the room in order to get reimbursed for the cost. I called when I made the reservation and was told to present the form upon check-in and everything would be taken care of. I did so, and the front desk told me that everything would be fine. However, when I checked out, I was informed that the state of Illinois does not do tax exceptions for hotel stays. When I asked for some type of documentation to show to my employer, I was told to go to the state's website and find it myself. Lastly, when the charges hit my credit card after check-out, there were extra fees applied for mini-bar charges that we did not make. I have called four different times since my check-out on July 22nd. Twice I left messages with accounting that were not returned, and twice I was told that the charges would be reversed immediately. So far, nothing has been done. I almost always stay at Starwood Properties and have never had a complaint. However, this hotel was, by far, the worst I have ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: danaboo
Reviews.Content: We had such a great time in Chicago! Between the food and the architecture we had a ball. The W Lakeshore was everything we could have asked in a hotel. The room was definitely large enough for the two of us and the staff treated us so well. Location wise-it was a little out of the way but I'm glad our friends had a car. Beautiful hotel and beautiful city. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “We ALWAYS stay here when we visit Chicago. . .”
Reviews.Author: Januarybride01
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, their service is second to none!! Love the happening lobby, love the warm vibe, love the Bliss spa (make sure you schedule your appointment before you get there), love the location! They also have an indoor pool, a great patio to overlook the lake, and a fully stocked gym. The only negatives are that they don't have coffee makers in the rooms (but they do have coffee in the lobby in the mornings) and the bathroom with a "window" (with wooden shutters that open and close) is kind of weird. We stay here exclusively on our trips to Chicago whether it's for business, romance or a family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great W experience, outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: dsenden
Reviews.Content: This is a great W hotel. The locations and views of the lake are outstanding and you're a quick walk or cab ride to Mag Mile shopping, restaurants and bars. The hotel's lobby is upscale, confortable and trendy, without being over the top. I love the rocking chairs outside on the patio. Great touch of comfort. The guest rooms are the same, trendy and fun, but still very comfortable and usable. Great desk space, although I do wish there were more plug ins near the bed for charging phones/ipads. The bathrooms are a bit on the small side, but they've done a great job with the layout for functionality. If you're traveling with someone, the shutters separating the bathoom from the bedroom could be a little too revealing, but I found it refreshing that you could see the lake and get natural lighting as well. Again, outstanding views of the lake from that side of the building. Also, the AC in the guest rooms is outstanding. The management is doing a great job with training because the associates are friendly and genuinely interested in your comfort. While I was waiting on an elevator, one of the mini-bar attendants was standing there as well. He asked how I was doing and during our conversation, I mentioned how hot it had been in Chicago this week. He gave me a bottle of Fiji water and said 'stay hydrated out there'. Very nice touch. On a subsequent day, another associate was riding in the elevator with me down to the lobby. She was engaging and fun. She asked if I was having a good time in Chicago and I said I was actually a little tired from multiple events. She said, "well let me buy you a drink at the bar so you can relax a bit before you're off again". I declined, but again, GREAT staff interaction. This service team isn't all glitz and show, they know how to service customers. My key stopped working during my stay so I called down from the elevator landing to ask for them to deliver another key. The security patrolman was friendly and worked quickly. He checked my ID, which is the right standard. A challenge that was handled perfectly. The valet guys in the drive are spot on as well. Efficient and friendly every time. the Acura MDX program is very cool, although I didn't use it on this trip. I would absolutely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Right across the street from Navy Pier and Lake Michigan.”
Reviews.Author: Jojo810
Reviews.Content: Very trendy upscale hotel with contemporary decor. Looks like a great spot to hang out if you're vacationing without young children. 2 bars. Valet Parking is a bit pricey at $53.00, but you do get in and out privileges.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, comfy, pricey”
Reviews.Author: Ace4294
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night while on a quick visit to Chicago. The location is great. Awesome views of the lake on one side and the city center on the other. Very close to Michigan Ave. and easily within walking distance to most major attractions. There is a nice beach right across from the hotel. There is an indoor pool and an extensive workout facility. The room was comfortable and quiet. My only complaint would be the fee for the valet parking. $53 for one night of parking seemed excessive but perhaps that is the norm in that area. If you're looking to be close to the water then this is a good option for you.

Reviews.Title: “Damn good for being free!”
Reviews.Author: Steferny
Reviews.Content: I used my SPG points to book a room for my girlfriends and I and we were very impressed. Our "city view" was not impressive but we all enjoyed the room - mostly the beds - and felt their freebie toiletries were good quality. We shared a few small plates and drinks at their lobby restaurant which was priced decent and absolutely delicious. We stopped ourselves at one cocktail at their skybar as they were $16/each - couldn't say much about the decor and atmosphere there though as it was pitch dark. The location was very ideal and the concierge boys were incredibly helpful. I suppose the front desk would have been more helpful had we been paying customers but we were happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, did not live up to 4 star standards.”
Reviews.Author: jtrinh
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the W for a weekend retreat to Chicago. We reserved and prepaid for a King bed wonderful room. We ended up checking in an 1 1/2 hours after the check-in time. Even being 1 1/2 hours later, they didn't have a room available for us. They gave us drink vouchers for our trouble. When we finally got our room, it was 2 doubles and not a king. All they could say was that they overbooked and what we could do was ask for a king tomorrow. The hotel was nice but I expected much more from a 4 star hotel. I don't think anyone asked if they could do anything for us for the inconvienence. I'd compare the service to a Holiday Inn. On a side note, the elevators were terrible, parking outside of valet was unclear and the Acura Experience is limited.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Get Enough of the W Lakeshore”
Reviews.Author: sminter23
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is just fabulous! I arranged the stay for my group of 7 women for a bachelorette party overnight. After letting the booking agent know we were staying for a special occasion, planned to use the Bliss Spa and have dinner at their on-site restaurant Wave, they gave me a very nice discount on the rooms and free breakfast for two (a big plus for the bride and a lucky friend the morning after!) Arriving on a Saturday afternoon, the valet and bell-man whisked my SUV and all our bags to our connecting Wonderful Rooms (yes, connecting at no extra charge!!) The concierge even sent up a complimentary desert tray-- such an unexpected treat! At dinner at Wave, the chef sent over complimentary champagne-- another amazing treat! And the dinner was just delicious. All the plates are appetizer size and are meant to be shared with the table. (The basil parmesan balls are the best) And later that evening one of the ladies realized she had forgotten her contact solution and case, which the front desk quickly provided for her. The next day we had treatments done at the very relaxing Bliss Spa (just an elevator ride away-- so convenient!), grabbed some coffee at the Starbucks down the street and had a very pleasant drive home. I have been to this hotel several times to use the spa and to have lunch, but this my first time staying. It was a very good experience and I recommend it to anyone staying in Chicago. I know I plan on making another weekend trip there this fall.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views and Location”
Reviews.Author: Kzoo50
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel on Hotwire, great rate. The hotel is only a ten minute walk to Navy Pier and Michigan Ave. Plenty of great restaurants within walking distance. The room itself was very nice with many amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, wonderful room, solid location”
Reviews.Author: sd_in_switzerland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at several in Chicago during a Thanksgiving "Meet the Parents" trip, and this was by far the best one. In fact, this was one of the favorite hotels we have stayed at (and we travel a lot). The upsides were, the amazing view of Lake Michigan and Navy Pier. We felt like we were sleeping in the John Hancock building. The room was also very elegant and comfortable, which is a tricky combination to achieve. We also enjoy walking, so the location was absolutely perfect as it was just a pinch of a distance to the central shops etc (but I can imagine it would be tricky if you have young children). The only downsides that we experienced was that we did not think the restaurant was that fabulous. The hours were very limited if you wanted to eat at odd times (i.e. because of jet lag), and if there is a vegetarian in your group, you will find their options are quite limited. You're better off eating outside the hotel. Overall, however, a thoroughly enjoyable trip.

Reviews.Title: “If it weren't for the Staff, I would not be back! The Staff have Truly made the W Lakeshore my home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: JAG1616
Reviews.Content: To whom it may concern, I noted in this submission, that I stayed in July 2011 because my only choice was to pick a month and a year. Actually July 2011 was my One year anniversary of staying at the W Lakeshore every week and I still have another year to go on this project. I also wish you had two separate ratings for this hotel evaluation, because I would rate each as follows: - I rate the property worse than POOR. - I rate the People (The W Lakeshore Team) Above EXCEPTIONAL!! This property is in probably one of the worst conditions I have seen, especially considering it is a "W". Very sad to see that is has been allowed to get so run down. With that said, the view is fantastic and the People are Phenomenal! I am leading a long term project in Chicago and collectively we have had over 100 traveling team members staying in various properties around the city. While I have choices and even other choices with a view of the lake, I have chosen to stay at the W, every week, now for the past year, PRIMARILY because of the PEOPLE!!! The phenomenal W Lakeshore Team!! Your valuable team has truly made the W Lakeshore, my home away from home! I know I should be submitting a separate entry for every person listed below; however, my time is extremely limited and these acknowledgements are a result of many nights and many experiences at your hotel. It would be difficult to isolate each one and remember the specific dates in a separate note, but believe me, they are all real experiences and are memorable moments I have carried with me each week I walk back into your W Lakeshore hotel, just like tonight. I trust that this note will result in equal recognition to each of the staff named herein who have made my experience at the W Lakeshore memorable and easier to be away from home. If possible, would appreciate a confirmation as such. - Linda ONeal: Truly one of a kind, sincere, genuine and acts with pride as if an "owner" of your property - you are lucky to have Linda! She has gone out of her way to take special effort to care for my team members and I, in sickness and in health. AND our spouses when they visited us on the weekends we had to stay over. Always greeting our team by name. Truly a role model and mentor for others! A phenomenal lady! - Danyel Davis: very hard worker, both gracious and thoughtful; Always greeting our team and our families by name with a smile and willingness to help make our stay at the W Lakeshore, the best it can be, given our crazy week after week travel schedules. A true role model for others on your W team! - Romon Gomez : Talk about family....my husband, Gary, came into town to visit and went to a cubs game while I was working. The weather was unexpectedly extremely cold that afternoon and Ramon brought his personal overcoat for Gary to wear to the game.........unbelievable!! A true testament to how much your staff at the W Lakeshore Care about your patrons. Always smiling! Always greeting by name and even from afar as we are walking through the lobby. Genuine! Precious Asset to your W Lakeshore. - Donnel Clayton: The most professional and considerate! I see him everyday! always consistently pleasant and went out of his way to help the team get taxi's in bad weather) - Roger Moore: The best smile ever! Roger has been one of the bellman who has picked up my bags and stored them every week for the past year. always prompt, positive and a bright smile to start the day!) - Arlene Hampshire - The pleasant voice on Thursday or Friday mornings when I am checking out for the week. She was instrumental in helping me quickly locate my blackberry that I left in the room when I checked out one Thursday. She went above and beyond to contact security. - Renee ____________do not have Renee's last name, but would like her recognized as well. She and Arlene are phenomenal! You need more like them answering the W/W line. It was either Arlene or Renee can't remember exactly which one, but know it was one of them who took my call after I left the hotel one morning during this past year and thought I left the iron plugged in. I called and they immediately followed through to get someone to check the room. - Darrius Doss - security: so very helpful in locating my blackberry in my room and returning to front desk for colleague to pick up - Dwayne Campbell - security: Dwayne and Darrius worked together to find and return my blackberry. They backed each other up at shift change and it was like clock work!! a matter of less than 45 minutes, all was coordinated and blackberry was at front desk ready for pick up. - Steven Carter: Always a smile on his face! Greeting by name every time he is there when I come in from a challenging long day on the project site. Haven't seen Steven for a few weeks but know that you need more like Steven!! - Alex Turan: I frequently see Alex when I am getting out of my taxi in the evenings. Always smiling and always greeting by name. Haven't seen Alex for a few weeks but also know you need more like Alex!! - Uriah ________: I do not know Uriah's last name but wanted to also acknowledge his excellent customer service. Over the course of the year he has from time to time, picked up my luggage at the end of the week and stored it over the weekend. Always prompt, greeting by name, efficient, pleasant smile and professional! - Daniel Martin: Smiling Dan! Can't tell you how much I have interacted with Dan at the front desk. Works so hard and so many days, but you could never tell it by the way he treats others. He is always pleasant; always smiling; and always looking for ways to make your stay less conflicting. Goes out of his way to ensure follow through on requests made. A superior manager! - Jackie _______: do not have her last name but she is always saying good morning to me from the front desk. Always pleasant! Always smiling! What a great way to start your day when you are day-after-day, at a hotel without your family versus your own home. Jackie is a true role model for others!! - Ashely Seaverson: Ashely is often at the front desk when I check in for the week. Always smiling, inspite of the craziness in the lobby and always greeting by name. very professional and pleasant. You are lucky to have her at the W Lakeshore - Ashley Sarpong: I do not recall ever meeting this Ashley, but I have to say, that she has been instrumental when I have had issues with the room (stale, moldy smells, plumbing problems, blind problems). Can't tell you how many times, there have been issues and she just happened to be on the other end of the phone on W/W line when I phoned to express my concern and ask for assistance. Very patient and helpful! Excellent follow through! - Kevin Carlin: I finally met Kevin a few weeks ago; although I have exchanged emails with him almost weekly over the past year. Talk about genuine commitment to excellence! His follow through and confirmation feedback is phenomenal. His efforts have been key to many positive experiences at the W lakeshore, inspite of the constructional/cosmetic issues of the property. In addition, Kevin has gone above and beyond to help ensure pleasant experiences at other starwood properties when my husband and I were able to get away for a couple of weekends. Excellent customer service!!! You are lucky to have Kevin at the W Lakeshore - Michael_________: not sure what Michael's last name is but he often delivers the coffee/tea service to my room to use for the week. He is always prompt and pleasant. Always greeting by name with a big smile! - Rachel__________: not sure what Rachel's last name is but she sometimes delivers the coffee/tea service to my room for the week and is also extremely pleasant and genuinely willing to follow through to ensure my stay at the W Lakeshore is enjoyable. - Housekeeping staff: I know of two Maria's, (do not have last names) that I have interacted with that have been most pleasant and efficient in their duties. Unfortunately, these are the only staff names I have in housekeeping but if at all possible, I would like for someone to go through my stays and see who have been assigned to my rooms and provide acknowledgements for a "consistent" job well done! These valuable employees often go unrecognized because you never see them, but the work they do is instrumental in the overall experience at the W Lakeshore. Can someone please provide confirmation of the staff that are ultimately recognized for their efforts. I Do Not want to submit this recognition note without getting confirmation that these folks will also receive recognition. Such hard workers and all putting their special touch on making the room sparkle as much as possible, given the current construction condition. - Cynthia Destafano: I have never met Cynthia but know she is most effective at her job. Many of the individuals acknowledged above are mentored by her. To me, it is most important to acknowledge those leaders behind the scenes who make a difference by the way they mentor their team! Thank you Cynthia! - Heather Steenage Hart: I would be remiss if I did not acknowledge Heather. I have also never met Heather, although I feel I have just through my interactions with her phenomenal team at the W Lakeshore. This property truly is in such bad need of repair which is acknowledged by all. Staying here now one year and still have another year to go on this engagement, I can tell you honestly that I would not be staying at the W Lakeshore if it weren't for the W Lakeshore Team! I attribute this exceptional, consistent behavior to Heather, a most effective and clearly a respected leader by her team!! I know I have probably left some individuals out and for that I apologize in advance. I have stayed at the W Lakeshore for over a year now and my formal feedback is way past due and should have been submitted every month. Every month, I would have ackowledged these same individuals. I would sincerely appreciate it if each of these individuals could be acknowledged and equally recognized for their valuable contribution to your W Lakeshore hotel and the Exceptional, Consistent, Customer Service experience shared!! Thank you again to the W Lakeshore Team for making this weekly experience feel like my home away from home! With My Sincere Appreciation, Jackie Edwards P50720250958

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: dan9190
Reviews.Content: Why anyone would stay anywhere else, is beyond me. The room was perfect, service great, food wonderful...but more importantly, the staff seems to sincerely care about their guests! What a concept! This one is a winner!

Reviews.Title: “Hip and lively, good location”
Reviews.Author: grapegirl26
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I went to Chicago for the Fourth of July weekend just for a fun trip and we had a great time. We were so glad we chose this W instead of the other one which is i the financial district and there was of course nothing going on in that area on the long weekend. The W Lakeshore is right across the street from the Navy Pier (on the other side of the Lake Shore Drive highway but there's an easy underground tunnel to walk through) area where there's lots of people watching to do at anytime of day. I've stayed at a few W hotels and this one was quite similar to the others and was what I expected. Hip, sleek, trendy and pretty lively in the lobby and bar areas. Too bad there's only an indoor pool. We had beautiful weather while there so we didn't want to swim indoors. It's an easy walk to the Magnificent Mile/Michigan Avenue, to the river, to the touristy sites. We didn't see too many restaurants nearby but there's Starbucks and 7 Eleven for all your convenience needs. There's a long strip of beach right across the street that is popular with locals and tourists alike. Service was great and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for business, not sure i'd ever stay here on my own dime”
Reviews.Author: liisaco
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a conference...It's a nice W-right across from Navy Pier with fantastic views. Staff is friendly, and for the first time I utilized their free Acura driving service-very nice. The restaurant was delicious, although I would really not pay $25.00 or more every day for breakfast if I was paying for it myself, but it was good and they had great service. The room was also standard W, but had WAY too much of a fragrance sprayed through the room. Since I was on such a high floor i couldn't open the windows to air it out, so I had to leave the door open. I was informed that it was their 'signature scent' they spray after cleaning the room. I asked them to please refrain from using it during the rest of my stay and they did. I also had problems with the a/c in the room and they were fixed immediately. Upon checking out I found that they had charged me separate internet access for my ipad and laptop, which isn't expressly stated when you sign on. They did end up refunding some of those charges, though. So, overall a nice hotel, it is a W so expect a lively bar and club scene. A nice treat to stay while traveling for work, but i'm not sure i would stay here on my own dime...only because it is geared more towards a party atmosphere and I just don't relax as well there. Otherwise, nice hotel, nice staff, great views.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive though elegant!”
Reviews.Author: TusharSrivastava
Reviews.Content: Situated right right next to Navy pier, W offers a beautiful view from every room- be it sunrise, sunset or boats sailing across the river. The rooms are rather small and untidy for the kind of rates and the food is passable. The crowd at this place is always cool and classy for any time of the year. All in all, you wouldn't regret staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Navy Pier”
Reviews.Author: JulesWisconsin
Reviews.Content: Room was small but adequate. Beds were very comfortable,and lots of pillows. Bathroom with the window was different, but it was ok for one night. Don't think I would stay any longer. We didn't spend much time in hotel. Lobby atmosphere isn't comfortable with kids. There is a McDonald's around the corner, which was convenient for breakfast. Easy walk to/from Navy Pier with an underground tunnel about a block away. Convenient after the Navy Pier Fireworks. Pool was small, comfortable temperature, but deep (4-8ft). Location is ideal for Navy Pier, also can take water taxi from downtown. $10 cab ride to Willis Tower. Parking $53 at hotel. Park at Navy Pier instead $20.

Reviews.Title: “Air condition in the room is too loud”
Reviews.Author: Tonee92
Reviews.Content: Is you want to have a good silent night sleep this is not a good Hotel for you. They have this old air condition unit in every room that make a loud noise. Not a good Place to stay during summer in Chicago. They sent someone to fixed the problem But the guy said that he can't fixed it since all the air-condition unit in this hotel is too old. Location is good but at the end of a long day , I prefered to have a quite night rest.

Reviews.Title: “July 4th Holiday Weekend - Just an "Okay" W Property But Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SURF4FUN007
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a renovated (old) Days Inn Hotel on Lake Shore Drive. They have a nice bar in the hotel lobby, although they WILL NOT make any blended drinks (they claim no blenders, although they are right next to the restaurant). The front desk staff not very helpful, very robotic. Rooms are small and as others have mentioned a bit dated and worn. We needed a new comforter since the one on the bed was dirty and stained in several places. Bathroom was interesting, it had shutters that opened up into the room and you couldn't help but hear everyone doing their "business". Great location to Navy Pier and Michigan Avenue shops. A bit on the pricy side -- bottom line, and I hate to say this as a SPG Platinum member, but there are better places to stay in Chicago in the same price range as the W. Most likely will not return to this SPG property when in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view, but not best location, not ideal for children.”
Reviews.Author: cindyroman
Reviews.Content: A very modern facility on the waterfront. The views of Lake Michigan were beautiful. However, the location is about seven city blocks from the subway, so it is necessary to do a lot of extra walking when seeking out the major Chicago attractions. This is not an ideal family hotel. Returning to the hotel in the evenings, the lobby was abuzz with drunken twenty-year-olds and loud techno music. The room was nice, comfortable and clean. However, there is no privacy in the bathroom. There is a window in the bathroom covered with wooden shutters, and the sliding bathroom door is made of woven wood.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean rooms, very trendy”
Reviews.Author: Travlr54
Reviews.Content: Be sure to ask the parking rate before you book so you don't get the sticker shock of $53 per night... for your car. Other than that, this hotel is very nice, sleek, and modern. The hallways use LED lighting, but leave the halls a bit dark. If privacy is your thing or if your are modest, you need to know that the bathroom in your room has wood blinds and a pocket door separating the living space and bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “very convenient and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katefu
Reviews.Content: Although you need to be under 30 to really enjoy the scene here the rooms are very nice and service very good.

Reviews.Title: “Party Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vidigital
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel for anyone that likes to party or enjoys the club scene. It just wasn't my cup of tea. The W Chicago Lakeshore was booked through Hotwire as a secret hotel. I have never stayed at a W before, and after this experience, I probably won't be staying at another one. The hotel was fine, but the general ambiance and overall brand doesn't match my personality/travel style. I have absolutely no complaints about the service. It was friendly and professional, the room was clean and well appointed, and I really loved the Bliss toiletries. Evenings in the lobby turned into a club-like atmosphere, loud, dark, and lots of dressed up singles. Luckily I requested a high floor and wasn't bothered by any noise. By the way, bring your iPod since there are docking stations in the rooms. There is free wi-fi in the lobby, but otherwise you'll have to pay $15 to use it in your room. The location of the hotel was fantastic, right on Lakeshore overlooking the lake. It's a few blocks from Michigan Avenue, and getting on public transit requires walking a couple of blocks. There's Starbucks, 7-Eleven, Corner Bakery, and Panera in the neighborhood, as well as Fox & Obel, a high-end grocery store. As a lone traveler, I felt safe, even at night to walk around.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the W!”
Reviews.Author: MH13
Reviews.Content: The W Lakeshore is a busy place, but the staff was very friendly and helpful to each and every guest. The rooms and furnishings were beautiful. All around a great weekend. (And we loved our view of Lake Michigan!)

Reviews.Title: “The best place to hang out in a fun and relaxed trip”
Reviews.Author: Nesh16
Reviews.Content: The W Chicago Lakeshore made my trip one of the most memorable ever. The rooms have a beautiful interior decor making it ideal for couples to hangout. The lake facing rooms provide a scenic view to Lake Michigan. Being in the heart of downtown, it is close to shopping and recreation area. Its pub on the top floor is the most amazing part of it and makes for a perfect place to end the day in fun and frolic.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: egellman
Reviews.Content: Great nightlife. In the heart of downtown this hotel gives you a comfortable feel, great rooms and a wonderful and courteous staff.

Reviews.Title: “bamboo window panel is disgusting, and you can hear people in the next room talk...”
Reviews.Author: patrick20102012
Reviews.Content: I'm not a very picky person and my base line for a hotel room is- keep it clean. . But I have to I've had my worst experience in staying here. Look at the pictures I've taken and attached. It seems that they never clean they curtain panels so that they are full of stains and mold. EWWW...it's disgusting, imagine you have to sleep a whole night facing the whole panels. I am allergic to dust mites and when I stay on the bed at night I began to sneeze. I sneezed so hard and I almost shoot my lung out. Plus, you can hear people in the next room talk, it's like they are staying in the same room with you.

Reviews.Title: “awesome location”
Reviews.Author: rahulmehta86
Reviews.Content: the hotel is situated exactly opposite to lake Michigan the most beautiful attraction in chicago. It has beautiful indoor swimming pool and fabulous ambiance. It provides Acura car for drop off and pick up anywhere across city within 5 miles of radius which is an excellent customer service. you have many chain restaurants around the hotel and main thing is it is inside downtown so its all in a good place to be. take care of PARKING....its very expensive. Be ready for street parking.

Reviews.Title: “Ugh, tired, run down AND ups the charges!”
Reviews.Author: thegrlnxtdr
Reviews.Content: This crusty old building needs to be torn down before it falls down. They tried to sexy it up with W style but sorry not even moody lighting or copious amounts of thick paint or expensive zorel wallpaper can cover the ramshackle interior left over from the 60's. Air conditioning was struggling mightily throughout the hotel, the narrow kitschy lobby was sticky and overwhelmed with tourists luggage by day, and jammed at night with boozy sweaty desperate looking men. The weird disco brothel vibe, made me glad to see the card reader in the elevator to control who goes up to the rooms. Even then the drunk girls stumbled noisily in, giggling down the hall to their rooms at 5:00 in the morning. My room A/C wasn't working, they managed to find another room with A/C that worked but sounded as if a dump truck was idling in my room. A relic from the 60's. On checking out found they had added over $130 to my room charge, along with a mysterious snack bar charge. Front Desk told me they couldn't change my room rate but would issue me a credit. A warning to all of you road warriors that don't double check your bill!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Robolo64
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at a W and I throughly enjoyed myself! First, physical attributes. 1. The Living Room was pretty cool. Although the space is somewhat limited, the use of the space is done well. The design, furniture and layout are lovely and intuitive. The decor is as trendy as you'd expect from the brand. The apples and cookies are a nice touch. 2. The room was better than I expected given how inexpensive a rate I booked. I had a room with two double beds (was traveling with my brother) and I'd say it was just less than 400 square feet. Probably the standard room, but the city view was nice (see attached photo), the washroom was very nicely appointed with Bliss amenities and the room didn't have the "just on the edge of needing an overhaul" look that so many hotels have. I felt very comfortable in the room. 3. Sleep quality: the beds/mattresses are first rate. Pillows were great for me but I could see how they might be a bit thick for some. Hotels usually have thinner options if you call. 4. Pool and Fitness Center (what W calls "wet" and "sweat" respectively) were done well. The indoor pool was much larger than I thought it would be but seemed a bit bare-- kind of austere. There was a menu placed next to a lounge chair if you felt like a snack whilst swimming. The fitness center had great, modern gear and had a wonderful aroma about it. The television signal going into the fitness center was weak, but no big deal. I wasn't there to watch TV. Plenty of towels, apples and nice Bliss wet-wipes aplenty. 5. Restaurant: We only ate at "wave" for breakfast, and I was very pleased. My sourdough French toast was wonderful and covered with loads of fresh berries. My brother's omelet was delicious. The food arrived much quicker than I thought it would and was quite reasonably priced given the urban markups prevalent. My French toast was about $12 if I remember correctly. Service was good. The staff is very friendly-- the gentleman (I wish I remembered his name!) who was refilling our water made extra effort to make friendly, unobtrusive conversation about my laptop, of which type he also owned, as I Facebooked while waiting for food to arrive. Those were the only physical aspects of the hotel we experienced. Although we took a peek at Whiskey Sky, we didn't go in; neither did we even take a look at Bliss spa. On a side note: the location is great for families. You are right next to Navy Pier and about 4 blocks from the fantastic shopping of Michigan Avenue. Now for the best part: the service! 1. Arrival: We were greeted by the staff on the front drive and welcomed at the front desk by a very helpful young lady named Bridget. She was kind enough to put us in a very high floor and wished my brother a happy graduation-- I had called ahead to notify them of the surprise nature of the stay. Believe me, those kinds of personal touches, even when requested in advance, can be very difficult for staff to follow through on simply because they are so busy. I appreciated the effort. Bridget offered us bag assistance and we declined since we were traveling so lightly. 2. Concierge: I really, really wish I remembered the name of the fabulous concierge who assisted us Monday night, the 30th. I called to ask if Gino's East takes reservations. They do not, she said, but offered to give me a preferred seating voucher. She helped set us up with a ride in the Acura Experience. This was the highlight of our trip-- we were driven in style to the restaurant, dropped off like VIPs, found the wait staff to whom we showed our voucher, literally WHISKED to the front of the line and were seated immediately, then given free garlic bread, all because we were referred by the W! My brother was blown away. That made our trip. **Remember that the Acura Experience will only give you rides TO somewhere, not pick you up. Bring cab fare or be prepared to walk back. They also only give rides until 8:00 PM. Reserve a ride as soon as you know when/where you want to go. We got a time roughly close to when we wanted to leave but I got the impression that if we had asked sooner, we would have been able to book sooner. 3. Whatever/Whenever: these folks were great. After Gino's East (which is unbelievable, you have to go, but go to the Superior Street location), we had leftover and nowhere in the room to place it. I called Whatever/Whenever and was assured a fridge would be sent right up. 15 minutes later, voila! Mini-fridge in the room. Awesome follow-through. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. I was looking to treat my little brother to a graduation present/experience and the W delivered. What was best was that it didn't seem like they had to try that hard to make "extraordinary" happen for us. What I mean by that is that they just did what they normally do--provided great personalization, follow-through and service. I can tell when excellent is the norm and when it is the exception. Here it is the norm.

Reviews.Title: “Just for the Whatever Whenever”
Reviews.Author: Umski
Reviews.Content: This is a W that needs an overhaul (and 'am told it will get one soon). It does not look too great from the outside nor is well designed on the inside. Its a conversion of a lesser brand hotel but Starwood could have done a better job. The Lobby living room does have a buzz - but then there is no where else to go. the Whisky bar on roof top is hardly one to rave about. The rooms are tired and the bathroom could give the bath tub the miss. But then, why did I enjoy my stay? Simply put - the service, the food and the "whatever whenever" experience. I can forgive everything else just because of the wonderful interaction with the people running this property- may it be the "ambassadors" at the door or the Managers. To me that's what branded hotels are all about. The Food and Beverage at the W (where ever I have stayed) has never been a disappointment and this property too lives up to the standards. The Coffee mornings are a treat - specially sitting outside the living room over seeing Lake Michigan. Conveniently located - withing walking distance of Michigan Ave. and Navy Pier - are a definite plus. Hope to visit it once its gone through a refurb.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for little kids near Navy Pier.”
Reviews.Author: kiel_99
Reviews.Content: Easy access to great locations. Lobby very sheik. Love getting fresh apples.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, fun Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ilove-europ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were at the W for 5 nights in the end of April. We chose it due to our Starwood membership and proximity, but would highly recomend it since we didn't even use our points for the trip. The service was excellent. They helped us find restaurants, bars, drivers and boat tours. They went above and beyond. The wake-up calls were great because they let you "snooze" and would call back 15 minutes later!! Nice touch to ensure we wake up! Room serveice is 24-hours a day which is nice for late night food. We ordered food at 3 AM on night and it was very quick. The bar upstairs was super fun at night and ever the "lobby" bar had a DJ and was really fun. I would say that this hotel is more geared toward adults who want to have fun. I owuldn't suggest familes especially since the bathrooms don't have much privacy. Overall we liked it and would return but I'm giving it 4 out of 5 only because i didn't LOVE the location when trying to walk. The traffic on Lakeshore was always bad so it took a while to get out of that area. Plus it was raining when we were ther so walking distances wasn't ideal. In summer the location would be better since it's on Lakeshore and the lake view is amazing! Also, rooms are not sound proof and the child next door woke us up almost every morning crying.

Reviews.Title: “This is how all hotels should be run!”
Reviews.Author: carrisEs
Reviews.Content: The best part of my stay at the W was the staff. Everyone was so helpful and accommodating. On my last day in Chicago I found out that my flight was delayed until the next day. The staff helped me book my flight for the next day as well as getting me a room for an additional evening. I was traveling on business for a large convention and received a special price on the hotel when I booked it. When I had to book the additional evening they honored the price without me even having to ask. They simply stated that they would book me for another evening at the same price. The food at the hotel was another amazing benefit. It was incredible and convenient! They also provided delicious coffee in the morning, which is very important to us caffeine addicts. The rooms are beautiful, comfortable and clean. The Bliss bathroom products that are provided for the guests are amazing. I have to reiterate that the staff was what made the difference in comparison to other hotels. I would like to thank the W for hiring incredible people; I hope you pay them well!

Reviews.Title: “Meets your expectations with some flair”
Reviews.Author: drdave60
Reviews.Content: As a former Chicago native, I have a pretty good sense of the city's hotel options - the W on the Lake offers good views, a nice lobby bar, and a good restaurant for breakfast. It is a bit out of the way - very convenient to Northwestern Hospital, but still a good walk to Michigan Ave shopping, etc...Parking is a pain but all in all, you won't go wrong here. The rooms are average but the staff is very helpful, especially at the front desk. Good value for a Chicago hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and attention of Will and Rene at breakfast , all concierge staff, front staff, and housekeeping were A plus .”
Reviews.Author: Sim025
Reviews.Content: I also enjoyed Acura free ride promo as well as being close to running trails, views of Lake Michigan, and various excellent restaurant choices in walk distance. The workout room is outstanding as is the business office room and views. Additionally, the 33rd floor bar was great view for a late cocktail.The staff responded promptly to every request I made. I would definitely return here again.

Reviews.Title: “Did we stay in a different place?”
Reviews.Author: sss128
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 2-night stay at the W Lakeshore. I've seen numerous less than positive reviews, and have to wonder where they were. What they did right: Flawless on early check-in Fixed malfunctioning TV in less than half an hour Followed up with a phone call to ensure satisfaction Room was cleaned efficiently both days Concierge was quick to assist Employees were pleasant and helpful Checkout was quick and easy Many hotels would fall short in most of these areas. While the property is decidedly not cheap; I was not disappointed in any aspect of the hotel. The workout facility and pool were very impressive. I have stayed in another major hotel chain in Chicago; it was an absolute travesty. If you have the wherewithal to afford this kind of lodging, I can't imagine improving on the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: magyarsd
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 days at this hotel and must say it was a delightful experience. Hospitality of EVERY STAFF MEMBER was an A+. The best hotel experience I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Motel quality”
Reviews.Author: MakkaDC
Reviews.Content: The walls are paper thin - every conversation in the room and next door can be heard. From level 30 the traffic was still clearly heard. The bathroom may as well have no door. The staff - from the concierge to the bar waitress to the spa receptionist, could not have made it clearer how uninterested they were. The hall carpets look cheap, the dark decor is just dingy, and the only members of staff who were genuinely interested in providing service were at breakfast. Appalling would be too kind

Reviews.Title: “Nice view”
Reviews.Author: euanross
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as we were looking for a hotel with a view over Lake Michigan... and we certainly got it. We booked a suite for 3 nights and we were on the 17th floor out of a possible 30+. The room was spacious and clean with one large bathroom/shower room and a further toilet located off the living area. Whilst breakfast wasn't complimentary it was very reasonably priced and the food was good so we ate there each morning. Location wise it was fine for us. We were by the water but had a 10/15 minute walk to Michigan Avenue. I've given location 4 out of 5 as it was close to the water which is what we wanted. If you wanted to be close to downtown Chicago then it was a little walk. Whilst there was free wi-fi in the lobby area, you had to pay for wi-fi in rooms, something that I don't like when many hotels offer it free. If I was visiting Chicago again, unlike other hotels I've been at, there is nothing really stand-out that would make me re-visit. That said, there is nothing that would prevent me from staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect oasis within Chicago limits”
Reviews.Author: elansp
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business for a week. As others have mentioned, super trendy hotel, nice bar scene, very friendly service. I don't have status at SPG properties but I smiled on check-in and was given a corner floor room with direct lake/Navy Pier view. Gym was nice, a bit small but typical of city hotels. The pool was fine for a quick soak. Even though this is a city hotel, its in a residential location on the shores of Lake Michigan. Under 10 minute cab ride to the Loop. 10 minute walk to Michigan Ave. Almost across the street from Navy Pier. I wil be back...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, avg rooms, very trendy and can be loud- great service”
Reviews.Author: BiotechCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My title of the review says it all.. Lake Shore Dr is a great location- I originally had a more expensive Lake VIew Room - I realized that the view of the lake at night is basically looking at blackness- I moved to a city view and enjoyed this much more. Chicagos skyline & buildings are incredible and beautiful.- opt for as high a floor as possible and a city view. Note this is a verytrendy hotel- the lobby at night is a zoo- very busy and loud bar scene. The party(s) seem to carry into the hallways and neighboring rooms all night- as I am there for business- I was not thrilled about this! The service is pretty good- The "Ambassadors" (bell captains) are perfect. I think its a good idea when I first check in to have one help you with something (I needed help with room change) and tip them well in advance- this way you have someone looking out for you for the whole trip. The rooms are a bit small- nice beds, well appointed - just a bit small. Caution about parking at any Hotel in DT Chicago - its expensive! $53 night at the W-

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Stay at the W”
Reviews.Author: floydWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a long week end at the W hotel Lakeshore, we were travelling with another couple and we all had the best stay. Everyone from the front desk, wait staff, and concierge were great, no complaints at all. We loved that the lobby turned into a night club at night, very funky. We were made to feel very welcome by all staff we came across. We loved the recommondations from the concierge regarding the restaurants, we wanted to try places that were a bit off the map and we were not disappointed. I think you would have to be a bit naive to think that there might not be some sort of loyalty regarding where they recommend. I would not hesitate to recommend to anyone, we did see a lot of kids around, but this is not really a kids hotel, candles everywhere, dim lights, funky music..not exactly kid friendly. This is more of a sexy, grown up place to get away from kids!

Reviews.Title: “Sorry to say - this was my worst Chicago experience”
Reviews.Author: mtarasyek
Reviews.Content: I love Chicago and visited for business/pleasure multiple times and stayed in different hotels. I really wanted to introduce Chicago to my husband for his birthday. Well, let's just say it did not go smoothly. First of all, the hotel seems to be in a huge need of a maintenance facelift. The lobby appears to be small and cluttered, the room is an OK size, however doesn't offer as much as a coffemaker! When we arrived, half of the lightbulbs in the room were out, and the toilet wouldn't flush, unless you held the handle down for a while. The furniture looked scratched and worn......Not a big deal. and we were only staying for 2 nights, so we never called front desk........however it never happened to me in other Chicago hotels (similarly priced). Secondly, I booked through Travelzoo, 4 months in advance, and it clearly stated in my promotion e-mail that there is a bonus parking rate of $30, instead of regular $53. When we arrived, the front desk clerk claimed that there is nothing in my confirnation e-mail to prove discounted parking. Well, I managed to find the original promotional e-mail from Travelzoo (back from January 2011), and went downstairs to show it to the manager. Her only response was: "They (Travelzoo) misleaded you, and this is not the parking rate we offer with your room rate". Well, that's great - I would've never booked your hotel, if I knew the parking is $53!!!??? There were plenty of others, centrally located, with free parking offer!! The only reason I booked yours was because I wanted my husband to enjoy the lake view on his birthday! After some back and forth communication, the manager agreed to dicount ONE night to Travelzoo promotion rate. Very gracious indeed - but that is not what I subscribed for...... Well, later in the day we went to check out the pool, which was also one of the main reasons I booked this hotel - my husband enjoys swimming and I wanted him to have it all on his birthday. The hotel included sauna and whirlpool in their website description, however all they had was a fairly small pool - no hot tub, no sauna, no lockers either!! The only place you could change in the health center facility was a single M/F bathroom :) To top it off, the pool area was full of families enjoying alcoholoc beverages on the premises (I don't have anything against a little relaxation, just don't feel it belongs to public areas:) Needless to say, we left and never came back. Later that night my husband decided to go outside for a late night cigar, and I joined him. When we were returning back to our room, a person emerged in front of us, demanding our room keys!! Seriously??!!! I realize they care about safety and security of their guests, however their elevators are already programmed to work only when the valid room key is inserted into the elevator slot! I stayed in many hotels in US, both for business and pleasure, some of them in best room Guidelines (50 character maximum) Chicago, and was never treated like that! So much for Midwestern hospitality I bragged to my husband about all these years! :) Just a quick highlight - on the way to the jazz club we were heading that night we got lost and ended up in the foyer of the hotel I stayed last time I visited Chicago (a few months ago) - Sheraton Chicago Hotel and Towers. The hotel concierge was polite ans gracious, gave us the precize directions, needless to say never asked us for room cards, or anything like that. Well, the bottom line is - if you want a quality stay - book anywhere else. This hotel does not have neither capability nor integrity, that come with the deal. The bottom line - if you can book anywhere else for the same price - run and run fast! If this is the best price you can get - prepare to be (unpleasantly) surprised.

Reviews.Title: “The W Lakeshore is not what it markets itself as.”
Reviews.Author: thomjohnson42
Reviews.Content: My wife, myself, and our friend all booked one room for the week we were visiting Chicago in mid April 2011. We're all mid 20's and often frequent bars and clubs, so a hotel attempting to turn it's lobby into a "sexy" night club with very adult themed bathrooms and suggestive signage on the mirrors seemed to be more akin to our tastes than say a Hilton or The Peninsula while being affordable as well. The rooms were nice enough, location was incredible, short distance to a starbucks, walking distance from nearly everything in the river north neighborhoods and 5 blocks from a train station.
