Room service was well done and our belongings were often straightened up in a very care-taken pattern and our privacy was well respected (except for the morning when room service entered our room while we were all still asleep at 7 am). We were left to ourselves most of the week which is what we wanted, but when we did interact with the staff, most of it was awful. The concierge is only interested in suggesting businesses that offer some sort of kick-back to the hotel. After being told on our first day to check out Yolk for breakfast after check-in and walking there to discover a 30 minute wait and rude staff as well, we walked two more blocks and were sat at West Egg Cafe immediately and had one of the best breakfasts we had the entire trip. A few days later after asking again for a good Chicago pizza & pasta place that wasn't too expensive, and being sent to Rosebud which was $30 a plate, we used google on our phone and found the famous Gino's East merely half the distance to the hotel than we were told to walk and again felt more comfortable there than at home. They have no interest in suggesting what's right for an individual, only for their networking and feedback. The complimentary Acura dropoff service was fantastic and those drivers were some of the nicest service we had form the hotel all week, unfortunately they were Acura employees and not affiliated with The W at all. As for the pool, if you want to go for a late night dip after a few drinks in their dimly lit, provocative bar (which takes up more half of the downstairs lobby, oh, and half of the upstairs rooftop view as well... and is called Whiskey Sky) and enjoy a view of lake michigan while relaxing... good luck finding your way through the screaming children. In the 7 nights we were at The W not a SINGLE one was free of a swarm of 7-9 year old children screaming and splashing about until the pool closed at 11 pm. I know they can't control who stays at the hotel and everyone has a right to all the amenities, but when we question the desk whether there was any time we could use the pool without being harassed by babies, we were simply sent away with a shrug. We even asked if it was at all possible to keep the pool open for private use simply 30 minutes after hours and were told that was impossible. Don't offer "Whenever/Whatever" service if you're not able to deliver. Bottom line is we booked The W under the expectation of a somewhat professional adult atmosphere and were left to a week of self-indulgent, paper-thin customer service, hiding behind a mock-up of class and arrogance, surrounded by the exact type of travelers we wanted to avoid and only felt comfortable in Chicago outside of our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything You'd Expect From a "W"”
Reviews.Author: GoinAwol
Reviews.Content: Everything is exactly what you'd expect from a great property like Starwood's W. The late nite scene was kind of dead but I was there for work so it didn't matter to me at all. Perfect rooms, service and the price was right too, comparatively to other W's like Boston's.

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel with great service and clean, stylish facilities”
Reviews.Author: ELM2426
Reviews.Content: Early 40's, I stayed here for two nights and found the service exceptionally nice, the common rooms clean and stylish and my room spacious and clean. Everyone from the bellman to the room service delivery person and front desk staff were as nice as they could be. They have a small-ish pool very clean and warm and good for kids. The gym was immaculate and modern. Every morning there is great free coffee in the lobby. The only odd thing is in the room there is a "window" between the bathroom and the bedroom that shutters block off but it's weird. Would be weird if you are staying with a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves it's mediocre rating.”
Reviews.Author: Familyof5in5states
Reviews.Content: Went to Chicago on business, stayed there 2 nights as it was were the customers booked. Had never stayed at a W before, but expected much more. Maybe a dilution of the brand now that they have so many locations? Room typical of a nice Vegas-type room, common areas nice when empty, just small when people are around. $53 per day to park your car = ridiculous!

Reviews.Title: “quality hotel! definately stay again!”
Reviews.Author: mickmooney
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend for 5 nights in April (two friends also stayed and agree with this review). Location: Couldn't really ask for better! 5 minutes walk from Magnificent Mile for shopping, 7.5 minutes from Rush Street for countless top quality restaurants. Accomodation: Rooms were a good size and very clean. Don't let the reviews below complaining about the bathroom put you off, the shutters close. The hotel made great use of space in the bathroom and it is well equipped. One of the best showers I've seen in a hotel! The bed is not as good as the Westin Heavenly bed, but those of you who have stayed in a Westin bed will know that it would be very hard to reach that. In saying that, the beds were very big and comfortable! For those men who have had to wait for their partners to get ready, they have a very comfy futon in the rooms for watching tv and having a beer! Check-in / check-out: Seamless. All staff were very helpful and friendly! The concierge helped us with our online check-in for our flight home too! Downsides to the hotel: Very few. The bar is a bit pricey (as are most hotel bars) but the service was always really good and that staff were always very very friendly! If you stay, definately have a drink in the rooftop bar, the views of the city and pier are pretty cool! Added value: Free coffee and fruit in the lobby in the mornings (good coffee too!). They also have a touch-screen computer in the lobby that lets you check-in for your flight for any airline and print boarding passes, free of charge (we were flying Delta so the service wasn't available on the touch-screen, but the concierge just did it the old fashioned way for us). Overall: The next time I stay in Chicago I'll be staying here and I wouldn't think twice about it!

Reviews.Title: “indifference and questionable....”
Reviews.Author: cubfan18
Reviews.Content: We, my husband and two children, stayed at the W Lakeshore for a night in mid March. We booked this thru an online service where you don't know the name of the hotel until you agree to the price. While the hotel was perfectly located for our interests it took advantage of their location and charged a whooping $53 to park which is even high for Chicago standards. Service was indifferent to us as we entered. All of the employees seemed to be talking to each other and took no notice of us. I went to check in and was given basic treatment. Not that I expect to be treated like royalty but this is a 4 star hotel and a simple "enjoy your stay" or even a smile would have been nice. The room was dark and cramped and again, what is with the wood slat shutters on the bathroom???? I don't need to hear anyones "bathroom business" I was horrified that my daughter (9) was intrigued by the service bar and found the $8 box of condoms with a bit SCREW on it among the candy and chips. It certainly implies that this hotel doesn't cater to families or even spouses. For the singles looking to party and hook up maybe.... As for amenities, the pool is nice with the rooftop deck and fabulous view. No coffee maker in the room. Really? This is the W, I shouldn't have to call down and wait 30 minutes to get a coffee maker. They told me they had coffee in the lobby but I was in my pajamas. Maybe the idea is to go get coffee in those little styrafoam cups while your husband is in the bathroom, then the shutters are not an issue. Long story short, other better hotels in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “The W is CHICAGO”
Reviews.Author: kidd81
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel, if ur looking for a hip atmosphere, great service and just all around 5 star hotel. The W has great views of city and lake and minutes from anything and everything will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 85usmc11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing! I had an awesome time there, I would tell anyone to stay here. The man at the door noticed we left a phone in the cab and chased it down for us, he saved the weekend. The atmosphere is amazing at The W, the bar downstairs is close to the front desk and the music fills the whole downstairs, everything was perfect. The rooms are clean and the bed is amazingly comfortable. The W also has a nice bar upstairs too with a great atmosphere. The gym has new/great workout equipment as well. I canâ€™t wait to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Surprise”
Reviews.Author: sdowney1110
Reviews.Content: Walking into this charming and elegant hotel made me feel like I was stepping into a spa where the atmosphere was comfortable and quiet with an oriental flare. I was delighted with the service and room. The room was very clean and cozy. The view was of the lake and Navy Pier, which is always beautiful at night. The food was good. The waiters made dinner and breakfast an event in and of itself. They were very accommodating and made you feel welcome. This is a wonderful romantic getaway. I will not hesitate to go back. Hopefully, not for business.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katefu
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here before and haven't for a few years. I thought it was wonderful for many reasons: room was quiet, lakefront drive access easy, pool very pleasant, "Living Room" bar lobby great for sitting and drinking although a bit pricey for drinks, whiskey bar is fun even if you are old, etc!

Reviews.Title: “Strange blinds between room and bathroom”
Reviews.Author: 26d
Reviews.Content: Although this is a lovely hotel in general, the partition between the bedroom and the bathroom is only a wooden blind, therefore you can hear everything that is going on in the bathroom! I was sharing with a friend and we would turn the tv on very loud to prevent the embarrassment of hearing the other person excreting! Other than that, the rooms are nice and modern and the 'wave-jito' in the bar is lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Too old to be "hip"?”
Reviews.Author: PoisonPrincess
Reviews.Content: Being aged 55 - 60, my husband and I knew that we were not the target market for W hotels. However, this W was a location where we wanted to stay, and we are loyal to the Starwood brand. We stayed 2 nights---Sat. & Sun. nights. We anticipated some noise, and we were not disappointed. This hotel had both pluses & minuses. Pluses: great location and excellent housekeeping. This hotel is very clean, and we appreciated that. Minuses: noisy, service not great. Saturday night, there was a lot of noise during the night as people returned from their evening out, and talked loudly in the hallway. Sunday night, the hotel seemed nearly empty, so it was much quieter. The worse noise, however, was in our room. Although the thermostat was on the wall, the blower for the air handling system was one of those boxes under the window. It was VERY noisy, and not particularly effective, as the room was drafty throughout the weekend. Even with earplugs, the roar of the fan bothered me. Finally, the service was hit and miss. A room service order came incomplete. Check-in was particularly annoying. The young lady working at the Starwood Preferred Check-in line waved us up to the counter, but then continued to handle a phone call plus another customer's question while we stood there. When she FINALLY was free to wait on us, my husband politely asked for an upgrade since he is "silver" level with Starwood. She said she would see if one was available, and then just gave us our reserved level with no explanation. One might expect her to say something like, "So sorry, we are full tonight" (unlikely, since we made our reservation 2 days before), or "We are full tonight, but could upgrade you tomorrow night.". We both observed that she was clueless, and did not pursue an upgrade. The whole check experience was annoying. We appreciated the free morning coffee. Finally, I assume this is part of the "W" brand, but we found the names of things----extra roll of toilet paper called "Back-up Plan", exercise room called "Sweat", concierge called "Anytime - Anywhere", just a bit "twee". Don't you?

Reviews.Title: “Better than the average W”
Reviews.Author: dupedtourist
Reviews.Content: I used Starwood points for this weekend stay, so I can't comment on the prevailing prices but like most Ws, it had a younger clientele, an upscale decor, modern furnishings and constant, annoying disco music playing in all common areas. Unlike most Ws, the lobby was bright and well-lit due to the large glass windows overlooking the lake. For my money, Lake Michigan is not all that scenic but the lake view (a block away near Navy Pier) is a feature of this property. The downside to this location is the total lack of drive-in space for picking up and dropping off passengers and the frenzied valet scene. Barely 3 cars can fit in this area and you will be rushed out by the attendants to find your way amongst a maze of one-way streets. NOTE: You can only drive in heading south on a frontage road that parallels Lake Shore Drive. When I checked in, I was given an upgraded room (I'm SPG Platinum) on the top floor but found that there was a disco bar on that floor and the room was near an elevator, so I asked for a different room. The clerk was outstanding. She found us a suite on the same floor as the gym (8th floor?) that was the only guest room on the floor and was at the opposite side of the building from the gym. She even walked us up to the room so we could inspect it. There were conference rooms on that floor, so be aware that if those are busy, this location may not be as quiet as our stay. The bar on the top floor was pitch dark and had minimal seating. SPG, please stop making Ws so damn dark. It's not relaxing or trendy, it's depressing and annoying. When checking out, we found that we were charged for internet service (it's supposed to be free for Platinum guests) and for parking on a night that we didn't even have a car. This took several calls to accounting to fix after the fact. Overall, it's a much cooler place to stay than most of the big city chain options and definitely better than the other W in the loop that has the smallest rooms I've ever stayed in, and this includes London, Paris and Rome!

Reviews.Title: “W Lakeshore has got it going on! Excellent Hotel, highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Kimbo31
Reviews.Content: My daughter lives in NYC and I flew from Australia to visit her and organised a nice little side trip to Chicago whilst I was in the US. I travel extensively for work and always stay in 4 and 5 star hotels when I am away on business and leisure so I consider myself a good judge when it comes to hotel stays. From the moment my daughter and I arrived were were, "wowed." From stepping out of the taxi and being greeted by concierge to checking in with the lovely, Ali to the wonderful cleaning staff, Restaurant staff and bar staff, I could not fault them. Their service and eye for detail was exemplary. The rooms are spotlessly clean and the beds are extremely comfortable. I was really impressed and would highly recommend W Lakeshore to anyone visiting Chicago for business or pleasure. Note to fellow travellers to Chicago. Be warned that the cab drivers are very difficult at times if you wish to pay by credit card. We experienced this every single time we took a cab. The lovely gents at Concierge ended up dealing with this problem when we jumped in the cab at the hotel but be aware that the cabs have to accept credit card.

Reviews.Title: “MANAGER NEEDS CUSTOMER SERVICE SKILLS TRAINING”
Reviews.Author: lala12121
Reviews.Content: For a birthday get-together a group of us decided to stay at the "W Hotel" in Chicago Lake Shore!! After talking and laughing at around 5:30 p.m. we were notld we were being too noisy (I guess you have to whisper to stay the W). Robert, the manager on duty provided us w/3 options: check out the hotel; move to undesirable room or stay in current room and be QUIET. Not an upscaled place!! My money will go elsewhere moving forward.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, perfect location for 4th of July fireworks, lots of issues though”
Reviews.Author: zephyr221
Reviews.Content: First let me start with the positive-- the hotel is beautiful, wonderfully designed and the Marvelous Suite upgrade lived up to it's name-- if only for the fantastic view of the lake and the fireworks. Truly wonderful. Unfortunately, the service in the hotel was nowhere near as good. When we arrrived at the hotel, there was utter chaos in the lobby. There were so many people waiting (to check in? out?) and kids running every which way, no one even greeted us or offered to help with our bags. This is a vast departure from other W experiences I have had. After this we had to wait 20 minutes on line to even attempt to check-in and even though there was a Gold/Platinum SPG line, there was no preference given to elite members. There was an average wait of 5+ minutes (each way) to take the elevator. Particularly in the evening, there was a line stretching out the front door of the hotel, and not a single W employee was in site to guide traffic or assist with the elevators (though the need for such support was clear) and it took 20 minutes of waiting in a hot sweaty queue. We (and many other guests I'm sure) almost missed the fireworks due to this lack of operations management. I realize the hotel was busy with the holiday weekend, but there's only a certain extent to waiting/delays/mismanagement before it becomes unacceptable. On the evening of July 4th, we had to wait an average of 3-4 minutes for someone at the front desk or whatever/whenever to even answer the phone. Also-- there was no corkscrew in our room (crazy when 3 types of beverages requiring one are sold in the minibar) and it took 2 calls and 45 minutes to get one. Later, room service took an hour. Crazy! Finally there were a few issues with the room that made it apparent that housekeeping was not giving their full attention-- the main light in the room (large floor lamp) wasn't working, the TV in the bedroom had its volume limited to about half of the maximum which would be fine except for the fact that the A/C unit was about as twice as loud as that (so impossible to hear TV). The batteries in the bathroom scales were also dead. And the thermostats in the room were completely wacky-- no matter how high we made the temperature, the compressor/AC kept coming on until we were about frozen out. In sum, while our suite was wonderful, the service we experienced was not up to SPG or W Hotel standards. Perhaps it would be better on a regular day that isn't July 4th.

Reviews.Title: “Location, style, cool factor...but..”
Reviews.Author: StayToday
Reviews.Content: Love the location, style, and feeling of the property, the rooms are starting to show some age. Still a good spot, above average, but hopefully they update it soon.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: RDWade
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the W Chicago Lakeshore after my firm's holiday party. I was very impressed by the customer service and attention to detail of the entire W staff. Everybody from the valet attendant, doorman, front desk staff and room service staff were courteous, polite and recognized me by name. I'm a very frequent business traveler and I can honestly say that the service at the W Lakeshore is among the very best I've ever experienced. In addition to the top notch service, the lobby, lounge and hotel room were all very modern, inviting, clean and up to date. I appreciated nice touches like the Tivoli clock radios and large selection of Bliss spa ameneties. Our room also had a gorgeous view of the Navy Pier lights in the evening. Overall, I was very pleasantly surprised and the W Chicago Lakeshore really exceeded my expectations. Highly recommended if you're in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A great get away!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jakbadgers
Reviews.Content: Great location!!! Can walk and see the sights... shopping, restaurants!!! W has great drinks and excellent service ... The New York steak was excellent with the speical onions. Very friendly everyone knew their job!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Most fun in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: grichards1000
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel to stay at in Chicago. The hotel is classy and fun, and the lakeshore views are fantastic. One of my favorite aspects of this hotel is their restaurant. They use a small plates concept, so you get to try all sorts of unique and delicous dishes. I live in the suburbs of Chicago, and like to stay at this hotel as a convenient and fun weekend getaway (it is easy to get from the hotel to nearby shows, comedy clubs, etc...)

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: shoefettish
Reviews.Content: The view of Lake Michigan was superb and the rooms were extremely comfortable and sleek. Stick with the mid to upper floors if possible to avoid the Lake Shore drive distractions.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: Hoosier2005
Reviews.Content: The W-Lakeshore is just that Wow! This Hotel is one of the top hotels in the city! You can't beat the view or the experience! Whatever/Whenever is the saying around the hotel and boy do they mean it!

Reviews.Title: “Shabby chic or just a stinker?”
Reviews.Author: roadster123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W Lakeshore on business. It was, unfortunately, my first W experience. The small cramped lobby is not designed to handle high-flow check-ins and check-outs, resulting in a traffic jam during peak hours. The room was small, and looked like a W-rehab--shabby, surface-deep, and even sloppy at close inspection. For example, the wooden panels which covered one side of the room were so uneven (or the wall behind them was so uneven) that uncovered, uneven amounts of wall peaked out at the edges. The japanese paper lantern that covered the light bulb hanging in the entryway was totally off-kilter. The closet (such as it was) had a curtain for a door. The bathroom initially struck me as sleek--until I realized that it was completely nonfunctional. The shower wall, half the length of the shower, did not keep most of the water in the shower. The sink drain stopper was nearly kaput. And there is some problem with the plumbing venting in this room--as soon as water entered the shower drain, sewer gas could be perceived. Yuck. I would not recommend this hotel to anybody willing to pay this pricepoint.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: olympia39
Reviews.Content: First time at this fairly expensive hotel - tiny rooms, tiny beds, tiny bathroom, tiny bottles of water ($3 each). We could hear the people next door showering, flushing and even understand the words of their discussions - yikes! What's with the bathroom being part of the room? Who want to listen to your roommates use the facility? Halls were dark, air conditioning unit groaned all night like a Motel 6. Hotel is supposed to be hip, but it missed the mark. Add to this - $53 PER NIGHT to park your car, front desk workers who look and act bored, overpriced drinks & food and jack-hammers in the parking garage starting first thing in the morning to vibrate you awake! We travel all the time and stay at everything from the Four Seasons to the Hampton Inn. The W needs to spend more time on providing great customer service and less time trying to act cool.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good w hitel”
Reviews.Author: Jay_Mac_76
Reviews.Content: I used some of my starwood points for my recent stay at the chicago lakeshore w and was extremely disappointed. By far my worst w experience. The attention to detail and service was not up to the level of expectation for a w let alone a Sheraton or lower level brand name. Just a few examples: 1. The staff: We arrived and no one was around to offer taking our bags. Every staff member except the room service delivery person seemed disinterested in even being there. This included the bartender, service staff in two bars, reception desk, and concierges. We ordered a bottle of wine to go. It took ten minutes to get it when no one was patronizing the bar. And that was after waiting 10 minutes in a dead bar before I got up and tracked down a menu myself. 2. Attention to detail: the mats in the elevators that said good morning, good evening, etc. were always thrown in the elevators crooked with corners riding the walls. The iron in the room had its labels were completely worn off so I didn't know what settings were what. The bar on the top floor was layed out in a way that 5 people could enjoy the space so we left immediately. It just did not feel like a w to me and I was upset I wasted my points staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Too cool for school”
Reviews.Author: TonyGambee
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. I brought my wife with me to Chicago and had never stayed here before. It will be our first choice next time for sure. Just driving up, we knew it was "cool". Everyone was super helpful and nice. The lobby or "family room" is a nice place to hang out when deciding where to go, or just to stay in. We had a nice surprise to find the lobby converted to a night club Saturday night when we came back from the Lion King. We stayed in a lake view room.... do it! The navy peir is cool to watch at night and the sunrises are breath taking. Every detail is fun, cool, or convenient. Hint, read the floor mats in the elevators each time you ride. Beds, comfy. People, friendly. Rooms, clean. View, great. Location, good. Truffle Oil Fries, amazing.

Reviews.Title: “We always come back to the W Chicago Lakeshore”
Reviews.Author: CynthiaLenstec
Reviews.Content: When attending a conference in Chicago, our company always stays at the W Chicago Lakeshore because the staff there treats us like family and does everything possible to meet our needs by being attentive, warm and friendly, yet professional. Twice we've held a reception in The Altitude Room, and what a great event each time! Besides the room itself being an exceptional location, the staff makes sure everything is perfect by staying in communication with me both before and during the reception. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This place has seen better days.”
Reviews.Author: LizAndMac
Reviews.Content: It's a W with a bunch of old folks staying. If you want to chill with your parents then, cool. My whole non-smoking floor smelled like smoke and was gross. The fact that I had to call to comment on the smoke, twice shows they have no idea what goes on in their hotel.

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel Lakeshore - First "W" Experience”
Reviews.Author: davidpokey
Reviews.Content: When compared to my usual Starwood stays at Four Points, Sheraton & Westin properties, I anticipated that the W hotel would be more "hip" than any of the others. My actual experience at the W Lakeshore was just that, in terms of the lobby, bar/restaurant, clients & rooms. The quality of the rooms, however, were high quality Starwood, but just more chic. The only thing missing in the room was a coffee maker - this has been standard-issue at the other Starwood properties, but coffee service was complimentary in the lobby. Overall, I enjoyed the W experience & would visit these hotels in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Perfect Location, Dog Friendly”
Reviews.Author: dogpriority
Reviews.Content: This hotel is kind of a scene with party people, and although I am not that sort of traveler, I think this hotel is wonderful for anyone. It is especially great for those traveling with dogs. The hotel very kindly and enthusiastically welcomed my large dog. There is a pedestrian underpass less than one block away allowing access to the lakefront trail for running and dog walking. Great views can be had in all directions from this hotel. It is directly across the street from the lake and the spectacular Ohio Street Beach and very near all the shops of Michigan Ave., and it's easy to grab a cab to anywhere else in the city. I saw friends in Irving Park, which was an easy cab ride right up Lake Shore Drive, and my husband went down to Soldier Field for the Bears game. The popular Streeterville breakfast place, Yolk (which is great!) is only a few blocks away. I used to live in Chicago and have visited a few times since. There are a LOT of great hotels and a lot of great neighborhoods, so it's hard to choose. But, I think this hotel was very nice, and I don't understand how anyone but a pretentious and spoiled person could complain about it. The staff was very knowledgeable and helpful, the room was clean and very nicely decorated, the views and location were perfect, check-in and out were both efficiently and competently done, and they welcome pets! It's a great, well-run hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Second time here - martini-bar chic doing fading fast.”
Reviews.Author: Thinkerer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at both W hotels in downtown Chicago (I'm usually on business and don't book the rooms). If you must stay in one of these, go to the W Hotel City Center which has more successfully maintained its veneer of chill chi-chi martini bar hipness. The only reason for staying at the Lakefront is...the Lake. The view on the lake side is gorgeous, though this can backfire in summer months when the sun comes blazing up a little earlier than most people would prefer. The rooms are quite small ( approx 10' x 25' including bathroom, inset clothes hanging area etc.) and seems best suited for two people who are very good friends. Things seem a bit worn around the edges and the room rates plus parking are pricey to say the least. A great place to bring your significant other for an intimate weekend but it's not really downtown so you'll be having to deal with transportation issues. I'd give it a 3

Reviews.Title: “A former gem losing its luster”
Reviews.Author: Ultraplur
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many W hotels around the world and some of the things that I admire from this Starwood brand are the prime locations, cool and relaxed atmosphere and above-all a world-class execution of the W concept, where things are usually flawless. I am sad to report that the W Chicago Lakeshore is in need for an important service and maintenance makeover and a subtle review of certain other aspects would do it well. This was not my first stay at this hotel (it was the third) although after experimenting around, I decided to go back for another try since my past stays had been very good. I. Location The location of the W Chicago Lakeshore is one of the main reasons to stay there. Only 3 blocks away from Michigan Ave., two blocks away from the river and with everything else in even shorter walking distance, from the Navy Pier, the AMC theaters, the Northwestern hospital/shool, the Playboy headquarters, but above-all being water front to Lake Michigan .The views are remarkable. Be sure to book a room facing the lake from levels 15 and up, the views are really worth it. II. Check-in/Check-out Check-in and check-out services were flawless and the staff at the front desk appears as very weel trained, friendly and accomodating. III. Cleanliness When I went up to my room, I found a baby crib right outside of my room door, which I had to slighltly move to go in and later found out that it had been probably used in the same room that I was using, as I found about 5 baby toy cars behind the television desk. I felt that this was a sign of lack of care from the room cleaning department, but the real shocker came when I was working on the desk and dropped a pen. As I looked under the desk to find the pen, I also found a couple of very old french fries or other similar food item on the floor, which clearly was not mine (I never ate in the room). My conclusion is that there is a severe lack of control and attention to detail in the rrom cleaning service. I felt nauseaous for a bit, but then regained control. ;-) I complained at the front desk and I that I received was a "sorry sir", but no further apology, explanation or, even better, SPG reward points for noticing and, more importantly, informing them so that they can improve their service. IV. Internet and telephone I found that although the cable connection to the Internet service worked fine (not very fast, but decent Ethernet), the wireless (wifi) service in the rooms is useless While the wifi signal is strong enough on the hallways, it is simply not strong enough to reach into the rooms. Three collegaues and I attempted to log-in using our iPads, laptops and Blackberries from the rooms, but all found the same problem. When you complain in the hotel, you are appropriately re-routed to an outsourced service company, that "pretends" to verify the problem only to tell you that the routers are up and running and that the problem resides in your device, despite us telling them that we tried with 7 different devices in different rooms and that the devices could not be the problem. They did not care further and just left us with the problem by literally saying "sorry" (again) there is nothing we can do about this (well, they should!). I asked for a room change so that i could use the wifi service, but still in the other room (as expected) the service did not work. If you need to rely ona wifi connection to work, think of another place to stay. The telephone on the work desk was also not in good working condition. I tried to join a few conference calls using it, but the amount of noise was too much and I ended up using the wireless telephone on the bedside table, which is more uncomfortable to use for long calls and also has some interference noise. The speakerphone on the desk phone did not work. All in all, the business functionality at this hotel was very limited for me. Shabby, I would say. V. Television A big Kudos for the quality of the television and movie services in the hotel. The selection and definition were excellent. VI. Restaurant I have always thought that some W-hotel restaurants lack identity and charm and this is a perfect example. The complicated sharing-style menu is not only ackward and unpractical, but also greatly lacks in taste and coherence. I shared 3 dinners with colleagues and we all agreed that, for the price, there are so many better options (even at other hotel's restaurants and cafeterias) than the "Wave" restaurant. The only convenience of eating there is having your room a few steps away... To top it off, when I was walking out of the hotel one morning, a man approached me with a flyer indicating that the kitchen at the hotel had been found in severe violation of health codes....mmmm.... VII. Room amenities The room amenities shocked me as very lacking. My door was missing the mandatory escape route plan during my whole stay (thank God there was no fire or emergency during my stay...). The curtain covering the clothing area was dirty. There was only one magazine (Michigan Avenue) in the room and not the standard Conde Nast, Time Out or other travel magazines. No in-room dining menu. On hotel-amenities menu/directory, no Spa-menu....mmm is the hotel cutting corners here? No soap bar for the shower.... even more mmmm. At times I felt in a motel and at times the views to Lake Michigan reminded me where I was... VIII. Room maintenance Some parts of the room showed lack of attention to maintenance, from the dirty curtain and lack of escape route plan to the faulty phones, but also, some parts of the wooden wall next to the bed were severely scratched and portions of the wall covering were falling off next to the ceiling. The light in the magnifying mirror on the bathroom did not work, and yes, I did plug it in...., no "do not disturb" hanger in my room (I had to ask a cleaning lady for one and she, rapidly, took one that was hanging outside another room and handed it to me (I just hope that the other guest was not disturbed,as he had wished)... IX. Bar Sad, sad,scene. The once lively bar on the 33rd floor now reminded me of a dark room for mobsters or junkies looking to hide from some one. 4 patrons the most I could count. This entire floor has sooo much potential with those views and location. The hotel management should really get around to making it THE place to be in this part of town... X. Acura service The Acure service, which I have used at many W hotels, was flawless. Not only was the car in perfect condition, but the driver was also very helpful in explaining the features and found interest in us as guests. CONCLUSION All in all, my stay at this hotel has taught me that even the best can fail. The W Chicago Lakeshore failed to deliver a good experience on many fronts to me and my colleagues this time. I did alert hotel employees about each adn every of my complaints witha "sorry" in return...well yeah, sorry to have stayed there this time... The result will most probably be that I will stay somewhere else during my next Chicago stay. The rest of my colleagues that did not stay at the W this time stayed at other hotels and the comments were mixed, however, I am sad to say that the W experiece was the worst of the bunch this time. I continue to be a fan of the W concept and of many other Starwood brands, but for now: Starwood, a review visit is in order for this hotel, seriously.

Reviews.Title: “Girlfriend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: TJM0121
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived (it was very early and they had a room ready for us)--until the moment we left, it was nothing but an absolute awesome experience. We received some great tips from the front desk associate as well as the conceriege recommendations. The Bliss spa is something that cannot be missed! The sangria was also the bestwe had ever had. I would definitely stay at a W again. Thanks to the staff for making our getaway weekend one to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTravelDude
Reviews.Content: This was the single worst hotel experience of my life and as someone who does a lot of leisure and work travel, I have had my share of hotel stays. I actually live in Chicago, but as there was a music festival right downtown and I had some free nights through an SPG promotion, my wife and I thought it would be fun to stay at the W Lakeshore during the music festival. The first night was fine â€“ as a SPG Platinum member I was given a room on one of the top floors with a spectacular view. The second night, however, was a different story. My wife decided to return to the hotel earlier than I, as I was staying out late to see another band perform. She returned to a dark hotel room to have someone jump out of our bed and scream â€œWhat the **** are you doing? Get the **** out of our room!!!â€� Before she could leave the person physically pushed her out the door. According to her, it was the single most horrifying experience of her life. She was in total shock. She tried calling me, but unfortunately the music venue I was at had poor reception. After collecting herself she went to the front desk to explain that inexplicably some people were in our room. The front desk shocked her with their response. We had been checked out of the room because, according to this person, state law required luggage to be in the room for them to charge us for the room. Since the cleaning personnel saw no luggage in our room, we were checked out. Since we live in the city anyway we only had brought with us a single bag and had returned home that afternoon. The front desk person went on to tell her that the place was totally booked and there were no available rooms. My wife went home. By the time I found out I was furious, but it was late and my wife was shaken up and wanted me to come home. I figured it would be best to deal with the manager the next day. When I phoned the following day, all I could get was the managerâ€™s voicemail. So I instead called the SPG Platinum Desk and explained the situation to them. They were shocked and claimed they had never heard of such a policy of checking people out automatically if no luggage were in the room. I explained I wanted to know why our keys still worked if they checked us out and pointed out that my wife was put in a potentially dangerous position by the hotel with how this was handled. I went on to ask why they made no attempt to contact me to notify me I was being checked out by the hotel even though they clearly had my phone and email available. The Platinum Desk told me they were filing a complaint and the GM of the hotel would contact me within 48 hours. Here was the response I received: Good evening, I received your file from Starwood Corporate and I apologize about your experience last night. As you stated, we had your reservation through today but when my Style team serviced the room, there were no signs of any guest staying in the room. I personally inspected the room around 10pm and the room was still vacant. At that point it is Starwoodâ€™s policy that we must check out any vacant room even if their reservation is through the following day. The only way the hotel can leave a room registered is if we were informed there would be someone taking over the room or if there are physical signs of someone occupying the room. Again, I am very sorry that you and your friend had to experience this late last night. I would love to personally WOW you on your next visit to the W Lakeshore, so once you have made your plans and reservations please contact me and I will make sure you have a wonderful experience. Please let me know if I can be of further assistance. Warm regards, Grant Grant Bruce |Welcome Desk Manager W Chicago Lake Shore 644 North Lake Shore Drive |Chicago| IL 60611 t: 312.943.9200 |f: 312.255.4499 [email]grant.bruce@whotels.com[/email] I replied that I had no plans to stay at their hotel again. I said I would like an explanation as to why I was never contacted to be told I was being checked out. I also said I would like to know why, if we were checked out, our key still worked for the room placing us in an uncomfortable and potentially dangerous situation. The following day I received this email from the General Manager: Well Hello There, Thanks for visiting us at the W Chicago - Lakeshore. We miss you already. How was your escape? Did you experience Whatever/Whenever service? Why not whisper how your escape was to us? We would love to hear from you! Email me your thoughts on your visit and how we can grant your wishes in the future at [email]GMHeather.Steenge@whotels.com[/email] Warmest wishes, Heather Steenge-Hart, General Manager I sent Heather my issues with our stay and the same questions I had sent to Grant. I never received any response from either Heather the General Manager or Grant the Welcome Desk Manager. I think for the W to give any guest this treatment is absolutely detestable. And the fact that I am at the highest level of their customer loyalty program (Platinum) says that this status counts for nothing when it comes to common courtesy and respect. I should also point out that the W Lakeshore never credited back the free night that they took away from me by selling the room to someone else the second night of my reservation. When I realized the night had never been credited back to my account I had to again call the SPG Platinum desk and explain the situation to them before I was finally credited back the free night. I would recommend avoiding this hotel and staying at the Westin River North or the Westin Michigan Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Get a room at the front”
Reviews.Author: LiamB27
Reviews.Content: We were in a room at the back of the hotel overlooking numerous air con units. There was no sleep the first night. To be fair the hotel moved us the next moring to a room higher up which did help but I'd say spend the extra to overlook the lake.Also even though the bed was comfortable it is very high off the ground.Make sure to do the architecture river cruise.Have a drink/meal at the Signature Room in the John Hancock Building on the 95th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed by our Room”
Reviews.Author: Loveour2dogs
Reviews.Content: Was expecting this hotel to be as nice as the other W's we've stayed at, but it was quite disappointing. The room had a strange open window in the bathroom which completely limited the privacy, plus it had no exhaust fan. Also the wall paper was tearing off in sections of the bathroom, the fabric chair in the sitting area was torn and there was bubbling in the ceiling. Not to mention there wasn't coffee in our room, nor did the business center allow free internet access and usage. For the price and the expectations of a typical "W" Hotel, this fell way short of expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and BETTER Staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelinWIGal
Reviews.Content: This W has all of the edgy-ness of a modern hotel without any of the pretentious attitude. The staff is awesome. We had a minor maintenance issue upon checking into our room and I swear before the phone was hung-up a very nice maintnenance man was at the door, he adeptly worked, apologized for the inconvenience and let us know how much longer he was going to on that night, in case we still needed assistance. The breakfast at the W Hotel is fantastic, eggs done to perfection, 'not so easy with a medium hard poached egg'...says my friend who cooed over her eggs. At night the small plates with drinks were delectable as the view of Lake Michigan. We were walking distance to Navy Pier and shopping on the Miracle Mile. If we needed a cab it was immediately available. If you're a runner or a walker this hotel has very quick access to the lake park and waterfront sidewalk, you don't even need to cross a street...just go down the stairs that leads to a path underneath the overpass. Easy!

Reviews.Title: “Waste of time”
Reviews.Author: JmaxBod
Reviews.Content: None of my requests were granted at this property, even a simple room with a view of the lake (which I requested days in advance). The acura service a joke and could not get a ride anywhere at anypoint. When requesting a cab at the lobby entrance, I was directed towards the street. No help with luggage was made at any point. Calling guest services often left me on hold or disconnected. Checked out after 1 day. Westin Michicgan ave was a far better property. Don't waste your time here!

Reviews.Title: “Great location to next Navy Pier”
Reviews.Author: Cricket1984
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in August with my boyfriend. The rooms are clean and modern but the shutters that are part of the bathroom wall offer very limited privacy. We walked to a great breakfast restaurant called Yolk and over to Navy Pier. We could see the fireworks from our room the first night and the patio outside the pool area the second night. There is plenty nearby to do and see. Get a Spectacular room for the lake view it is well worth it. We came into Chicago on the Metra which was a $15 taxi ride. Parking is very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Impecable rooms and spectacular views”
Reviews.Author: cricketgo
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel for convenience and style. Lavishly decorated and great ambience add to the room making it most comforting and not feeling so far away from home. Service is great and ammenities fall within my parameters. It is not necessary to cab it to and from night life as this hotel is positioned in a most ideal spot to and from great dining, entertaining and nightlife activities.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad but won't go back”
Reviews.Author: jal52sandiego
Reviews.Content: Before my business trip to Chicago, did usual research on Trip Advisor. Had never stayed at a W property before so open to the experience since I had perceived it as hip, cool, enjoyable, stylish, high quality in rooms and services. Read the mixed reviews on TA. But, because they were more positive than negative, I decided to give it a try. I used Starwood points for my two night stay, btw. Check in was well handled at the desk. I paid $20 additional to have a Lake view and a higher floor. Biggest disappointment was the room itself. Dirty windows which made the Lake view less enjoyable. Room, overall, was average. One can tell that the hotel is just "turning" in the sense that in a little more time, it will look dated and tired and will need a refresh. Room was clean but just not "top quality". Many have mentioned the bathroom with the "shutters" that lead into the bedroom area. Certainly, limits privacy which I didn't like. Room size was average to smaller and, with two beds, it was difficult to move around easily. Did enjoy the free coffee in the morning and did always receive prompt service from all staff. All staff, as well, were friendly and accommodating. Did not have any food and beverage. Location was great. The hotel caters to the "young and hip" crowd and those of us in Brooks Brothers or past 40 in age (like me) were out of place in the lobby bar and in the top floor lounge. I am a Park Hyatt or Four Seasons type of traveler so maybe I should have known better. All in all, the experience was OK but not worth a second visit. If I had had to actually pay for the room, I would have been a bit angry but since I was using points, I put up with what I needed to put up with. Would I recommend it to the rest of TA travelers? It all depends on what you are looking for. If room quality is not top of your list, then you are probably OK with the W.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - once you can find it”
Reviews.Author: Ann_W059
Reviews.Content: First of all I will say make you when you are going to stay at the hotel study your map and have a GPS if possible-so that comment has nothing to do with hotel just make sure you have your bearings. When we arrived the car valet met us was very courteous and gave us exact instructions on where to go to check in. We had asked for early check in and they were very accommodating with that and the room was ready. The elevators do have the security added in that you need you room key to make the elevator function which is a good idea. Our room was on the 23rd floor and was a city view - probably not high enough in Chicago to get a true city view. The room had everything you needed but was a bit small for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: tellitlikeitis21
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the W Lakeshore. It is in a great location walking distance from Navy Pier and magnificent mile. It is a 15 minute walk to the closest red line. The pool and fitness center at this hotel are very nice. My only complaint is the cost of parking, but that is a problem throughout this area of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a designer hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: pianobird
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel greets you with glitter, glamour, and warmth. There is plentiful help right at the door. Inside, the lobby is a work of art married with hospitality. Concierge service always available right there. The room we stayed in had a wonderful view, great decore, and was very comfortable. The bathroom was something I had never seen before. The fixtures were the latest design, and there was plenty of mirror and counter space. The walls of the bathroom were woven wood, and there was an opening with shutters so you could see out and watch tv while shaving, perhaps. Soundproof it was not, making it easy to carry on a conversation with the door slid shut, but not so easy to cover noises you might not want to carry out into the room. There is a super gift boutique just off the lobby with elegant cosmetics and fashions. Staying at the W was a memorable experience. The memory still makes me smile.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: lynzbee
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Spectacular room facing the lake, comofortable beds, great food, super close to the Navy pier. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I had a wonderful experience at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MTL0105
Reviews.Content: Everything was wonderful at W. The location is very convenient for both night life and shopping on Mag Mile. The best part was the staff. They are friendly, helpful and very accommodating. For example, one of my friends needed to load up on carbs for a race and couldn't find anything on the menu so they made her bowl of spaghetti and meatballs.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: hatchling04
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The W when I was in for the weekend to run the Chicago Half-Marathon. I chose the W because the shuttle running to the race Sat. morning was leaving from that location. When I got to the W I realized what a great choice it had been! It was super close to shopping, restaurants, and Navy Pier. The hotel itself had great decor, friendly staff, a great atmosphere, and the bed was super comfortable for a great nights sleep before the race. I will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great for connecting rooms!”
Reviews.Author: ihopeihelped
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at this hotel, and both times I was able to lock in connecting rooms in advance. It may be my gold SPG status, or it could just be great customer service. Those of you who want a connecting room know that most hotels will not guarantee one. In the case of the W Lakeshore, they have many connecting rooms, so I think it is easier for them to do this. The other advantage of this hotel is that it is next to Lakeshore Drive, so if you need to travel around Chicago, it is easy to get on this drive. Other than that, the rooms are small. I do not recommend a standard room for families that want a rollaway. Even with 2 people, it is tight for a longer stay. For example, when one person sits at the desk chair, the other person cannot pass through. There just isn't enough room between the back of the chair and the end of the bed. We are not "hip," so the wrong demographic for this hotel. If I didn't want the connecting room guarantee, I would have stayed at the Westin River North. Still, this was our second time there, so no complaints. When I went to the store in the hotel, they had a poor inventory of pharmaceuticals but were big on fashion. That's the demographic. The first time we stayed there we enjoyed outdoor drinks, and this time we went to the top floor for a nightcap and magnificent view. For the right people, this is a fun place to stay. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hip and comfortable, great location.”
Reviews.Author: TravelinFool93436
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed good service, modern decor, comfortable rooms, convenient meeting space, attentive meeting and banquet staff, and the lounge on the top floor. Great view of the fireworks off Navy Pier. Incredible location. Will definitely be back. The only frustration was the room key cards - sometimes they worked, sometimes they didn't, no rhyme or reason. But that was a relatively minor annoyance.

Reviews.Title: “My kind of place !”
Reviews.Author: 31bailey
Reviews.Content: What impressed us most was the amazing atompshere of the lobby. The cool music and slick furniture gives the place a lot of energy. Also, our wonderful room overlooking the city was fantastic, and the staff made us feel like A-List celebrities!

Reviews.Title: “Impressed with the W”
Reviews.Author: locondcoco
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the W Lakeshore for the Chicago Half Marathon. As the title states, I was pretty impressed. The W certainly caters to a "younger", "hip" crowd, which I believe is the whole idea behind the W brand. The hotel is located across and within walking distance of the Navy Pier. Its also walking distance to many great restaurants. We were greeted as soon as we walked in a escorted to the reception desk. Check in was a breeze. Next to the counter is a little kiosk, which you can print your boarding pass. The room was a little small, but was typical for a W. As another review mentioned, the bathroom doors/shutters give you little "privacy", this i believe is typical of W as well. Bathroom was well stocked with Bliss products. Each room has a DVD player and LCD TV. Beds were adequate, as is the HVAC. it does work off a sensor, as mentioned in another review. It was never a problem for us. Room also has a speaker/alarm clock system for ipods/iphones. Hotel also has a pool and fitness center, which I did not use. And a Bliss spa on premise. Lastly, W has a courtesy Acura service, which will take you anywhere in a 5 mile radius. This was VERY convenient and allows you to save on cabs. The only problem would be returning to the hotel, if you go farther. We even took it after we checked out, to the Clark/Lake "L" station, to get to O'Hare. The bar and restaurant is located right in the lobby, and can get a little rowdy. Our first night, there must've been some kind of function there, and it was pretty loud with club like music. There was also a bunch of girls on our floor on a bachelorette party. Needless to say they woke us up on their return from partying. But obviously was no fault to the hotel, asides from putting them on our floor. Parking is $53/night, if you need that. And in room internet is paid. there is free wi-fi in the "living room", aka lobby. No problems with the service we received. And even the staff is "younger" and "hipper". Overall, I greatly enjoyed the stay and would def. return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Flexible and helpul!”
Reviews.Author: jhigbejax
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Chicago with W was great. Progressive hotel with a host of amenities and great service staff. We did run into a small reservation issue that seemed to have occurred via an outside agent, but Ben the manager was helpful and accommodating and he definitely saved our stay. He has insured that when our employees travel to Chicago that the W will be at the top of our list. Thank you Ben and thank you W. Looking forward to our next stay. James

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel with an awesome view!!”
Reviews.Author: Kitryan
Reviews.Content: My 20 year old daughter and I stayed here on a weekend getaway. We had a blast. The hotel is extremely clean, the beds are so comfortable, the Acura Experience was great. We called thirty minutes ahead and they took us to our desired destination. The view of Lake Michigan is phenominal.

Reviews.Title: “Really helpful with our baby needs!”
Reviews.Author: KatherineLouise
Reviews.Content: As a Brit who used to live in Chicago, I usually stay with friends so don't use the downtown hotels, but this time decided on 3 nights at the W, as I was taking my partner and 10 month old baby to see the city for the first time. We found the staff to be super friendly and helpful. They bought a baby sterilizer for me prior to our arrival so that I could easily sterilze my son's bottles and brought a microwave to the room to heat his bottles for him. When we first arrived we were assigned to a city view room with 2 queen beds, but asked if we could switch to a lake view with one king size. This meant there was more floorspace for the baby to crawl around and more spacious for his crib. The staff were only too please to move us and move all our things. I would highly recommend the lake view rooms as they definitely are lighter and brighter than on the othre side. All the staff were helpful - restaurant staff heated bottles for us while we enjoyed the outside rocking chairs in the afternoons and room service staff crept in quietly with dinner to make sure they didn't wake the baby! Bar food and room service food and drinks were also of a high standard - and ending a busy day of sightseeing with a drink and snack on a rocking chair looking at Lake Michigan is priceless!

Reviews.Title: “Family fun, fabulous food, fantastic, caring staff!”
Reviews.Author: INMomoftwo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our two young kids to stay at the W. My two year old is potty training, and of course immediately upon arrival, we had to run to the lobby bathroom for (ahem) #2. He was terrified that the automatic toilet kept flushing and just distraught. I was too; I didn't shut the stall door! An amazing staff member was in there and ran out and got a stuffed animal and brought it to us in the stall! It made my son relax and do the deed and he sleeps with his "W" animal every night. In a fabulous hotel, where it appears that image is important, she took the time to make him happy. Turns out, the hotel has the image thing just right, but they are NOT stuffy, snooty or aloof. It just looks rockin' cool! LOVE that place! Loved walking to the Pier. Loved that a local candy store left two candy packets for my boys upon check in!

Reviews.Title: “One star too many”
Reviews.Author: JeffKuzmits
Reviews.Content: I booked this room through one of the popular online services where you don't know the name of the hotel until you book it. The W hotel was listed as a 4 star property. It is not. This property used to be a Holiday Inn and a Days Inn prior to the current status as a W hotel. For those of you who never stayed at a W Hotel, they ARE upscale trendy properties. I'm not saying this place was horrible.....just not in the league of other 4 star properties in Chicago. Valet Parking was very expensive and seemed to be run by men on work visas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: 41club31
Reviews.Content: We managed to get this hotel on priceline on a Friday for a Saturday night stay - I'd stay here again, but not at the rack rate. The hotel itself is in a fantastic location - across from the lake/beach and blocks to Michigan Ave, Navy Pier and Millennium Park. The rooms were small (W used to be a Days Inn) but were nice. The views of the lake from the hotel are spectacular - telescope near the elevators to check out the boats. We had a west-facing view - overlooking some other buildings instead of the great lake view - not great, but you get what you pay for. We didn't have dinner reservations when we arrived at 3pm, but the concierge desk gave us a ton of ideas and we loved the place we went. Only complaint is the valet parking is $53/night.

Reviews.Title: “Professional, curtious, and respectful; a truly incredible stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: gstephen137
Reviews.Content: The hotel stay was great. The W Chicago Lakeshore really made our travels fantastic. I work for a non-profit and we do a cross-country cycling trip to raise money for people with disabilities. We were able to stay at the hotel, and it was relaxing and a very nice break for the cyclists after a long summer on the bicycle.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some not so much”
Reviews.Author: km39497
Reviews.Content: Daughter and I decided literally one morning to make the 3 hour drive to Chicago on a Monday to do a little shopping and visit the new Bear exhibit at Brookfield. Got on Priceline and made a bid on a 3 star N Michigan Ave. hotel. Ended up getting upgraded to the W for $117 including fees. Parking is an incredible $53/night with in and out privileges. You can park until 5:00 pm the next day. Our room was very modern, comfortable and clean. The beds were fluffy and had 4 pillows apiece. The Bliss products (shampoo, conditioner, face wash, etc) were really nice. Everything was really nice especially for the price we got. We did not eat at the hotel. We didn't even use a bottle of water ($6/bottle). Con: and this was a big one for me, no complimentary Wi-Fi in the rooms. You could pay $14.99 for 24 hours. Maybe I was being cheap especially with the rate we got but this just seemed super chintzy. Even Econolodge and Motel 6 have free Wi-Fi in their rooms. This is supposed to be a business hotel? There is complimentary internet in the "Living Room" (?lobby). Also, the pool was very nice with an amazing view of Navy Pier but after a day of walking up and down Michigan Avenue, I could have used a hot tub/spa which the W does not have.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy little hot spot”
Reviews.Author: patayla
Reviews.Content: We recently spent one night at this hotel and were quite satisfied with the rooms and the service, however found the $53 parking outlandish and it was the sole reason we stayed only 1 night. The lobby was both trendy and clean. Our waitress, Angela, in "The Livingroom" was outstanding, probobly the friendliest person we met in all of Chicago. We loved the rooms, they were gorgeous and the Bliss products in bathroom were to die for, I actually regret not going down to the spa to purchase some of that face wash! The location was good, walking distance to everything. I'd recommend it, if you fly into Chicago...but if you have to park a car....save your pennies before you stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Ladies Weekend Local”
Reviews.Author: travelgurew
Reviews.Content: I spent a long weekend at the W Lakeshore with close friends in May and we had a fabulous time! The location was amazing if you are in Chicago for shopping or dining. The rooms were clean and comfortable and we were lucky enough to have an amazing view of the lake! If you can, I would definitely advise upgrading to a suite- Our group had two rooms, a suite with king bed and a room with two double beds. Our room (the suite) had an extra 1/2 bath with vanity which came in handy for getting ready, a couch and a 2nd television. Staff was friendly and attentive. We ate at the hotel several times and ordered room service and had no complaints. Service was prompt and the food was great. The bar/lobby area was a fun and trendy place to hang out and grab a drink before heading out for the evening. The work out facilities were fine and the Bliss Spa was AMAZING. Negatives: The first concierge we talked to was rude and unhelpful-- we asked about booking spa services and he looked at us like we had just insulted his mother. However the girl working the following day was very sweet. The hotel was so crowded at times that we had exceptionally long waits for the elevators (I think because of the popular restaurant at the top of the building?). If you don't like crowds this isn't the place for you as the lobby seems to be a popular hang out for local businessmen to grab lunch or a cocktail. Also a popular place for weddings- there were several brides running around while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly designed, poorly managed”
Reviews.Author: 123name456
Reviews.Content: Both the W Lakeshore and its staff are generally quite attractive but not at all functional. Iâ€™ll start with the facilities. (1) The bathroom in apparently every guest room has an insubstantial wooden sliding screen for a door and a large window with flimsy wooden shutters that open directly into the bedroom. In other words, the bathroom is completely acoustically transparent to the bedroom. Even if you are happy sharing a bed with someone, you will need to steel yourself to hear every last bit of noise they generate in the bathroom. (2) To conserve energy, the heating and air conditioning unit is on a motion sensor: as confirmed by the staff, when there is no motion in the room for some period of time, the hvac shuts down. When I visited in July, this meant waking up in a sauna at least twice per night and frantically waving my arms until the air conditioner turned back on. (3) The latch on the room door would not catch without tightly pulling it closed, a problem that the staff said occurred in most rooms every summer when the humidity rose. (4) The business center did not have a single working computer when I needed to print a report for work. (5) Finally, the entire hallway (27th floor) reeked of mildew. Now, the staff. (6) Our room was not ready when we arrived at 4pm, and the reception staff really did not seem to care. (7) They did offer to call us when a room was ready, but they never did call and we ended up wasting an extra hour waiting after the room was in fact ready. (8) The housekeeping department, which seems to prefer to be called the Style Department, made the bed with a duvet cover that was, to put it delicately, soiled by a prior (male) guest. (9) Not a single staff member with whom we interacted seemed to have the slightest interest in their jobs or our stay, and we are platinum Starwood members. Here is, verbatim, my conversation at checkout: Me: â€œIâ€™d like to check out, please, room ____.â€� W: â€œSo did you have a nice stay?â€� Me: â€œNo, actually, it was an extreme disappointment.â€� W: â€œOK, so Iâ€™ll put that on the AmEx?â€� The view of the lake and Navy Pier are great if your room is on the right side of the hotel. Otherwise, this hotel has absolutely nothing going for it, and it has turned me off to the entire W brand and perhaps even Starwood. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Subpar W Hotel”
Reviews.Author: indiefilmmaker
Reviews.Content: As a frequent guest at W Hotels around the world, have to say this W is one of my least favorite. Had the opportunity for a one night stay and have to say the experience was subpar at best. From a loud and noisy lobby where you have to shout to the check-in person to be heard to the subpar rooms, not like the W Hotels I've stayed at before. Service was so-so, staff seemed to care less. Probably only good advantage is its right across from Lake Michigan and close to bars and restaurants. For the money, think I'll look for another hotel on my next visit to Chi-town....truly a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: Brandonsyygr
Reviews.Content: chic and modern. Beautiful hotel with fantastic amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kkn-7
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W on N Lakeshore for 5 days. Room and staff were very friendly and efficient. We were traveling with our teenage girls and rooms were well stocked and rooomy. Loved the lobby atmoshpere and rockling chairs out front. I drank my coffee sitting outside looking over Lake Michigan every morning. It was a 1 1/2 blocks to a Starbucks and Seven Elevan if you needed anything. We enjoyed the Acura experience in the lobby,Casey drove us to our restaurant each night. The concierge desk was always helpful in making our dinner reservations for us. Would highly recommend the W . We will stay with them agaiin on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: chilli907
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights at the W Chicago Lakeshore. We checked in on July 17 at noon and they had a room ready for us. We went up to drop off our luggage and we were impressed with the view of the lake and Navy Pier. The decor in the hotel is modern and different from any of the hotels I have stayed at but it fit well and it was quite nice. The room is not very large but we found it big enough for two people. The hotel does have a sliding door to the bathroom as well as shutters that open directly to the room. My wife and I did not mind this but it could be a downside to others. Our room was clean and we only had one problem during our stay. We awoke to an 80 degree room the first morning and it kept getting warmer. We called the Whatever, Whenever and they immediately sent an engineer. He arrived to our room just a few minutes after the call and told us he would replace the air conditioner. He left to get a new unit and we left for the day. When we returned to our room it was nice and cool and we did not have any problems for the rest of our stay. Our room was on the 25th floor and it was quiet and we were both able to sleep well at night. I usually do not sleep that well at hotels. We were pleased with the hotel and we would consider staying there again when we return to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service, Attitude, and Rooms”
Reviews.Author: WilliamC002
Reviews.Content: I would advise not to stay here ever. The Whatever/Whenever service is a joke. I had to call down 3 or more times to retrieve my laundry which was promised to be back before a very important meeting. I tried to be calm and understanding regarding many mistakes. After calling multiple times and talking to the so called, "Supervisor" Omar as well as a rude girl named Whitney, I will never be coming back here again. Overhearing staff members swearing, laughing, and using profane words in the background of each conversation I had when calling from my room also put me over the edge. Classy, leisure, and flirty is their motto, more like trashy, ugly, and awful. The view of the lake from my room was the only thing that kept me sane when staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: LeaBNewYork
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel on Lakeshore Dr is one of the top ten hotels I've stayed at in my five years of business travel. It's stylish, conveniently located and very comfortable. The amenities are top notch, the bed was comfortable, the room was perfect for business without being dull. I got a great deal on the room via Priceline and would stay here again in a heartbeat if I was lucky enough to get the same deal.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, urbane hotel...can I retire here?”
Reviews.Author: yayafabs
Reviews.Content: We came to Chicago for Thanksgiving weekend with our 14 year old son,another couple and their 2 teenage sons. Everyone on the staff was very helpful and accomodating ...and cool with the boys. We loved the civilized feel and the attention to details, (aromatherapy in elevators, etc). Very handy location to Navy Pier and Michigan Ave. Upstairs bar was way too tragically hip and dark for us 50 year olds, but the ground level area was excellent. Love the minimalistic decor...I really did not want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: Clodsmarco
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Lakeshore for 4 nights. The room was average, although the bathroom products (Bliss because they have a Bliss Spa on site) were a real plus. The bathrooms are very small though. The W tries too hard to be laid-back and our experience was that this was reflected in the service provided, especially by the almost horizontally laid-back concierge service. There's little enthusiasm about them (there were 2 of them) and on the 3 occasions we used them, each time there was a problem, culminating in us turning up to a restaurant, luckily with our booking confirmation printed out, only to find that there was no reservation. Lots of posing going on in the bar in the evenings and the Whisky Sky Bar on the top floor is a must just for even one drink as you won't believe you're arrived at the right place, when you think of the hype surrounding this below-par place. it does have a good view of the Navy Pier but that's it and it's about the size of my living room and I don't live in a big. house. The hotel did provide a free car service to take you anywhere in the city which was good. You get complimentary coffee in the lobby, but then you don't get coffee-making facilities in your room. You're only a 10 min walk to the main shopping area and the Navy Pier and small beach are very close (although most locals don't recommend getting in the water). Also, it is a pet-friendly hotel. All in all, our first stay at a W Hotel was not worth the hype, I'm afraid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: OregonToots
Reviews.Content: Across from the lake, handy location, very comfy room, nicely appointed

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't disappoint”
Reviews.Author: liongal
Reviews.Content: Not my favorite W experience...but not a bad one by any stretch. It's what you might expect from a W - swanky decor, groovy bar, delicious food and well appointed. Worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “they live up to their whatever/whenever slogan”
Reviews.Author: Drawdaddy
Reviews.Content: i had returned to my room one evening and the room was hot. adjusting the thermostat did no good. A hotel engineer happened to be on the floor so i asked if he could look at it. he reset the thermostat and sensor and indicated that if it did not cool down to call again in 15 minutes. unfortunately, it did not cool down so i called downstairs and another engineer was at my door in minutes. i explained to him what had happened and he asked me to hold tight and he would be back in 10 minutes. he was back in 5 minutes with a new AC on a trolley. he slipped the old unit out, put the new one in and the room was now cooling. this took no more than 5 minutes of his time and i was back to being comfortable. having had this issue before i have run into enginners spending an hour trying to fix the unit or having to move to another room. not here. this is the way these issues should be resolved. my kudos to the engineering staff of the W. these are the small things that tell customers how important they are.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular & Dynamic w/very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Twobings
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to spend one night at the W Hotel for a Girls' Getaway. Upon arrival, the drop off & unload area in front of the hotel is small & tight so be warned. Things move fast but efficient here. A bellhop came to us immediately to help unload our bags. Check-in was fast & efficient. The lobby space is tight to once again, be prepared for a lot of people moving and working in a small area although the flow of the lobby works well. You need your room key to access your floor in the elevator. Hallways are dimly lit. Carpeting is hip and colorful. Room was average size. Good amount of storage for luggage which the bellhop loaded the suitcases into for us. The beds and comforter are wonderful. A lot of windows which includes a full darkening shade which did not work in our room. Bathroom is average size. Bizarre to have a shutter window open into the bedroom though and that in combination with the zenlike sliding wood door does not offer any sound proofing so I hope you are not modest. Tub was small. Ammenities in room excellent. Staff very nice & helpful. Everyone said hello and were very well informed. Bliss spa was nice although there could be more privacy for the manicure and pedicure area. Also the pedi foot soak does not have any jet action in it so your feet are essentially sitting in a bowl of water. That was a little disappointing. Pedicure was done very well. Spa ambience is so so. Location to the beach & Navy Pier great. It's about a 10 min walk to Navy Pier and 5 min to the beach. Hotel was quiet at night. Not sure if the hotel had a restaurant as there was no emphasis on this. Suggestion to go to the Grande Luxe on Michigan for breakfast or lunch. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place, even with the kids”
Reviews.Author: Wellness2
Reviews.Content: We planned a Mother's Day Trip to the American Girl Store and were very impressed with this hotel. The pool was very nice and from the pool area the view of Navy Pier was fantastic. Staff was friendly, rooms were nice, beds comfortable and they accomidated our request for joining rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel - very zenlike!!”
Reviews.Author: slpnbuety2
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel - great location and beautiful views. Very near Lake Michigan and dangerously close to Michigan Ave. Very quiet too inside the room. Plus they have recycling bins in the rooms - awesome! Didn't get to take advantage of the spa, but I hope to do so on my next stay. Prices were reasonable too - I'd definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience; Super Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: nikias
Reviews.Content: My mom, sister and I went to Chicago over Memorial Day weekend just to get away. We got to the hotel pretty early (about 10:30 AM) on Saturday, so we didn't expect to be able to check in, but we wanted to leave our suitcases and go wander and grab a bite to eat.
