The staff was very nice and helpful. They took our luggage at the door (we dropped our mom off at the hotel and then went to find a cheaper self-park lot rather than the $47/night valet). They let us pre check-in, basically assigning us to a room that was being cleaned, and said they would call when it was ready, which would be no more than 2 hours. They gave us a few suggestions for places to eat. We left and during brunch, less than an hour later, they called to let us know our room was ready. The room was average sized with pretty modern, purple decor. Very clean. I was happy to see that they had a recycle bin along with trash cans in the room. The bathroom was fairly large for a hotel bathroom with a window that you could open into the bedroom part. I read in some of the reviews on here that people didn't like this window and the sliding door to the bathroom, but we didn't have a problem with it. We didn't feel that we lacked privacy at all. The location is excellent. It's on the corner of Lake Shore and Ontario. Navy Pier and the beach are pretty much across the street. Michigan Avenue shopping is within about a 10-15 minute walk. There are all kinds of restaurants nearby. They also had a nice service with an Acura dealership that gave guests free rides to anywhere within a certain number of miles (5 miles, I think). That really came in handy and saved us some money on cab fare. You do have to book your ride in advance, though. If you can't get a ride with them, there seemed to be a cab right outside the door constantly. As I mentioned before, the staff was super nice. We did not encounter one unfriendly person. The man who brought our suitcases to the room was very welcoming and helpful. The couple of times that we called the front desk for something the person was pleasant and greeted us by name when they answered. We had a problem with the safe in our room and they had someone up to fix it in about 5 minutes. The housekeeping staff always smiled and said hello when you passed them in the halls. They had someone standing at the door all the time to greet guests and help with any questions. I had read about the music in the lobby, but I was surprised to see that there was DJ playing the music. I had been thinking there was just a loud cd playing or something. It was a little loud, but not annoying, and we had no problems with noisy guests or anything like that. I was actually surprised at how quiet our halls were at night considering that it seemed to be a younger crowd staying there. There appeared to be a few weddings, and bachelor/bachelorette parties staying there. They're also very pet-friendly. We didn't have any pets with us, but I did see a few well-behaved dogs and the room service menu has a separate menu to order your dog a burger or steak. We're all dog lovers, so we found it amusing and good to know in case we ever did want to bring one of our dogs. There did not appear to be any size restrictions either, considering that we were greeted by a very friendly 130 lb chocolate labrador when we got on the elevator once. The only thing that would have made it better was if there was free internet access in the room. There was was free wifi in the lobby (or as they call it the living room), but you had to pay for it in the guest rooms. Overally, we had a great experience. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The staff gets Customer Satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: BustravelSchaumburg
Reviews.Content: We had a week long event here with 50 people. The food was great, the service was excellent, the hotel was fun and lively. We loved the location close to Navy Pier, the beach and fun! The Hotel staff whether in the morning or evening, whether the valet, the front desk or the catering, were always pleasant and responsive.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy place to book into on a Saturday night.”
Reviews.Author: gmcc
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel about 10.30pm after a long trip from Scotland after being delayed 5 hours in New York. On arrival your hearing is assaulted by the music. We had read the previous posts about the music in the lobby but they still did not prepare us for the noise. We had to shout to the receptionist to check us in. After such a long trip we asked if there was another bar and were directed to the 32nd?? floor. This was a much smaller bar but every bit as noisy with a DJ playing in the corner. I accept that we arrived on a Saturday night and the place is likely to be busier.That would be my only minor gripe. The location is good- right on the lake shore; 5 minutes walk from Navy Pier where the tour buses have a stop; 15 minute walk to a number of bars and restaurants. We walked back to the hotel at night and never once felt concerned for safety. 5 minute walk to 2 diners for breakfast. One is out of the hotel and turn left, take first left and up about 3 blocks to the Corner Bakery. The other is turn right out of the hotel and up about 2 blocks to the West Egg. Both were fine. The rooms were a good size and air conditioning not too noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: bugstar
Reviews.Content: Loved it...W Hotel never disappoints. EVER! Stayed at the W City Center the previous weekend and equally wonderful! THANK YOU!

Reviews.Title: “Overated w Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frankie1701
Reviews.Content: I had always wanted to stay at the W in Chicago. Everyone seems to rave about it. I went with firends for weekend trip to city. I was astonished at the size of the room- thought I was in Japan-tiny, claustraphobic, low ceilings, no space for suitcases, no counter space in tiny bath- no towel bars-just some hooks, no hot water in sink, no fan, no bath room heater,walls so thin we were up all night from party people.overpriced mini bar and parking, $6 to purchase a band aid kit, ( beware of bed's platform bottom- both of us seroiusly stubbed out toes under it.-did not want to pay $6 for kit) no shower cap, no coffee machine, dangeroulsy under cooked eggs, chemical tasting bacon, no jelly for toast, super handsome waiter helped. All in all- the biggest rip off for the over priced rooms- no wonder they don't show real pictures of the room- things like rolled up toels and leaves instead. Next time we will go back to our luxury hotels like the Intercontinental!

Reviews.Title: “Needs help with the little things”
Reviews.Author: feelingbeachy
Reviews.Content: Positive: Location, location. Cool bar on top floor. Nice view of lake. Big negatives: The lobby decor looks old/very used and needs to be replaced. The pool seemed dirty and the outside terrace looked dirty and the lights, walls need to be cleaned. Room was ok. Someone needs to go through this hotel and fix a lot of little things. Restaurant was way over priced for just okay food. Hope this helps because this hotel could be great with the location, view, and bar.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and in need of upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Ruthie1982
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here in October 2009 as part of our honeymoon. The location is great but for price of hotel you are expecting something special and i have to admit we were disappointed. The rooms are quite small and drab and need to be updated. For the same money you could stay somewhere alot nicer

Reviews.Title: “One of My Favorite Hotels”
Reviews.Author: jonathanhsinger
Reviews.Content: The W Lakeshore is genuinely one of my favorite hotels. The rooms are big, clean and comfortable, the service cheerful and helpful, the views enjoyable. I stayed here twice recently, coming back a second time after enjoying it so much the first. Perhaps the only downside is that it isn't near the L. Other than that, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “I W Chicago”
Reviews.Author: yessica81
Reviews.Content: The W Lakeshore is by far my favorite hotel in Chicago. Its a place where I've stayed with a boyfriend, for a girls spa weekend and a family trip. My most recent trip was with my sister and our young kids (4 & 7 year old). You wouldn't typically think this hotel is child friendly, but it is! The kids love the food (room service and wave restaurant). They also love the pool with complementary green apples! We got a great last minute deal on the room. The location is perfect to walk to navy pier or the beach. Its just blocks away from shopping on Michigan Ave. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to have a memorable time in Chicago. Personally I just love the Bliss products provided in the bathroom! Keep up the good work W Lakeshore.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like the rockstar I am.”
Reviews.Author: flumeDC
Reviews.Content: Air travel snafus resulted in me being stranded in Chicago for the night. No thank you United, keep your airport hotel, I'm off to enjoy the handful of hours that I have in this great city. Got a room with a lakefront view -well worth it-and begin the warmup on the roof level bar. Extremely talented staff on duty. I get the inside scoop on the right areas to hit on my agenda for live music, good drinks and more from the W ambassador at the door. He steered me right. On the way out I ask for a setup of toiletries since mine were in orbit elsewhere--they were delivered immediately. Every recommended stop on my night was absolutely what I wanted. The W staff hit the mark in every way. My only regret was not having enough energy the next morning to hit the pool which looked great. I was a bit too crispy around the edges for that. Next time for sure. This is a great W and I've stayed in many--over nine I think--and will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Another Amazing Stay at the W Chicago Lakeshore”
Reviews.Author: travrev82
Reviews.Content: I just returned from another stay at the W Chicago Lakeshore. I was in town for business, but I felt like I was at home. The staff was wonderful and so friendly. I feel like i have new friends! I travel a lot and the best part about this hotel is that they Workouts most mornings with NBC fitness expert Saran Dunmore. The beds are the most comfortable in town and, as much as I travel, I've never had a better hotel experience! Plus, all rooms include Bliss shampoo, conditioner, lotion, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty, but could use an update.”
Reviews.Author: daniellescm
Reviews.Content: To be honest, I'm a sucker for things that are purple and sparkly. If I could have had the W decorators outfit my room when I was 16 I would have been in glitzy, purply heaven. My room was OK. Furniture looked a little battered and I thought it odd that there's no real wall between the bathroom and the bed -- just a little screen you pull closed. Traveling solo this is fine, but I would think a little more privacy might be nice for some. It just looks like it could use some refurbishing but not a bad place.

Reviews.Title: “The W is my Favorite Chicago Hotel”
Reviews.Author: iluvmycharger
Reviews.Content: First of I all I am a very loyal SPG member , mainly because of the W and the awesome staff - especially the manager. I have stayed at the W 10- 15 times in the past year and I loved every stay. If you are thinking of staying at the W here are the positives: 1. Awesome View- Lakeview and City Views are equally stunning. 2. Very quick walk to Navy Pier- like 5 minutes 3. Beach directly across the street- again like 5 minutes 4. Very hip atmosphere- lively. They even have a DJ on some nights in the lobby 5. The staff is very helpful- I would give them all an A+- From the car porter who remembers us and always has something nice to say down to the bartender 6. Heather Steenge-Hart --the manager ---has always been unbelieveably kind!! Kudos to her!! 7. 7/11 is less than a block away so you can stock up if you're on a budget or need a slurpee fix. Also some of the best retaurants in this area are on Ontario. 8. The pool- WET- has an awesome view of Navy Pier and a sitting area outside overlooking the beach and Navy pier- perfect on night when there are fireworks. There are a million other things I can list but this is my short list. Feel free to contact me with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but swanky”
Reviews.Author: Yatrik1
Reviews.Content: That's the best way I can describe this. I walked in and they had totally swanky electro-lounge music playing all over the lobby, which was as much a bar as it was a lobby. I liked the scene though, it just caught me a little by surprise. The decor and theme is modern/trendy. I rode the elevator with an older couple and they really seemed out of place. I realized this place is geared for the younger crowd. I wonder how it will do now that so many 20's-30's somethings don't have as much cash flow as they thought. Overall it was nice, comfortable, but overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Everything here is designed for people under 30 and over 6 ft tall”
Reviews.Author: nydolly
Reviews.Content: We are empty-nesters who booked here for a multi-day professional conference. Iâ€™m 5â€™1â€� - short, but not technically a little person and I needed a step-stool to get into the bed! Literally!! The mattress is on a box spring which is on a platform. I couldnâ€™t reach the safe, and could barely reach the faucets in back of the sink, which was too high! And there were no towel bars - just 3 hooks which were, you guessed it, too high!! Hereâ€™s a tip - if you get a room ending in 00 ask for a different room right away: Itâ€™s got a great view, but the dead space behind the elevator bank has an adorable full size telescope WHICH ABUTS THE paper thin walls of the ROOM, allowing you to hear all the noise from the people who are naturally congregating there. And donâ€™t get me started about the bathroom door which does not close (it slides) and has a SHUTTERED PASS-THROUGH. I canâ€™t think of a single reason that youâ€™d need a view into the bathroom that doesnâ€™t begin with â€œEwwwww!â€� The concierge did not help me get an appointment at the spa which was completely booked, had no idea wherever/whenever another spa appointment could be booked and did not follow up to see that I found one. I did it on my own with yelp. And the whiskey sour that I asked for at the insanely noisy bar was made with rum. The only thing that recommends this place is that itâ€™s spotlessly clean. Would I stay here again? No way.

Reviews.Title: “W-onderful stay”
Reviews.Author: JiniG
Reviews.Content: We held our annual team offsite in Chicago. Jenny Silvestri, Joe Winkler and the entire team took care of us so well! The Front Desk associates assisted my colleague which she was so thrilled about the next day; the food/bev. crew took care of us on last min. changes. We definitely plan on having another team offsite at the W-Lakeshore again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service experience but room was nothing special!”
Reviews.Author: travelaholic_111
Reviews.Content: I wanted to LOVE this hotel! It was my dream to stay at the W with my mom and I'd always heard great things about it. The concierge provided phonomenal service and we loved the Acura SUV service (although return service would have been even better)! The free movie and cd rentals was a bonus! I was under the impression we'd get goodie bags for checking in (based on their website) but all we had was an overpriced mini bar? The shutters for couples would be great but they're not sound proof and really serve no purpose. We just learned to laugh at them! Didn't have time to use the pool or fitness facilities but they looked great and were usually empty. The hotel definitely becomes a happening spot at night but we were on the 21st floor and didn't hear a peep! The rooms were nothing all that special but I liked the I Pod clock radio and the beds were SSSOOOO comfortable! Best sleep in a long time! It's only about a 5 minute walk from the Magnificent Mile which is nice and also really close to Navy Pier. I would stay at a W hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “I can't believe I stayed in a Hotel named "W", after being subjected to the presidency of a like named village idiot.”
Reviews.Author: JonathonNealesteine
Reviews.Content: My wife made the reservation, as we were meeting freinds from France already in residence. This is the old LakeShore Holiday Inn, that I think also opperated as a Howard Johnsons, though it has been renovated. Rooms are nicely decorated, though are limited by the concrete structure of the past. The hotel is dog freindly and the Concierge/Parking assistants were outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay--great service”
Reviews.Author: NebraskaBluejay
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the W hotel this week. The employees were kind and the service was prompt. The concierge gave us great recommendations for activities, places to eat and transportation. We would highly recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “BEST EXPERIENCE EVER”
Reviews.Author: mfranze
Reviews.Content: W Hotel Lakeshore was one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in. I am in sales and our business thrives on customer service. I have an elevated expectation because my business goes out of the way to extend a hand and put a smile on someone's face. W Hotel took it to another level. I will never stay anywhere else in Chicago again. Thanks again W Hotels, Matt Franze

Reviews.Title: “was a great hotel and i loved the view”
Reviews.Author: terryholcomb1
Reviews.Content: was a great hotel and i loved the view. would stay there again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: TeresaPhila
Reviews.Content: Hot Spot, I will be there for Taste of Chicago 2010

Reviews.Title: “"W"hatever...”
Reviews.Author: lastcallforboarding
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Chicago for Valentines weekend, and as the other reviewer said "I really wanted to love this hotel". However... it was a stretch. The guide book says it is a former "Days Inn" and when you see the bathtub you will believe it. There's the usual "W" gloss going on, but beneath that you will find an old, tired hotel. There were several things wrong besides the tired rooms. We had to ask at least twice for the phone to be connected, as it was broken when we arrived. We also had to ask twice for wine glasses (there were none in the room). The walls are horribly paper thin. There was some sort of loud party going on next door but you would have sworn they were in the room with you at 3 AM. Very un-nerving. The location beside the water is nice, but by the same token, it's a little off the beaten track.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusted with the outcome!”
Reviews.Author: oceans2010
Reviews.Content: We were in Chicago for business and our son's engagement party. We went into the city for new years eve. Last minute decided to stay at the W hotel thinking because it was a W we would have the same satisfaction that we had from the W in Texas. I am appauled at the way the general mgr. has handled our situation. We called 5 minutes from the hotel to find out if there were rooms available. I was told that there were a few rooms but they were filling up fast so I gave my credit card to hold the room. We checked in and was told there were no kings so took what they had. We opened the door to the room and realized right away it wasn't what we expected and did not want to spend new years eve at this hotel. The room was small, dark and it faced the wall of a building, that was our view. The bathroom was not private it had a window open to the bedroom with shutters, poor design. I immediately called downstairs and told the mgr. that we were leaving since there was no other rooms available. The mgr. told me we would not get a credit for the room. I contacted the general mgr. by e mail, as I was told at the front desk they were sure she would take care of the problem. I was also told that they did in fact have plenty of rooms, just not a different kind of room. Heather, the GM never responded to me, how rude. I then took my complaint up with my credit card company. The letter I recieved from my cc company said that Heather's comment was that there was no mgr. named Bill that I spoke with and their policy did not allow any credit even though I was only in their hotel for 10 mins. We were not given credit, thus we were charged for something we did not get. I find the W hotel to be nothing more than modern day bandits. My husband and I own more than one business and we would never treat one of our customers as the W treated us. We will never stay at another W and I will tell anyone and everyone I know about our horrible experience and don't bother with a establisment that will give you absolutely no consideration regarding our request.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME HOTEL - EXCELLENT SERVICE, ROOM, AND FOOD/DRINKS!”
Reviews.Author: mathgirl1109
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time staying at The W Hotel, at the Lakeshore Chicago location! We got the Baby It's Cold Outside package and loved everything about it! The breakfasts were so yummy and it was great to have a cocktail on the house. The bartender made us great drinks that we had never had anywhere else and the Calamari was sooooo tasty! The staff were always very pleasant and we really enjoyed all the little details. We had rose petals and our song playing when we got into our room and it was great - super romantic just like we were hoping! We used the Acura Experience (complimentary drop-off service) every day that we were there and really appreciated having that - I don't know of any other hotel that has something like that! Also, we thought the lobby restrooms were really cute (check them out!) Thank you for a weekend we will remember for a long time. We definitely hope to do it again sometime!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: mpattyn
Reviews.Content: I think the hotel is Great! We booked the room in advance and a cheap rate. We got there, talked to bartender for a while, found out that they had a low occupancy rate for the weekend and asked if we could get an upgraded room. The gave us exactly what we asked for, never made us wait and it was wonderful. I agree with other review, the rooms are a bit small but definitely luxury. The views are beautiful, ALL the staff was very accomodating and would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service -rude staff”
Reviews.Author: jula81
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W lakeshore for 5 days.Room was totally unsuitable for 3 people.It was very small and no room to move.Our room looked into an office building and so natural light was poor.Furniture was in poor condition,wood chipped and scraped.Dust everywhere.Very noisy- the walls were paper thin and you could here everything.Wooden shutter between bedroom and bathroom was ridiculous.would never stay here again and certainly would not recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Chicago!!”
Reviews.Author: StLouisSnazzy
Reviews.Content: The W Lakeshore is one of my favorites out of all of the hotels I've stayed in worldwide. The location is convienient to the lake, Navy Pier and many of the active attractions inthe downtown area. I always find the staff to be professional, friendly, and helpful. The hotel is a great place to chill, hear some music and have a drink. The lobby/lounge caters to the young professional crowd and the house music sets a great tone for those wanting to hang out and socialize. Heather the general manager is the best!! She was accommodating and makes sure that her guestshave the best possible experience every time they stay there. The W Lakeshore is guaranteed to provide a Wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal! Not enough stars on the scale to rate this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hilobabe
Reviews.Content: Service, surroundings, everything was above and beyond!

Reviews.Title: “mediocre face - only stay here if you get it cheap”
Reviews.Author: BrrrGetMeWarmth
Reviews.Content: Thankfully I booked this hotel on Priceline and stayed here for a little over $100 a night, had I paid $200 or more I would have been uphappy. Front desk staff is very rude and unhelpful, and the bar in the lobby is full of sleezy d-bags. Also don't even bother with the whatever whenever line, we tried it for a couple different things, both very simple and easy requests, and they not only didn't help but couldn't even tell us where in Chicago we might be able to check. The room itself was clean, and the bed was very comfortable, also the work out room was decent and had what I needed for a decent work out. Additionally the location is great, its a nice easy walk to the pier, and we even walked to John Hancock building which was a little more a hike, but not too bad, and you can walk to the good shopping on Michigan ave. too if its not too cold. Parking was ridiculous, $45 a day, unfortunately that's the going rate in downtown Chicago though. So I would not pay full price for this place, there are much better options at full price, but if you get a smoking deal on it, you should be pretty happy with your stay, and again the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellllllllent NYE”
Reviews.Author: KELLY_GOV
Reviews.Content: Greatest NYE I've had in along time the staff were very accomdating and they made me feel like i was at home

Reviews.Title: “The absolute worst hotel stay for seasoned travelers”
Reviews.Author: dbanks1230
Reviews.Content: The only thing that matters to me when traveling is the hotel clendtheness and friendly receptive customer service. Perhaps my family and I were of the wrong demographic; oddly enough my parents shelled out $20K for the wedding of dreams for my sister at the W Lakeshore Dr., Chicago. This was my first time straying away from my loyalty to the Hilton brand. We arrived at the hotel early for the bridal party Bliss Spa appointments and my husband attempted to checking in only to learn that I would be required to check in because the reservation was in my name. Understood; however, once I was summonsed to the lobby by the Hotel staff I then ignored. When the front desk representative finally decided to address me she was rude and clearly annoyed. Reveling that my family and I were part of the wedding party did not encourage courteous and friendly behavior. The morning following the wedding I realized that one of our two rooms had not been completely turned over; the room amenities were not restocked - no toiletries were provided. Frankly I'm not certain that the beds were changed that my children slept in. I also found it rather annoying to find my hall littered with left over room service dishes far into the night and following morning. Needless to say we cut our stay short a few days and true to form moved to The Wit on State Street a Hilton/Double Tree Hotel which far surpasses The W!!!

Reviews.Title: “W Lakeshore is RUDE - bad choice”
Reviews.Author: filmtheory
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Dec. 18-21 for a getaway with my girlfriend. DO NOT STAY HERE, fellow travellers. BAD experience. A hotel that tries to be hip and cool and instead is loud and obnoxious (there is a reason this place is ranked near bottom at #98). First problem was walking into lobby Friday night - as loud as a nightclub. Sounded like a party going on in the lobby (!). Who wants that after a long flight? Decor/ambience was nice and modern - too bad the people made it seem so awful. In the elevator, got stuck with drunk club kids whooping it up heading up to the rooftop bar (horrible repetitive techno music blaring over elevator speakers, too). Checked into room - decor was nice, larger than average room. Had a nice lake view room (had to pay $50 per night beyond Priceline rate, btw) for a total of $165 night. No complaints. Bit pricey compared to other options - Swisshotel and Hyatt were less. Upon coming back at night, we got denied entry to the rooftop bar (private party). Then upon going back to our room on 27th floor, some drunk people were partying in the hallway (!) and we could hear neighbors talking through paper thin walls. We complained to management - they did nothing, as far as we could tell. Next morning, the room service people banged on our door at 8:30am and woke us up. We told them to go away and they came back again at 9:15am. We complained to management about having our sleep disturbed and they seemed oblivious - as if this is how all hotels operate? Never in my entire hotel life has room service tried to clean a room at 8:30am in the morning. Poor management decisions by W staff here. Ruined our entire stay. End result, $500 in hotel money down the drain. I will never stay at another W (Starwood) hotel ever again. Too many other better options in Chicago - Sofitel, Swisshotel, Hyatt. The kind of person who likes this hotel are 25 year old frat kids, who want to run around screaming drunk till the wee hours of the morning. Poor value. AVOID at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “rude, loud hotel”
Reviews.Author: tripsndips
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small. Mine had dust all over the table. Hair on the bathroom floor. Rude restaurant staff downtairs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Rickpw
Reviews.Content: Like all W hotels, a nicely styled room and bathroom, very comfortable, contemporary, great bed. The walls are a bit thin. I could hear normal conversation easily through the wall. It's a bit of a walk to Michigan Ave., and a good 15 minutes to get to the El.

Reviews.Title: “Had two great stays at the W Lakeshore”
Reviews.Author: ZP83
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I have not been disappointed with a W yet! This hotel was very reasonable when I booked it for 110 per night and used starpoints on a couple of other nights plus cash (4,800 starpoints plus $60 per night). I had a great room overlooking the lake and with a good view of the Navy Pier. The rooms were very modern but very warm during the bleak winter months of December and March in Chicago when I stayed there. The beds were very consistently comfortable across the W's I have stayed at in Montreal and New Orleans. Service was excellent and I was always addressed by my first name. On my way to the gym the bell man that assisted me with my luggage said hello and wished me a good work out. I did have a wonderful work out in their nice gym overlooking the lake. This is my favorite hotel in Chicago. I would like to try the city center some time when I return to the area. The only complain I have is the location is often confusing for some people. It took one of my friends a while to find the place but we got there eventually. The bar on the top floor and the lobby lounge are always filled with great smiles and beautiful people. I highly recommend having a drink on the top floor (I'm a sucker for a sky line view!). It is not quite the Hancock building view but it is worth a cocktail or two and what's the worst? Your room is within stumbling distance :)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: tecouag
Reviews.Content: Everytime that I go to Chicago, I have the bad habit to try a different hotel, and this time was the turn for W Lakeshore. The hotel is a good surprise, with a modern decoration, perhaps the best are the rooms, very unique. However there are better hotels in Chicago and with better location.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your purses, ladies!”
Reviews.Author: Sunny6712
Reviews.Content: I was recently robbed in the restaurant in the hotel's lobby. My purse was tucked between my feet under the chair/table, and at some point during the meal, it was stolen. We later realized that there was a man sitting behind me who had turned his chair around and leaned towards us, and we believe he used his foot or some kind of implement to drag my purse out from under the table unnoticed. Pretty ridiculous, right? This is the sort of thing that takes practice. The hotel management was unhelpful to the point of being actively combative when I reported the theft. I immediately filed a police report and was met with rudeness and a complete lack of assistance from any of the hotel management. The security guard especially was purposefully rude, and when I complained about the treatment, as the victim of a crime, to the manager, all he would say was, "I have no control over the behavior of the security team." Um, you are the manager of the hotel, and that does not make any sense. We eventually got the security manager of the W City Center on the phone, who apologized profusely and began to actually help us, including taking down a description of the suspect from the people who had sat across from me and letting me know how to file a formal complaint with the hotel, which the hotel manager had completely neglected to do. Even in a less trying situation, this customer service would have been unacceptable, but after being robbed in the hotel, in what now turns out to be a repeated occurrence, it became downright offensive. It's too bad, because I had been a big fan of W properties, but I would never, ever come back to this restaurant OR hotel again. Potential future visitors, consider this your official warning. After reporting this story to friends, I found out about several other women who had the exact same thing happen to them at this restaurant over the past year. That sounds like a really bad pattern to me. Since this has happened, the police and my insurance company's private investigator have confirmed that this hotel is a very common spot for robberies in Chicago. The fact that the management evidently does not take this seriously is a huge problem.

Reviews.Title: “Hip but Helpful”
Reviews.Author: cliff_rock
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights just for R&R in two connecting rooms in late September. We had a good visit. It's a short cab ride to most popular destinations, though a bit off the beaten path for public trains. It's a relatively short walk to the Mag Mile, so plenty of restaurants nearby. The rooms are a bit small, but plenty comfortable. King room had a chaise and two-double room had a sitting chair. Bathrooms were great; not too big but very nice finishes. Quality linens and bedding. No closets, but there is a storage area w/ curtain. Halls and common areas are pretty dark, but the rooms had plenty of lighting. The pool area was quite big, w/ great view of Navy Pier. There is an outdoor sun deck by the gym/pool that is a great vantage for Navy Pier fireworks (your weather tolerance permitting). I was really scared by bad reviews. Fortunately my experience was quite nice. The staff was excellent. A couple small problems in our room (blinds, lightbulb) were quickly corrected. Received gifts for an occasion we were celebrating. In fairness, the elevator lobby is kind of a zoo at all hours. Be patient, or youâ€™ll be disappointed. Also, though I stayed on an excellent rate, I do regularly see some very high rates for this hotel. At over $250, I could probably find places I'd prefer to choose over the W Lakeshore.

Reviews.Title: “awful beds”
Reviews.Author: triplovee
Reviews.Content: The bed at this hotel was the worst I have ever slept on in a hotel. It felt like a super cheap mattress and the pillows were bad, too. There was an open air window between the bathroom and the bedroom, with shutters, which is ok if you don't want any privacy. The service was good, but nothing is more important than comfort, especially for the bed. We were exhausted from the lack of sleep and that makes the trip less enjoyable. We had to pay $48 PER DAY to park there. Would have stayed mid city, had we known. Way to much money for the low quality.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed but concerned with some of the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: jch159
Reviews.Content: I had a great trip with family and teen restaurant was good yes it is a "bar scene" lower level but no one was out of control restaurant was a little slow sometimes but overall good and food was good I get concerned with the bad reviews as when I read that customer service doesnt care I equate that with dirty bathrooms I would go back yes elevators are slow but come on its not that bad (imo)

Reviews.Title: “They had me, then they lost me...literally. But still lots of good amenities and terrific location.”
Reviews.Author: marmtravel
Reviews.Content: My first business trip in a long while, went to Chicago to spend two days working on a project, and chose this from several in the area that my company offered because we had a great corporate rate and location was good. Initially was very impressed. We checked in mid-day and both my colleague and I immediately were able to go to our rooms (early). Trendy vibe the moment you walk through the door. Through some promotion I don't recall, I'm currently Starwood Gold, so was upgraded to a spectacular view of Lake Michigan and Navy Pier on the 24th floor and given 4pm checkout on the day of departure, which was nice with a late flight. Room had flat-screen TV, two double beds, well-equipped bathroom with nifty Bliss amenities (and there's a Bliss spa on premises). There is an odd window in the bathroom with shutters that can open and close. I didn't mind it, but can see where it might freak out traditionalists. iPod docking station on the nightstand has become an expected but welcome amenity in this class of hotel. Weird traditional analog bedside clock was very hard to see if you woke up in the middle of the night. Closet space is strange because clothing storage is in drawers undeneath the closet so you have to awkwardly bend down to get your clothes. Not a deal breaker but if I had a bad back, would be annoyed. I missed some small amenities like an in-room coffeemaker and a stand for my suitcase for packing/unpacking. Everything's very design-y and trendy and theme-y. The extra roll of toilet paper in the bathroom had a cover titled "Backup Plan," the newspaper was presented every day in a grey bag titled "News" that hung on the doorknob,even the bathmat had the word "Step" inscribed on it. Little details were fun; guess these are a W signature but I don't stay at a lot of them. Had best intentions of working out so I did visit the pool and gym area, which seemed well equipped. The pool is indoors but there is an outdoor deck which would be fun in the summer months. Loved the treadmills facing the lake. Sadly, business and sleep took priority and I never made it there to actually work out. Had a great ahi tuna sandwich for lunch at the lobby bar and our group even briefly checked out Whiskey Sky, the rooftop bar, which wasn't as exciting as we'd hoped - very small and the view was better from my room. We had the chance to try their Acura "Wherever Whenever" service where their driver will take you anywhere you need to go within 5 miles of the hotel - much more pleasant and fun than a regular taxi cab. Service starts at noon so not great for early morning business meetings, but a really fun perk. So I was feeling great about the place initially, but the love affair ended abruptly when after a grueling 12 hour work day, I came back to my room to find that they'd checked me out. All my things were still there, untouched, but a friend came to visit and texted me to tell me the front desk told her I'd checked out. A half-hour ordeal ensued with a manager (Sasha) who insisted my reservation was only for one night (though I had an itinerary and materials given me at check-in that clearly stated two nights) and suggested that somehow I had made the mistake. "No, there's nothing noted here in the change log, it always was for just one night..." she kept saying over and over again. Wish she'd spent less energy insisting I was wrong and more energy trying to fix it. I was finally checked in again, but the next day the bill slipped under my door was wrong on so many counts that I had to go to the front desk again to fix it. Wound up with two separate bills, one for each night, which should be fun for submitting expenses. Parking was a breathtaking $48, so I was glad I didn't have a rental car, internet access was $40 for 3 days, and they charged me $2.29 access for calling the airline's 800 number. Be aware. Would I stay there again? Sure. But I'd make them print out proof of my check-out date and rate the moment I checked in. I would skip the internet access and stick to the cell phone for all my calls, even 800 numbers. The hotel is a block away from West Egg Cafe, a favorite breakfast spot, and another restaurant recommendation is Graham Elliot (not in the neighborhood but worth seeking out). Pumpernickel crusted sturgeon was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Worry about the Bad Reviews”
Reviews.Author: tomkat230
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my 40th birthday weekend and was a little nervious about some of the reviews...... Don't worry this is a nice hotel with a great staff. We got a lakeview room which I was also worried about and it turned out to be great. If you can get past the cost , which you already know about, this is a great place to stay. Close to everything,free Acura car ride, GREAT BED!

Reviews.Title: “For the money, I didn't like it enough”
Reviews.Author: BrizzleInnit
Reviews.Content: Cons: - Had to walk through parking/drop off area to get in. - 2 to 3 blocks from any restaurants etc. - No prices with snack bar - Continually transferred when talking to customer services - Cooooold bar Pros: - Good gym, and a pool (with a view) - Friendly staff on the whole - Nice room, comfy bed, cool furnishings and well supplied - Beautiful view Stayed here on the first night of our honeymoon, and were upgraded to a lake view room, which was pretty spectacular. The room was a good size and well furnished with a really comfy bed; although if you're not into contemporary design you might not be so keen. During our stay we used the gym which was pretty well equipped. The pool was a little on the small side, but there were rarely more than a couple of people in there so it wasn't a problem. A fruit bowl at the pool side was a nice addition too. The staff were friendly, and we didn't encounter any problems with service. When phoning down, we did tend to get transferred around quite a lot though; a problem I also encountered when phoning ahead of our trip. The hotel is a good looking place and well designed, but let down a bit by the fact that you have to negotiate a busy setting down area on the way in - an addition to a relaxed atmosphere this does not make. The W hotels make a bit of noise about the munchie boxes they have in their rooms, which are really just snack bars and definately not free so do not be fooled. Ours didn't have a price list, and some of the packets had been opened; not cool. The hotel is fairly central, and just across the road from Navy Pier. It's a good few blocks to anything much else though, which is why I wasn't so impressed with it's location. It's got a good bar up on the twenty something-th floor, but be warned; it's coooold. From chatting to the girl behind the bar, I got the impression it was always like that. Perhaps a busy friday night would warm it up. This is a great hotel if your into nightlife, with a bar in the lobby and another higher up, a buzzing atmosphere and good facilities. The rooms were generally well kept and well designed. I would recommend it for someone with plenty of money looking for somewhere with a good buzz. For me though, it was just a bit too expensive for what it was.

Reviews.Title: “Claustrophobia Anyone?”
Reviews.Author: storloc1
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a new hotel and found out that it has been in business for over 10 years. The upstairs bar reminded me of a bad dream from the pre-disco 70's with Black Lights. Daytime is alright with the Mackinac Island style rocking chairs overlooking the Lake. Everything screamed progressive - with young Turks ordering Martell and Red Bull cocktails for $20 a pop. Most of the visitors that weekend were government employees - not a business friendly atmosphere. Rooms were small, elevators were slow and very crowded - whoever designed the foot traffic pattern must have a sardine fetish - since this is how you feel at the elevator cue. Mediocre food - helpful staff though. Would only recommend if you are under 30.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: lel7176
Reviews.Content: got lucky when i chose to "name your price" on priceline. i chose the area of the city and bid 100. my bid was accepted. at first i was a bit hesitant because of some of the reviews that i had read (not necessarily on this site). however, i was pleasantly surprised. we stayed in a cityview room on the 19th floor. though not as amazing as a lake view, it was still great. you can enjoy the lake view at the elevator alcove where they provide a telescope. i would have gladly paid the standard rate for our room. we had a king sized bed, and the room was quite spacioius. although i could hear people in the adjoining rooms, during the early evening, it was silent when i went to sleep. the hotel is very trendy and hip. wireless is free in the living room (also wonderful for people watching). the staff was very helpful and courteous. the rooms were spotless. would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Kudos to Claudia from the concierge services”
Reviews.Author: tontas
Reviews.Content: Overall, our stay was very pleasant. We encountered one hiccup and that was immediately addresses by Claudia at the concierge. I can't say enpugh of her. She even came up to our room and brought our delivery that was hung up at the security. Good service and personnel made this stay memorable. Keep investing on the best people.

Reviews.Title: “Very Hip Place to say with Positive attitudes!”
Reviews.Author: kimberlyMichigan
Reviews.Content: I wanted to give a review since I almost canceled our stay due to the many negative ones listed on this site. We were here to celebrate a 40th birthday. In total we had 5 rooms. We requested to stay in the same vicinity and we were all on the same floor. Requested the 2 complimentary Acura car rides which were prompt and pleasant. Requested coffee make and brought up in a timely manner. In other words, "the anything" requests were granted and we were very pleased with our experience. The rooms were very contemporary. A bit worn but clean and comfortable (Love the bed!) I am a "Westin" girl and prefer the more traditional but I loved the "hip vibe" of the hotel lobby and atmoshere. My husband and I had a Marvelous suite with a great view of Lake Michigan and Navy Pier. It was also excellent to entertain the group before going out. Michigan Ave four blocks away so the location was pretty convenient. Don't be frightened to give this place a try. We will certainly go back sometime!

Reviews.Title: “Overall Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: CMNYC77
Reviews.Content: The W Lakeshore is located along the water and seems like a great location for the warmer months. We were about a 10 minute walk to Michigan Avenue, where all of the shopping is. Overall, we had a very nice stay at the W. The lobby is very cool and club-like. Our room was more simple than I would have thought. Since I had stayed at the W in Montreal, I would have expected more color and fur! The room was asian inspired and I did like the lounge chaise and the window with shutters that opened into the room. The staff was nice and helpful when asked, but did not go above and beyond. We were happy with the value that we received considering we spent about $200 a night. It was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “W stands for WOW!”
Reviews.Author: AMWOkc
Reviews.Content: What a great place! Beautiful hotel, comfy rooms, lots of amenities. Workout facilities were top of the line with indoor pool overlooking Lake Michigan.

Reviews.Title: “A Unique and enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: zaidee13
Reviews.Content: A very interesting hotel. Service was great Be sure to arrange for a free ride to local attractions in the hotels Acura MDX. The only problem was the bed was so high we needed a stool to get in Don't miss the unusual lobby restrooms

Reviews.Title: “Great Style”
Reviews.Author: siouxfan11
Reviews.Content: Loved the design of the rooms! Small, but not to crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Bliss Spa, but hotel could loose the "too cool for you attitude"”
Reviews.Author: szsignor
Reviews.Content: The bed was comfortable, but one of the lamps didn't work and the room service was beyond bad. The room appeared to have been renovated, poorly, from a hotel that was clearly NOT 4 star, as W rates itself. Too bad, because it's in a a nice location, good view. But the crux of it all is the "too cool for you" attitude. It's the antithesis of the other Starwood brands such as Westin and Sheraton. There are better options in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “A smoking room...and I sure don't mean the view”
Reviews.Author: nate1879
Reviews.Content: I stay in lots of W Hotels. I have seen it all...and then some. The staff was nice, some were exceptional (Mark Bernardo), and the Acura Experience folks saw way too much of us. I was actually a little excited about this hotel: across the street from the beach, beside my conference at Navy Pier, walking distance to MI Ave, and it has a pool...and here goes the story. We check into the hotel. Our room 925 has a view of people working in their office (city side), the room was small, the furniture was chipped, the room was just blah. I just smiled, I was staying for free on a free weekend redemption. I refuse to even comment on the often bemoaned SHUTTERS separating the bathroom and bedroom! Well, I will say this, I don't know anyone...ANYONE, I am that comfortable to share necessity time with like you do without turning on the shower for a noise buffer. It was just all the little things that didn't add up for me. It is as always for the younger traveler, not the grandma that was complaining about the music on the elevator. The Whiskey bar upstairs was nice, if not a little bland in decor. The bartender was terrific. The next morning we called down to Whenever/Whatever for a coffee maker to be sent up, and it promptly arrived. The lady was kind enough to set it up and start it for us. I was glad to move to the Sheraton Towers after checking out of there, not that the W was bad...it just didn't wow me like usual. I blame it on being W'd out for a bit...am taking a break from them. Likes: location, Acura Experience, pool, staff Dislikes: City view smoking room, amount of people that I don't think were guest floating around, paying for internet (and no, I won't walking to the lobby to get it for free...bring it to me), my overuse of the W brand at the moment (and being tired from too much work travel) Overall: It's great for younger travelers, you can walk most places you'll want to go, and you can easily cab it anywhere else. If you don't know who is on MTV, you probably shouldn't stay at a W. You will just complain afterward. Otherwise, I'll likely stay there in the future, but I will upgrade to a suite.

Reviews.Title: “Love the "W"!”
Reviews.Author: GypsyGirl21
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night during a business trip. Had a King Room (#2017). The bed was one of the best I've slept in as far as hotels go. Loved the decor and the overall set up. Especially loved the Bliss Ammenities! Bathroom had only shower, no tub, in case that's an issue. Hotel is walking distance (4 Blocks) to the Magnificent Mile, but there are closer hotels if that's a priority. One nice touch here at the W is the "Acura Experience" which is a complimentary Acura Shuttle service in a 5 mile Radius. Starts at noon...I booked lift to the Shopping District and the driver was informative and helpful as to where to find what I was looking for. Lobby has a cool vibe and the bar was very busy (Thursday night). I would definitley stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “W CHICAGO Lake Shore Drive”
Reviews.Author: GGOT
Reviews.Content: W on Lake Shore Drive is a hip hotel right on Lake Michigan. We arrived off a train from NYC and got in early but were able to check into a great room facing the lake. The beds are the most comfy Iâ€™ve ever stayed in. Yes, the bathroom configuration is a bit weird with shutters that open onto the bedroom so that you cannot mask the noise within. Donâ€™t know why they did this except to give you a view of the lake from inside the bathroom. We booked the architectural boat tour through the concierge and that was fabulous. Every W hotel includes free Acura drop off service that you must book in advance. We got a ride to the boat tours as well as to the John Hancock building that evening. We visited the Signature lounge for drink and the views before dinner. It was a wonderful place to see the city from high up. Dinner at Bistro 110 was disappointing and I donâ€™t recommend it although the concierge did. W Hotels have a whatever/whenever button on the phone where you can request just about anything. The only time it disappointed was when we asked for help with our bags at check out, the bell hop never showed up even though we called twice. All in all a very pleasant stay, great location and the view sublime.

Reviews.Title: “Good water views and pool area”
Reviews.Author: enilk3
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this W Hotel and the W Chicago City Center. Both stays were for business. I'd recommend the City Center location for business travel as I thought it had a quieter, cooler atmosphere and also better rooms. Both locations offer free internet in the lobby, but you have to pay for internet access in your room. The Lake Shore location rooms were more plain and I thought the lobby was incredibly crowded and noisy. The rooms do have great views of the water (if you request a water view room). Additionally, I stopped by the fitness center and it's really nice and modern. There is a great indoor pool and sundeck area. The location seems like a perfect spot if you're vacationing and also want some time to relax within the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: SNSHUN
Reviews.Content: We thought this hotel was in a great location and it was pretty easy to get to from the airport..love public transportation! It is situated right across from the water, just the road in between so it was lovely. We didn't have any issues with noise or anything either, which was nice. we didn't try the restaurant so have no opinion on that. we got a good deal from priceline.com too so that was a bonus! The rooms were nicely decorated too, kind of a swanky type place with being really modern and "shiny" :) I wouldn't call it a 4 star hotel but it was nice. The only downside if there must be one is the staff is mediocre at best, but we got done what needed to be done they just aren't overly enthusiastic about anything. One of the valet guys was really awesome though, but he was the only one that stood out as great. So if you don't need to a lot of attention, this is a great place. We're pretty easy going so it doesn't matter to us. Oh, and only free internet in the lobby, not in your room. U have to pay to get it in your room. We also did the near north walking food tour which was alot of fun and not to expensive then we hit the free zoo after that. That took up a whole day and was great for sight seeing and learning more about the city, i recommend this tour! And it was only 42/pp!

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressed”
Reviews.Author: lizashley
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W on our anniversary because we live in the suburbs and didn't want the long drive home after a late evening dinner. We arrived at about ten to four and we were told they we running 30 minuets behind. Considering check in is at three, this was pretty poor. An hour and a half past the listed check in time, really? That's pathetic for a large hotel chain. Our room was ok, dark and pretty small. After dinner we went to Whiskey Sky, which was a tiny joke, and then back to the room when I decided to take a shower. I turned on the water and it was so loud I thought the pipes were going to break! I'm positive our neighbors could hear it, because I heard the same sound coming from another room the next morning. Finally we had breakfast the next day at the restaurant in the lobby, $8 for an orange juice, give me a break! And the stupid benches that the waiters have to slide out and slide in, for you to sit down, ridiculous. This place is trying too hard and falling short. I was glad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Management does not care about their customers!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MOMG2
Reviews.Content: Check in time was at 3:00. We did not get our room till 4:00 and my parents could not get into their still 5:00. We were told we could get in our rooms at 3:20. When talking to management she had a oh well attiitude and did nothing. The rooms were nice but the service was absolutely horrible. Do not plan on going anywhere in a hurry because it will take a while to get on and off the elevators. It cost $15 to get on the interent also. We will not stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “All Glitz, No Substance”
Reviews.Author: JPMA1234
Reviews.Content: On the negative side, the lobby was simply packed with people all throughout the day due to the packed bar location 10 ft away from the reception. Elevators frequently backed up, causing a line. The walls were very thin. It's a tall building, though, so there are some very nice views from your room windows. Overall the room decor was fine and clean. The location itself is convenient to the beach & Navy Pier, but not to downtown. You'll have to cab it, but at least there were always cabs waiting outside. Overall I'd say that if you're simply visiting Chicago and want to see the sights you could probably find a hotel with a much better location and more enjoyable atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Amishcowboy
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is a Hip place if that's what you're looking for, I liked the location directly across from the Navy Pier and right in the heart of Streeterville not far from the downtown Loop area. I was a little freakout at first of the Shutters on the Bathroom but it wasn't a problem. Staff was very Helpful.

Reviews.Title: “True W Experience”
Reviews.Author: Pat_Hillcrest
Reviews.Content: THe W is a unique brand of hotel and I hear some people knocking the way they do things. This should be a fun experience; a chance to feel hip, and a place to escape from the normal hotel structure. I love this place and prefer to stay at a W when ther is one around (there is not that many unless in a big city). I rarely travel for leisure so this is a great place to let loose. Plus you can't beat the location. I have not been to the other W in Chicago but the reviews sound simlar...I encourage people to navigate the website and leave preconceptions at the door. Some of us really need this kind of place in our life and I applaud the fact that they are doing somwthing different. Definately a step in the right direction for the hotel industry.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service-Front Desk and Management”
Reviews.Author: Sconnie617
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my "experience" at the W Lakeshore and I am less than pleased. Upon checkin we were not able to receive our key. Our trip was pre-paid for by my father-in-law as a birthday gift and our names were not on the reservation. His name was the only name on the reservation, due to a hotel error. Due to "security reasons" we could not check in until he contacted the hotel to give approval. Understandable to an extent, but again our names were not on the reservation due to a booking mistake. I was ok with this mistake when the lady at the desk bought us drinks while we waited to get a hold of my father-in-law (who is a lawyer who happened to be stuck in court). After enjoying a few drinks at the bar I walked through the lobby to find a bathroom and all of our bags (which had been unloaded out of my car by valet) were sitting in the middle of the lobby completely unattended. It was check-in time and there were at least 100 people in the lobby. Any number of things could have been stolen! I alerted the front desk of this and they asked me what I wanted them to do. The girl at the desk talked to me like I was not a real guest and stomped over to her manager and clearly seemed like I was asking her to do something out of the question. Her manager also acted like I was being out of line for asking for my bags to be stored. 3 hours later we were able to check into the room and waited over an hour to get our bags delivered to the room. At the end of our stay we ended up paying $48 a day for parking even though when we booked the room there was a promotion for free parking during our stay. The front desk asked me to "prove it," in exact words. Shouldn't they have record of their promotions that they advertise. Should the guest really need documentation? Again our trip was a gift we did not have any confirmation information with us, but the reason why we picked the hotel was because of the free parking promotion. On the website that we booked the room with it still lists the promotion which is still valid for a few more weeks!!!!! Overall totally incompetent snobby front desk and management that think that since they work somewhere nice means they can be snobs. News flash, our stay at their hotel cost more than their monthly paycheck! Our waitress was nice and the man who delivered our bags to our room was also nice, but they were the only exceptions! There are MUCH better places in Chicago to stay! I will never spend another penny at a W hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice, great location”
Reviews.Author: backstagebethy
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here during Lollapalooza over the weekend. I'd been worried about the bathroom situation (the little shutters as opposed to a door) but we didn't have any problems with that. We had booked through hotels.com so I was pleasantly surprised to get a room on the 27th (of 33) floor--I would have thought those would be given to more VIP guests. Obviously the location is wonderful; there were telescopes by the elevators so you could look out over Navy Pier and the lake, it was a quick walk to clubs, restaurants and shopping, and cabs were easy to come by. I was excited for the Acura car service but it only ran 12-8 so I never got to use that. I loved the Bliss bath products, but there was only one robe in the bathroom, which seemed odd. The staff was very helpful when we had questions, and while the breakfast I ordered from room service arrived quickly, it wasn't that great--definitely not worth all the surcharges tacked on to the already expensive price tag. We made use of the Starbucks and 7-11 down the block, as well as the parking lot that was $16/day cheaper than the hotel rate. I am not a luxury-hotel-type person, and I'll probably go back to my Hampton Inns after this, but it was definitely a fun splurge thanks to the hotels.com rate.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: 1catsmeow
Reviews.Content: We actually hotwired this hotel and were quite pleasantly surprised with the quality of the hotel we received for the price we paid - as well - we got a complementary upgrade to lake view. I highly recommend hotwire if you dont' mind taking a bit of a chance on location - although there are tips to find out the location before you commit.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: SavingCNotes
Reviews.Content: After reading lots of negative reviews about this hotel, one would think to go someplace else. Boy, were they wrong! We booked for a 3 night stay and everything went very well. The staff were very accomodative from the beginning to end and with a smile. Our room was a tad small w/ 2 kids in tow BUT the room looked nice and very clean. Did I forget to mention the FREE coffee, bottled water, and internet service at the hotel lobby? I did not see that dreaded $3 coffee from previous reviews. Hotel management must read these reviews and make adjustments. We prepaid at an awesome price and the hotel is close to eveything a tourists craves (beach, Navy Pier, Michigan Avenue, Water Tower). After putting the kids down for the evening, we decided to check out the night scene at the 2 hotel bars. Definitely not for "married w/ children" types BUT great for the "checkout that hottie" single crowd and a cool spot for people watching. This is what my wife and I did for the most part while sipping our drinks. In conclusion, I guess Forrest Gump was right after all. "Life is like a box of chocolates, you never know what you're gonna get". Take a chance and see you next time at the W.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, could be better”
Reviews.Author: bhighlande
Reviews.Content: This is definitely a hip hotel. The lobby is cool and inviting and while we were there Jamie Fox and some other entertainers were staying there. The fitness center is excellent and my wife and daughter utilized the Bliss spa and loved it. We were offered a 2:30pm late checkout. The rooms are very average at best. They are small and need to be updated. Our comforter and sheets had stains. The internet charge is $14.95! The concierge was not very helpful, nor friendly. But the worst thing about our stay was the traffic noise. We stayed on the 12th floor, in a lake view room, overlooking Lake Shore Drive. The traffic noise was terrible until all hours of the night. Would stay there again, but would have to be on a higher floor.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, hip hotel”
Reviews.Author: jennings
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the W in Los Angeles before and I think the Lakeshore Chicago is much brighter and seems much busier. I think the location has to be the best part, right across from the lake and Navy Pier. Access is easy via an underground tunnel just a few yards along the street (there is a road between the hotel and the lake). The lobby, bar and restaurant all overlook the lake with floor to ceiling glass doors allowing the light to flood in and the gorgeous views to be accessed from any point. There are seats where you can just sit and watch the world go by out the front as well as restaurant seating. I had breakfast in the restaurant, a smoked salmon "pizette". It was excellent and the coffee was great too. As a platinum SPG member I was upgraged to a suite. It was extremely "cool" and comfortable. Had a great living room, 2nd bathroom etc. The bedroom and ensuite bathroom were fantastic. (photo's attached). I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Chicago. Oops, almost forgot the BLISS spa! There is a Bliss spa located in the hotel. Wonderful treatments available. I love that you can have a massage or facial and go back to your room in your robe without having to get dressed or be seen by the general public!!

Reviews.Title: “A big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: kalepooki
Reviews.Content: W is my partner's favorite hotel, so for his birthday I thought I could not go wrong by choosing this hotel. What a disappointment. The hotel was busy, full of kids and teens, with very loud music. The walls of the rooms are paper thick and could not sleep for the first two nights from the noise. The lifts were dirty and full of finger marks, the tea pot was smudged with butter and the room was so dusty that after the first day we had to leave a note asking if the room could be cleaned. They had a DVD library service which we thought was quite good but took them over an hour to bring the DVD up. This W seem to be just selling the view, which is beautiful, and the brand. nothing else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, cool lobby area, worn out interiors and room only ok”
Reviews.Author: reportingfromupclose
Reviews.Content: Location (5/5): Off the lake.. close enough to Michigan etc Lobby (4/5): Nicely done, club like ambience, a little small though Other interiors (1/5): Very bad, corridoors smell of staleness and moistness and look worn out Room (3/5): Ok. Nothing special Service (3/5): Couple of interactions with the hotel staff weren't helpful (e.g., asking about nearby area, etc) Food (N/A): Didn't try

Reviews.Title: “All Fluff No Substance”
Reviews.Author: Jaunt
Reviews.Content: They may think a sliding door and shutters for the bathroom look nice, but they don't muffle the sound of the shower, sink or toilet so that the person in the room is always disturbed. Further dysfunction is achieved by the motion activated air conditioning. It only works if someone is moving in the room. We don't move much when we sleep so the a/c would shut off making the room excessively warm. Green is good, but not at the cost of a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tin888
Reviews.Content: I like the dark decoration in the room, kinda modern & trendy style. I also like the breakfast in hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The worse W Hotel EVER - Horrible”
Reviews.Author: nycib
Reviews.Content: With the exception of the lake view from my room(which has nothing to do with the hotel), I hated everything about this hotel. It is was noisy, kids running around, garbage bags and cleaning cart in the middle of the hallway on my floor all morning long ... not to mention they start knocking doors to clean at 8am if you forget the Do Not Disturb sign. I did not dare to order food. It took 20 minutes to get some coffee bags, not even a pot. A few other things. I am over 40 and look 40. I went up to the whiskey bar (roof top) where there were only 4 people sitting and having a drink. I was asked for an ID before the hello. The other place where you can have a drink is the lobby... it is a zoo. Vegas, cheap hotel lobby? You get the picture. I am used to W Hotels in New York. Chicago Lakshore' decor is OK... not even close, but only grown-ups should be allowed. Horrible. The worse W ever. I will NEVER go back and I split my time between NYC and Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “The "W" Really Should Be "Club W" Pick Another Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Holly_GolightlyUs
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a nice girls trip in Chicago during the winter, by all means skip this hotel. Our flight had us arrive about 8:00pm at the hotel on the Friday. We entered the hotel and the lobby was covered in people smoking and drinking and for a second we were so taken aback we couldnt find the check-in area. The people were sooo rude, we couldnt understand it. WE got to our incrrrrrrrrrrrredibly small room (with a nice view of the lake, I might add) but there was no where to put toiletries. The rooms have these awkward plantation [--] that close off the bathroom from the bedroom and unless u r with your husband that is a bit awkward from a privacy perspective. The "Whiskey Sky Bar" is on the top level of the hotel (which is pretty forgettable, is this really what people consider fun?) and guests of the hotel have to share the elevator with all of the patrons coming to the hotel to "get their drink on". Yuck, my girlfriend unfortunately was the recipient of someones cocktail when he misstepped and lost his balance in the elevator. The spa was forgettable expect for the showers in the spa -AWESOME!!! but they serve you no brownies like they said in the add and there is NO COFFEE in that dang blab place- AWEFULLLLLLLLLLL!!!! I complained and wrote a detailed letter, do you know what I got back, an invitation to try them again- on my dime. ARE YOU KIDDING......apologize, give me a partial refund or even invite me back for a reduced rate, but just ask to come back again. DO NOT GO THERE EVER!!! Unless you really need a drink and can't afford one. Then step on the elevator, I am sure you will taste someone's alcohol!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never again. Easily described as "urban cheap."”
Reviews.Author: cubsfan35
Reviews.Content: Thankfully, we did not spend much time at the hotel. The room was small - we got shafted with two full beds, rather than a queen, two queens or a king. The bathroom is part of the room with a wooden sliding door. The cable went in and out. Our card keys had to be replaced several times - your card is required to use one of the few elevators and for entry into the fitness area. The fitness center consists of some treadmills, ellipticals, bikes, a set of dumbbells and several machines. There is only one free-standing bench and the ceiling is too short to do any standing exercises. There are no vending machines, only $6/bottle Fuji waters in the room, among other snacks, and over-priced room service. The hotel's web site talks about "the moment when the sun sparkles through your window you awaken to the sky" - even the cheap window shade would not go up. Chicago is an amazing city - staying at the W Lakeshore was the only negative aspect of our trip. If you care to try another W, stay at the W Chicago - City Center, an incredibly different hotel experience than at the touristy, poor attempt at a modern hotel, Lakeshore location.

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel, but pricey.”
Reviews.Author: eyedoc614
Reviews.Content: Had my wedding here last summer and was overall very pleased. I agree with the previous poster concerning room blocks. our group was spread out over a few floors. The guest rooms are clean and modern. The hallways aren't nearly as dark as the W citycenter. The suites are great. Large living room, great walk-in shower and sweeping views of Lake Michigan.

Reviews.Title: “stink, stank, stunk!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: seiber95
Reviews.Content: We went to Chicago for my best friend's daughter's wedding. They reserved a block of 15 rooms. Now, my understanding is a block is a group of rooms on the same floor or at least within a few floors of each other. Not in this case. NO ONE was on the same floor! Not the bride & her bridesmaids, not the groom & his groomsmen, not the family, nor friends! Before our arrival, the mother of the bride had requested coffee pots be in 3 of the rooms...ours, the grandparents, an uncle. This was confirmed in a email, there would be coffee pots upon check-in. NOT! The morning after our first night there, we called again to request a coffee pot. An hour later a gentleman arrived with a fresh pot of coffee stating he was sorry for the inconveniece and would get us a room coffeemaker ASAP. It finally arrived about dinner time. The bride had made "welcome gifts" for her wedding party that were to be placed in their rooms upon check-in. The hotel stated they would be happy to deliver, but there would be a $4 charge per item. No problem. However, while in the lobby, the bride noticed a man checking out that had, not one, but two of her welcome gifts! He was NOT a member of the wedding party! But she was sure charged for delivery! During booking, the mother of the bride had booked 2 Acura's for transportation purposes to the wedding. This too was confirmed by the hotel in an email. The day of the wedding, we called to confirm our Acura reservation and was told "we don't have you down and we can't help you at this time." We then asked if they could call and get us 4 van taxi's for 5:00 as the wedding was to start at 5:30. They stated they would call right away. We went downstairs...no van taxis. Upon questioning the front desk we were told, "uh, well, we called. Sorry...." OH MY GOD!!!! The hotel is quite beautiful but the service STINKS!!! They don't even try to fix what is "broken". They act as though they could care less if you are happy or not.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vibe - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nycadman
Reviews.Content: Vibe of hotel is great. Love the chairs outside looking over the lake. Bars, upstairs and downstairs are both very W -- which is cool and trendy. Rooms are clean and updated. Highly recommend the hotel. My fave in the city (at this point).

Reviews.Title: “Best W in the Midwest”
Reviews.Author: MCohen
Reviews.Content: W Lakeshore is a great place to stay in Chicago especially during summer across from the beach! As a Gold SPG member, I always got a suite and late check out. Though the rooms could use some remodeling the staff and views are fantastic. From the GM to the room service, the staff is great. Bliss is great.

Reviews.Title: “Old Holiday Inn turned into a W and it shows”
Reviews.Author: jdjhughes
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the weekend to celebrate anniversary without traveling far. We always stay at Starwood properties and we got a great winter rate here so we thought why not. The lobby is well designed, large and comfortable. Unfortunately, the rest of the hotel isn't. The hallways are dark and confining and the rooms leave much to be desired. While I realize this used to be a budget hotel that the remodeled, it felt like it. The ceilings still had that popcorn stuff on it and the carpet felt worn and dirty. The bathrooms are small but nice and of course you have the great Bliss amenities. If you have a room on the lakeside of the tower you do have a nice view that many hotels in Chicago cannot offer. The one really great plus was the front desk. They found out it was our anniversary and when we returned from dinner they had a bottle of champagne and strawberries in our room. Nice champagne too, $125 on the room service menu. That was impressive. If you are going to Chicago and want to stay in a Starwood hotel or W the Westin River North and W Chicago City Center are better choices.

Reviews.Title: “The View Restaurant was terrible & the room was noisy”
Reviews.Author: 3nonblondes_9
Reviews.Content: The View restaurant served the most horrible wine for $18/glass. I first tried the Pinor Noir, but it was horrible, so I switched to the equally disappointing Cab. Randy Gerber should be embarrassed to have his name associated with this place. I stayed at the hotel for 2 nights and there were glasses piled up outside the door adjacent to mine until the time I checked out. It was difficult sleeping because of the continuous overnight noise from Lakeshore Dr.

Reviews.Title: “Once is enough, thank you.”
Reviews.Author: NewMexicoSW_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I tried this place because I'm in Chicago on business all the time and wanted something different. The hotel has a very contemporary feel and is a little trendy. I found the staff generally helpful. The rooms were spacious and well kept, but I was put off by the $9.00 bottle of water by my bedside and the relatively high prices for room service. I chose to eat out mostly. The business center was nice once I finally found it, and the hotel seemed to be a pretty popular choice. The security after dark was a little annoying, asking everyone for their room keys before even letting you into the lobby (and this was at 7:00 pm). You need room keys just to go anywhere on the elevators anyway, so I thought this was a little excessive and made me wonder about their clientele. It was a clean hotel and a decent choice, but there are definitely better hotels downtown for the value.

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel - Staff is great!”
Reviews.Author: JennieIndy
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago for business and spent an entire week at the hotel - I must say that my stay was great. Once the long day at the office was done - I walked everywhere. The staff was very helpful..the wakeup calls were on time, and my car was delivered to me at the door within minutes! Paying for parking and the internet is a given in downtown - but the view of the lake and the comfortable bed was wonderful! My Brit and Scots business partners love the W........next time I plan to stay longer and use the spa.

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: kjve9876
Reviews.Content: This trendy hotel is very nice to look at and the rooms are cool but the staff does not care about customer satisfaction. The suits are not worth the price but the spa is outstanding. NEVER host a party there, the cost is very high and the service is horrible.

Reviews.Title: “W Lakeshore is my favorite hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Airbound13
